title: Very good pub
comment: We had my Mum's wake at this pub, 31st Jan, just opposite the Crematorium. The staff were really good, the food was very good and lots of it, and the pub it self was very good. I can't fault this place, and I am very grateful that we went there.

title: As soon as we walked in...
comment: As with other reviewers here, we booked the Woodman as a venue for a reception following my mother's funeral. I had inquired at other places but the welcome here was so warm and professional that there could be no other choice. The owners could not have been more accommodating and they understood exactly the sort of occasion we wanted to create. In the end we were slightly oversubscribed but it was absolutely no problem and the staff coped admirably. Heartily recommended.

title: Excellent Small Family Run Pub
comment: We visited this lovely pub before going for a walk around Ruislip Lido. The atmosphere was warm and inviting and the staff very friendly. The food, especially the Haddock in batter and the large scampi was amazing - apparently locally sourced from a wet fishmonger. Prices were fair and we enjoyed our lunch. We will visit again as it it is relatively local to where we live.

title: Such a lovely friendly family
comment: Such a lovely friendly family pub! Food is amazing! Highly recommend Fish n Chips! Such a nice little venue for a cozy lunch :) And dogs are welcome too

title: Staff couldn't have been more helpful
comment: I hadn't read any reviews prior to booking The Woodman for a wake, so all I can do is reiterate previous ones and say how good everything was - from the very first contact, to sending us off with doggy bags at the very end - it couldn't have been better or the staff kinder or more welcoming, professional but friendly too. Would definitely recommend!

title: Post funeral reception
comment: What a lovely place to have Mum's wake, from the initial enquiry phone call we made to us leaving the venue the staff couldn't have been more helpful and informative. A lovely private room with it's own bar and toilets. The buffett food was fantastic, lots of choice and labeled for the vegetarians. Would highly recommend, at such a difficult time The Woodman made that part of our day run smoothly and without stress, thank you all. Joanne and Simon

title: I wished I was dead
comment: This pub caters primarily for the dead - that's to say for funeral parties from the nearby crematorium. These gatherings take over the entire lounge bar leaving only the public bar for other customers. The small public bar has a dart board, fruit machine, and, when I visited, a group of loud-mouthed, shaven-headed, heavily tattooed, young men "effing and blinding" copiously. There are only three tables, two of which were occupied by old men reading the Racing Post and listening to horse-racing commentaries, while the third was taken-up by a couple with a dog.  I abandoned the idea of having lunch here, drank my beer as quickly as possible, and drove to Wetherspoons at Ruislip Manor where, fortunately, they have sufficient tables to accommodate their customers as well as a wider choice of beer and food at cheaper prices. It's no wonder so many pubs are closing down.

title: Drinks
comment: Popped in for a drink and a snack, fabulous pub inside and out, staff are amazing so welcoming and friendly will be going back again

title: A great little pub
comment: Met friends at the woodman. The covid menu is simple but well presented. They have taken every covid precaution that you can think of. Masks to be worn unless sat at a table. The outdoor area has overhead cover and heaters at every seated area. The staff are friendly and attentive. Will visit again.

title: Brilliant real pub
comment: I love this pub. Its one of the very few traditional pubs left around. The owner and staff do everything possible to accommodate you and make sure you have an enjoyable time. The toilets are really clean.  Food is good. Everything is reasonably priced. The garden outside is lovely.  I would highly recommend

title: Lovely cakes
comment: Besides the fact that the food is great it is a very cosy place. Staff are very friendly and you should definitely try a dessert.

title: First time we had Polish food! What a treat!!!
comment: A friend took us here, since we wanted to try his native cuisine. And what a treat!!! Started out with Polish Beers and Czech lager with our first course, 3 different kinds of dumplings and loved them all! Next up Blini, Steak Tatar, and Goat Cheese salad -- all of it so delicious! This was our first time trying Steak Tatar, and loved it! Our entrees were incredible as well! I had the chicken escalopes which included a plate full of lovely roasted vegetables. The chicken was absolutely amazing! My husband had the beef tenderloin which also included a plate full of lovely roasted vegetables. This dish was also amazing, cooked to perfection as requested by husband. Our friend had the half duck. We all thought this dish was a bit dry. This was the only less than perfect dish we had. We left after selecting a few chocolates from the bakery. I am not exaggerating when I say these had to have been the BEST chocolates I have ever had - and I have had chocolates from all over the world. The staff was friendly, the food absolutely amazing! I only wish we had tried Sowa much sooner. Would love to come back soon!

title: So disappointed, it’s upsetting 😢
comment: The family and I have been going to Great Fosters for about ten years now. We've always loved everything about the place, to the extent that my wife and I got married there a few years ago.  We periodically visit for romantic meals, family gatherings and our favourite; Afternoon Tea. We haven't been since December due to the dreaded lockdown, and we thought we’d treat ourselves for an Afternoon Tea this afternoon. But honestly, I wish we hadn't bothered! The sandwiches were nothing special, the scones have shrunk and lost their signature flavour and the cakes we're just boring! The brownie even had a smell of other cooking. Plus I was paying more than I'd previous times! I'm happy with inflation, but I’d expect a consistent experience! I'd rather go to the Runnymede just a few minutes away for much better value for money, even if the ambience isn't quite the same. It wasn’t all bad, the service is still exceptional and the tea presentation was just as lovely as always, but it’s just such a shame that you’re paying more for a lesser product. I will visit again in the future, but if anyone from Great Fosters reads this, please look into this as I was so disappointed!

title: DISAPPOINTING
comment: Unhygienic conditions of food preparation storage and display! Food delivered by a strongly smelling service personnel with strong makeup including unhygienic plastic long nails with hair all over the food and all preparation areas!

title: So so not to bad
comment: Hello Visited last Sunday.  Food not bad. Small portion and quite expensive as Polish restaurant.  Żurek soup was good but should be served in a proper style in bread.

title: Afternoon tea at Great Fosters
comment: We have had afternoon tea at Great Fosters several times and were expecting the high quality tea and service we enjoyed in the past. The quality and quantity of the food was very disappointing. There was an uninspiring selection of sandwiches and the quantity was measily. We asked for more sandwiches ( in the past they were offered). None came, so we asked about their progress and were told that they had 10 covers for afternoon tea and preparing it all was taking time. The sandwiches never arrived. The scones had been miniaturised and were hard. The cakes were very nice and the room we occupied was good. The service was very much on an on demand basis, no pro- active follow up to see if everything was ok or whether we needed any more tea (which we did). Not value for money and not comparable with the Runnymede.

title: Disappointing afternoon tea
comment: We are regulars at Great Fosters, having also had our wedding reception here. The quality of the food (whether it be afternoon tea, the Tudor Room or the Estate Grill) has always been excellent. We came today for afternoon tea for my great aunt’s birthday and were extremely disappointed. I won’t upload pictures because our cakes were exactly the same as those posted below - essentially all the same with just different flavour toppings. The scones seem to have been miniaturised despite the increase in price and gone are the refills. The quality was drastically reduced from our previous visit. Whilst Great Fosters has been redecorated under the ownership of Alexander Hotels, this has resulted in it losing it’s charm. We had been concerned about this change in ownership and were proved right today.  We couldn’t fault our host (Casper), who was lovely but would definitely think twice before we book again. At present, Great Fosters cannot compete with either Coworth Park or The Runnymede for the quality of food and atmosphere which is a shame as it had always been our top choice locally.

title: Post funeral reception
comment: We booked the Woodman because it was a convenient venue after my mums funeral at Breakspear Crematorium... Little did we know what a perfect find it would turn out to be! The staff (especially Dale) were amazing. Kind and considerate at such a difficult time. The food was plentiful and delicious and the private room cozy and welcoming.  We would highly recommend this lovely pub!!!  Maggie, Ken and family

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Had afternoon tea here, having been here twice before I hoped it would be the same. Tea was served without milk, scones were smaller and the cakes weren’t as good as before. When asking a waitress twice a query she never returned & when paying the bill we were accidentally overcharged. The gardens were covered in dog poo which isn’t very nice. We had a good welcome but won’t be returning as it needs to massively improve.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: The good; great friendly staff and amazing setting, from there it ends. For £35 plus 12.5% tip; given 4 finger sandwiches, 3 cakes and a scone with no refills is not what I expect. I’ve been before and endless refills were supplied. The cakes and scones were bone dry: the sandwiches were very nice just not enough.  Don’t waste your money for afternoon tea.

title: Afternoon Tea. Lovely setting but disappointing
comment: Oh dear! Similar to other reviews, the expectations were high but the outcome low.  The reality of the food was a small, almost amateur affair. Nothing in comparison to the pictures that caused us to book there in the first place. Tea choices were non existent and no top up offered on food and drink. I will give the staff a break in these post COVID times, but felt a little pressured to sit outside rather than in the cooler indoors. For the price point, there are much better alternatives. However, the grounds were lovely for photos.

title: Lovely cakes
comment: I saw these guys are open and have been in a couple of times recently for takeaway cakes. The traditional cheesecake is particularly good and for about £2.50 you get a very generous portion. Excellent quality and value.

title: Is this afternoon tea worth £70?
comment: We have been regular visitors to Great Fosters for their amazing afternoon teas for the past 10 years and never had a complaint  We visited this week and will never go back We had so looked forward our visit post  shielding but the whole experience was an absolute farce. Our waitress was not welcoming at all and in fact she couldn’t understand us and we couldn’t understand her. We had to point out our reservation on her guest sheet as she couldn’t see it. We ordered as soon as we were seated and waited 30 mins for one tea and one coffee. Our food took another 15 minutes! Difficult to understand why as no cooking involved and there were several empty tables To say we were disappointed with the food that arrived is an understatement. Please see the photos provided and decide whether that is worth £70 plus a service charge of £8.25 The cakes were dry and basically looked shop bought and the scones were hard. The hotel website and their facebook page advertise their afternoon tea with photos of the most beautiful cakes, pastries and sandwiches which are very superior to those that we were served We previously spoke to friends about Great Fosters cakes as being “works of art “ but these were shameful  The table next to us requested fresh tea and had to ask twice more before it arrived 30 minutes later. We asked to speak to someone in charge before we left but were told the manager was in a meeting, but would telephone us Two days later and still waiting we emailed the head office but no response from them either. What an absolute shame that this once wonderful hotel has no interest in customer service and after reading management responses to other negative experiences on here,we realise they have no interest in trying to improve.

title: Very good restaurant and cafe
comment: We visit the Restaurant after one year again and we are very happy the quality not change. Very good eat and very cookis and lovely sweet thinkings.  And the rate is also perfect. We live now in Düsseldorf Germany and.

title: Cozy Restaurant
comment: Had an enjoyable evening meal at the Restaurant one Saturday. I'm no connoisseur of Polish food, so I cannot vouch for its authenticity here except to say that the Pierogies and the duck dish were well cooked and delicious. Reasonably priced with good portions. Staff were attentive but not initially overly friendly. Simple deco and being a small restaurant with the tables arranged close to each other, it did not feel crowded. Recommended.

title: Poor service
comment: Very well presented premise looking really promising but let down by the poor customer service. Took my visiting family for patisseries and hot chocolates. We were made to wait at the counter despite the being the only ones there at the time. I found myself having to repeat my requests and queries and trying to be extra pleasant in the hope of a more welcoming assistance. Service was hostile and off putting to say the least but I didn’t let it deter me from trying to enjoy what seemed to be some really nicely presented patisseries. Unfortunately some of the slices were a bit on the dry side. Not what should be expected when you pay more than £35 on 2 small hot chocolates, 4 slices of cakes and 2 x sodas. Great shame looked so promising. Will not be returning.

title: Mixed feelings
comment: 3 stars awarded for the gardens. I Visited today for afternoon tea with my mum. Stunning setting and grounds, an incredibly historic building with so much character.  The staff were courteous but not particularly attentive.  The afternoon tea was .... ok, mediocre compared to others I have had previously. The bread was not fresh, seemed stale, and we informed the waitress who brought some more sandwiches. The fillings were a bit frugal, the scones were small and not cooked in the middle. The pastries were disappointing.  We walked around the stunning grounds but the one spoiler was the amount of dog's mess on the lawns, very shocking. Glad I went but there is a lot that could be improved upon for a 5 star hotel and the prices they charged £78 including a 12.5% service charge for a mediocre service.

title: Don’t go with kids
comment: Went with my husband and children. I asked for a cake that would be suitable for the children. When I tasted it, it tasted alcoholic. It was! Apparently all the cakes are! We should have been offered our money back really as we did ask specifically. There were no suitable drinks for kids. It’s probably ok to visit without kids.

title: Dog friendly
comment: The Woodman is a cosy freindly traditional pub. Dog friendly inside and out. Great friendly staff and certainly worth a visit.

title: Great pub, lovely staff and food
comment: We had lunch at the woodman and it was fabulous, despite it being a regulars pub everyone is treated the same Ian’s the regulars are super friendly which makes for a comfortable environment  Prices for food reasonable and portion size good, this place prides itself on good wine and beer and the wine doesn’t disappoint.  I can not recommend Highly enough and look forward to returning soon

title: First class
comment: We used The Woodman as the venue for family and friends to meet after a service at the crematorium and the staff really were first class. They made us feel welcome and provided excellent service at this sad time. They catered really well for a lactose intolerant family member and ensured all our needs were met from the first phone call to the service they provided on the day. I can't thank them enough.

title: Kathy was amazing
comment: An amazing evening with great bar staff, Kathy has been attentive and helpful. I recommend this local pub with great drinks and an awesome ambiance, the locals were really friendly and great fun!

title: Great local pub
comment: I have been visiting this pub for nearly twenty years, Thursday evenings, to play cribbage in the public bar and enjoy a quality beer or two. Sometimes also Sunday evenings. I rarely go to any other pubs. The beer here is always tremendous. Great selection of real ales, always in top condition. I understand they have just won a major award relating to the beers provided. This is a top quality place. Kathy, who serves us in these evenings is so friendly, helpful and efficient. A lovely person.  My decision to write this post was prompted by the wake we had there today, following the recent death of my mum. From first contact via phone the Woodman made the process so easy. The bar was well presented, set out exclusively for our party and the food was plentiful, varied and delicious. Gemma and Steve deserve enormous credit for running such a fine establishment. They have created a great environment, always welcoming and the regulars attending reflect this as well, being a really good bunch of people.

title: Elevensees
comment: Was in the area so stoped off with my mum for elevensees. Beautiful place - look at all the stunning flowers. We had coffee and biscuits and it was lovely. They have excellent menu too. Very very dog friendly inside and out. We have just found out they do breakfast sandwiches too. Well worth visit whatever the time of day

title: Great food at a good price
comment: We enjoyed a tasty meal at a reasonable price, particularly enjoyed the pierogies and also the lovely desserts from the Polish patisserie next door. A great find and glad we booked as it was busy whilst we were there (early Saturday evening).

title: Excellent
comment: Our second visit to The Woodman and what a difference to our first time here.Last time we were not impressed with the ploughmans that we were served.This time,I tried the ploughmans again and it was excellent.My wife had the fish and chips and she really enjoyed it.Due to my last review,I was asked to contact them and when I did their customer service was really outstanding.They have a good selection of Ales and I would recommend the Golden.The staff were very friendly and welcoming.

title: Perfect venue for a wake.
comment: The Woodman was perfect venue for a get together after my husbands funeral the staff couldn’t be more accommodating and kind on a very difficult and sad occasion.  Just a couple of minutes walk from the crematorium they had prepared the room just as we asked with photos and a slideshow on the television. The buffet was varied and tasty guests were impressed with the choices they even arranged to cook plenty of my husbands favourite sausages for the guests, which brought a smile to many a face as they tucked in.  It has a lovely outdoor garden where some guests took a few moments to compose themselves in peace and quiet it was a welcome refuge.  So thanks to Steve and all the team at the Woodman .

title: Probably the best pub in the area
comment: We have been coming to this pub for many years - usually once or twice a month after a walk along the canal at Harefield. We have always been made to feel very welcome by all the staff. We would like to come more often (especially as we are within walking distance), unfortunately whenever we make plans to go there for a beer - something else crops up. We have never eaten a meal here, but have had their sandwiches many times. They are always freshly made. The beer is also very good and well kept, and they have a guest beer on now and then which is usually very good too. We must try harder to visit them more often!

title: Funeral catering at The Woodman Ruislip
comment: Great small venue. Very convenient. Welcoming staff who did a very nice breakfast style finger buffet. Everyone loved it. Spot on Gemma and team thank you!

title: Outstanding service following funeral
comment: Louise helped organise catering for family and friends following my mother-in-law's funeral at Breakspear Crematorium. She was so lovely and gentle with grieving father-in-law as we made the arrangements, nothing was too much trouble and we were eased through the booking at a difficult time. Food was plentiful, beautifully laid out and delicious. Drinks were waiting as people arrived and bar tab was managed tactfully. Constantly checked in with me that I was happy with service and if I needed anything. This is a Gold Star service at a stressful time. Pub was spotless, they helped with displaying photos for us and were on hand the whole time. Thank you all so much Louise, Del and team

title: Wake
comment: Would like to thank The Woodeman, Ruislip held my mums wake there today 26th March they put on a lovely spread of food and made us very welcome . From when I first booked it until today kept in contact and nothing was too small for them with anything we wanted. Thank you A Curle

title: Made our day a little brighter
comment: My wife and I booked this pub for her father's wake, from the initial phone call I made until the moment we left the staff were helpful, friendly and professional. They did a wonderful spread with hot and cold finger-food, homemade sandwiches homemade cakes and fresh fruit, all tasty and well presented. The bar was well served, the prices were reasonable and the beer was good. My mother-in-law uses a wheelchair, they had a ramp ready for her to access the bar and the toilets had plenty of room for her and an assistant. The place was spotless. Louise and her team managed to help make a very sad day just that little bit brighter, many thanks, Ian and Deb

title: Excellent traditional pub
comment: We came across this pub after having been to a funeral-it is opposite the crematorium.The pub has two bars and plenty of outside seating, and is spotlessly clean!Bar staff were very friendly and I enjoyed a perfectly served pint of Timothy Taylor Landlord bitter.I had a cheese/pickle sandwich which was very fresh and tasty.This is a great traditional pub and we hope to return there soon.

title: After the Crem
comment: Just across the road from Breakspear Crematorium, The Woodman provided an ideal venue for a gathering of family and friends, following the cremation service. The staff were extremely helpful, providing delicious foods and providing for the special diets of a few guests (vegan and egg-free) without any fuss. It was so helpful for us to know that the catering was all taken care of, especially as none of us live nearby. The venue was comfortable, welcoming and homely. It was great to be able to display photos and to have pictures from a memory stick and power point shown on a large screen. I left an item at the pub which was posted back to me as soon as I'd asked about it. I would certainly recommend The Woodman as a venue for gatherings after the Crematorium. Thank you.

title: A wonderful team!
comment: The team at the Woodman were fantastic! A beautiful venue - I can't thank them enough for their support and kindness at such a sad time. Very professional. The buffet was delightful and dietary needs were catered for.

title: A delightfull afternoon tea
comment: We were a party of five and decided to go to Great Fosters for afternoon tea, I had a conversation with Prem the manager to ask if we could have all finger sandwiches, as well as scones and cakes, as I knew that they served also buns and baguettes and he obliged us by serving all finger sandwiches as wells as scones and cakes which were delicious. The staff were very attentive and friendly. We very much enjoyed the lovely gardens and stayed for a cocktail on the terrace as it was a very hot day. Our afternoon was enjoyed by all and we will definitely return.

title: Yummy
comment: So, to start off my review, let me just say: they make their own Pierogi dough and fillings(If you are unaware what pierogi is, it’s a type of Polish dumpling that comes with different fillings-more traditionally cottage cheese and onion, but for those not so orthodox they also come with meat, or as a sweet version, you can have them with strawberries inside topped with cream and sugar-and it looks a bit like this . ) the dough they make is soft and perfectly like what a pierogi should taste like. They also include a range of cakes more delicious than you have ever tasted. They have a set menu and a delicious soup of the day. They also include a range of vegetarian food. The restaurant looks beautiful and the seats are very comfortable. Honestly, the food here was the best food I have ever had in London. Thanks for reading my review.

title: Delicious
comment: Very pleasant place to have some of the finest polish dishes. Well recommended. To start with we choose sour soup, which was served in a very presentable way and it tasted even better than expected. We tried the beef rolls- beautifully cook, served with dumplings. That was very delicious dinner and we will definitely come back to try some more.

title: Service with empathy and a smile might help!
comment: We have been to this restaurant and patisserie a few times as we enjoy the distinctive menu and change of culture.However on this occasion we simply had coffee and cakes. Whilst the decaf coffee was excellent,the cakes were disappointing and did not live up to expectations. The comment was met with complete disinterest. It is also important to note that a 12.5% service charge is automatically added which makes such a pop-in treat very expensive.

title: Awesome
comment: We visited one Sunday evening. A very smart restaurant with quite a limited menu. The food was amazing, the beer cold and the wine was good. Excellent value.

title: Perfect
comment: We loved it. Delicious food and prudent service. Offered a variety of cold polish beers. Nice atmosphere. Thx!!!

title: Staff are rude
comment: It was Saturday evening and the restaurant was half empty. So myself and a friend figured we'd have a drink some nibbles and dessert. The waitress reluctantly seated us, after having told us everything was reserved. As we sat - to make a decision on everything we were ordering we asked if we could also see a dessert menu. She very rudely replied the patisserie is closed and walked away. We walked out and sat across the road at a restaurant. I could see into Sowa, and the tables they had 'reserved' were empty for more than 2 hours (it was 10 pm!!!).  Quite frankly, I don't know if she was racist or assumed based on our young looks that we were children - perhaps a combination of both! As Drs, we don't earn our money to then be judged whilst trying to sit in a restaurant and spend our money. I used to buy cakes from there for work, but I can't see myself going back nor would I recommend it to anyone.

title: Great restaurant
comment: Very stylish restaurant with good choice of tasty food and drinks served beautifully. Friendly staff, would recommend :)

title: Great quality and value
comment: We came in for coffee and cake. They do perhaps 20 types of cake by the slice including several baked cheesecakes. I can recommend Grandma's cheesecake with chocolate and cherries. The coffee is very nice too plus the staff are very friendly.

title: Ukrainian friend approved
comment: We had some visitors from the US staying and the guy who was Ukrainian by birth wanted some decent Polish food. So, we walked into here and were immediately offered a comfortable table in the corner.   One of the unique distinguishing factors about this place, is that in the middle of the room in a clear glass booth there is a lady constantly making fresh pierogies. So naturally we had to try them. But not before we tried the fresh chanterelle soup which was unanimously declared delicious.  The pierogies themselves were boiled rather than fried but the contents were delicious. Combine this with a constant flow of very chilled beer in frozen tankards and incredibly decadent desserts and you have a winning combination.  Our visitor was very pleased and we all left satisfied.

title: super jedzenie. chamska kelnerka
comment: as always I loved the food. pierogi 1class as well as soups. also loved the main (schabowy) but.... again the waitresses were disaster. they believe they are Victoria secret models and can just look fab whereas have no clues about customer service

title: Good food......
comment: My second visit at Sowa..... Friendly service and busy Sunday night.... Good atmosphere  The wild boar neck was a bit dry and need more sauce Very good chocolate pralines but small portion  Place to go at ealing..... Thank you at all the team.....

title: Disappointing and expensive
comment: The menu given to us on the day was out of date. The website still shows picture of previous years' afternoon teas. Service was slow and having to ask to remind waitresses to bring required food item. Glass of champagne as advertised turned out to be barely a half glass, considering the charge is £16.00 for a glass Fingers sandwiches were small buns, with a particularly difficult to chew coronation chicken baguette, and a somewhat indifferent and soggy cucumber roulade.  Fancy cakes did look nice, however some of the tastes and texture did not up to expectation. The room had no atmosphere, felt very silent at time and no background music, no flowers on table. Our party was three people and only two portions of jam and cream were served withe the scones, which we had to mention and took ages to arrive. I have been to Great Fosters teas before and have always been delighted with the experience. This is not the case this time.

title: New managers ruining this hotel
comment: I am just messaging to say how disappointed my family were today with afternoon tea. For many years we have been coming to great fosters for meals/afternoon tea to celebrate birthdays ect. However in the last few months on both occasions we have been let down. Firstly in April when we came for the Easter wreath workshop. The Easter wreath workshop was lovely but the meal included was disappointing. We had ordered our meals but my godmothers order had been taken down incorrectly. We had got our steaks but were waiting for the chips before starting to eat. Then a waiter came out and said he had my godmothers down as salmon. He took her steak away and gave to another client and then gave her salmon. My godmother had ordered steak but did not want to make a fuss. This is awful customer service and you would not expect this at a four star hotel. Who takes a dish from a customer to give to another customer because they have mucked up the orders? Furthermore the steak I had was cold.  Now today we received poor service for our afternoon tea. Not the service we had been used to. Firstly the service was slow and then when the tea arrived it was strong and stewed. We had to ask for extra hot water. Then we had to ask for extra sandwiches and even then was told I couldn’t have a cucumber one. Whereas before we were always offered an abundance of extra sandwiches. Also the sandwiches were dry and the coronation chicken one came in a tough roll which required to be gnawed at.  We also had to ask for fresh plates post savoury for our sweets.- when normally waiters would instinctively offer fresh plates because who wants to eat a scone of a plate smeared in coronation chicken. We also had to ask to take home the cakes and were given brown boxes where we had to put them in. Whereas previously we would have been asked if we would like to take them home and they would have been whisked off to kitchen and then they came back in lovely pink great fosters boxes with handles.  We were never offered extra tea or asked if we wanted more drinks.  Also there was no one at the door on arrival to help us through the door and direct us. There were 3 young men as we left who were more concerned with themselves then their duties.  We were used to attentive good service at great fosters but now that is not the case. Seems the new managers care little for customer service and are pleased with the changes they have made. As the response I recieved from a feedback email was ‘We have made changes to the afternoon tea in itself which we are happy with and for which we have received some lovely feedback’. Who is giving feedback I do not know.  Do not visit here as the new managers have ruined the once prestigious reputation that GF used to uphold.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: We visited Great Fosters yesterday for afternoon tea. Great Fosters has been one of our favourite hotels for many years. However our experience yesterday was very disappointing. The high standards of service that we have received in the past are gone. We waited a long time to be served, the tea when it eventually arrived was stewed and had to request additional pots of tea and clean cups and plates. There was no offer of additional sandwiches as in the past and no Victoria sponge and not value for money. Service was slow and the staff not attentive. In addition the changes to the decor are not sympathetic to the age and feel of an historic building. The new reception area sticks out like a sore thumb in a once beautiful great hall. Alexander Hotels you are ruining a stunning ancient building, ripping the soul out of it. If I wanted corporate I would go elsewhere. You need to up your game,

title: Amazing afternoon tea
comment: We were brought here by friends and were very impressed at both the building and the tea, unfortunately the weather was against us so we couldn’t explore the gardens but what we saw from the windows looked great, the actual tea was wonderful, we phoned prior to our visit to see if they could change our order slightly and they duly obliged, wonderful selection and the service was exemplary

title: A fitting way to celebrate my Milestone Birthday
comment: I celebrated a milestone birthday and as my best friend couldn't come for the main celebrations we treated ourselves to a Champagne Afternoon Tea which was amazing. I had gone there a couple of days before our treat, as I originally booked the table inside but as the forecast was promising, I thought it would be nice to sit by the water and take in the spectacular views of the gardens. I happened to mention to the Reception Manager in passing that I was celebrating a rather special birthday a week before our visit. Our arrival was amazing (I did have a Chauffeur take us there) and we were warmly welcomed and seated by the water and in some shade. The Afternoon Tea was amazing, my friend was so impressed but she has never been for Afternoon Tea before, whereas I have enjoyed Afternoon Tea throughout the world but Great Fosters did me proud. Olivia, our (lovely) waitress asked when we would like our glass of Champagne. We had it served early on and then ordered another two glasses. We very much enjoyed the selection of sandwiches and cakes although took a lot of the cakes with us, much to the delight of my Partner. I was very touched when Olivia brought a beautiful plate with a little birthday cake on it. It could only have come from the Reception Manager who I mentioned it to in conversation several days before. I will certainly take my Partner there for his upcoming birthday.

title: Afternoon tea gone downhill
comment: Have been here for afternoon tea a number of times in the past when it was a luxurious experience. went recently and it has become overpriced, poor value for money . To start by saying ‘we no longer offer extra sandwiches ‘ kind of sets the tone !

title: Personal service
comment: We recently held a Wake at the Woodman. From our initial visit the staff were extremely kind and helpful. They carefully explained the options and did everything we asked, taking care to allow us to make the event personal to our family. We never felt pressured into purchasing anything we did not want. The buffet on the day was excellent and the staff were very helpful. We had plenty of time together as a family in the venue. We would thoroughly recommend the Woodman.

title: Summer high tea
comment: Beautiful historic building and perfectly manicured gardens. Travel back in time for a royal experience in warm English sunshine. Very good service. Well presented high tea. Excellent food and large tea selection.

title: Thank you!
comment: We recently held my mother's wake at The Woodman and cannot praise the owner and staff enough for their kindness and consideration. Every detail was taken care of, from providing our choice of music, ability to screen a slideshow on the TV, and an excellent buffet with unlimited tea and coffee. It's a traditional Pub with many real ales and a great menu for dining, you don't have to have a Wake just to visit! Once again my thanks to all.

title: Best Pub EVER!!!
comment: Visited the Woodman for food and drinks with friends, really great staff and fantastic food. Would recommend highly!

title: The Great Fosters Used to Be Great but Not Anymore
comment: The Great Fosters used to be great but not any more. We visited today for a friend's birthday but left feeling sorely disappointed and ripped off. The price of afternoon tea had increased from £27 to £37 and consisted of five finger sandwiches (equal to about two and a half slices of bread), two scones with cream and jam and a few miniature patisseries. The tea was unlimited but this was little consolation. The service was also well below par. When we were seated initially, we were told in no uncertain terms that our time was limited to two hours. Great start to the afternoon! When we asked for extra sandwiches, our request was ignored. One member of our party didn't receive her pot of tea and, when we asked the waiter for it, we watched him go out into the foyer and flap his arms in a temper. One member of our party is vegetarian and another allergic to nuts, however, when the food arrived, the two special orders had been combined as one and given to the vegetarian. This meant that the lady with a nut allergy was given food that could have caused a severe allergic reaction. Just not good enough! The place has also recently been redecorated and, in our opinion, has now lost all it's historical charm and quaintness. The appeal of this place used to be that it felt like you were stepping back in time when you visited. Now it resembles any other characterless run of the mill hotel. We definitely will not be visiting again.

title: Don’t go, especially for afternoon tea!
comment: I’ve been for afternoon tea three times at this restaurant; three years ago, it was excellent; at the end of last summer, it was ok; and last week, it was awful. Stale sandwiches, no extra sandwiches, cakes ok but blatantly everything has been cut back. Service was like Faulty Towers. It took over 45 mins for our tea to arrive and then we had to chase (even going up to the bar twice to get some service). We were not the only ones. This hotel is in a fine location, is absolutely beautiful and it is such a shame that it’s been sold by the family who owned it and ran it superbly for many years. It used to be a class act; now it is one to be avoided at all costs. Truly disappointing.

title: Afternoon tea has changed! :(
comment: The afternoon tea has changed - no extra sandwiches, no victoria cream sponge - its been cutback and the price has gone up! Not the place to go to for this price - Pennyhill Park is only £3 more and there are cheaper options like the Runnymede. Hopefully the Great Fosters team will see this is not good value anymore, and the 'extra mile' needs to come back!

title: Afternoon tea
comment: Having been to Great Fosters for some wonderful afternoon teas, this was my first visit since the new company took over. What a disappointment! Firstly they have totally ruined the atmosphere with their modern furnishings and decor. Gone are the wonderful old pieces of furniture and tasteful period decor. The new reception desk looks like any you would see in a modern day chain hotel. Also it was cold a drizzling yesterday but now welcoming fire like you would have seen previously! The staff were pleasant enough but nowhere near as friendly and welcoming as the old staff. In the past every guest that stepped through the door was made to feel so special, it was always a wonderful treat to visit. The grounds still look lovely but they should be ashamed at the state of the swimming pool. It was fifthly with algae and dead leaves floating on it. Afternoon tea has increased in price but was rather disappointing. Firstly they don’t seem to know how to serve a decent cup of tea anymore. Earl Grey so strong it was like builders tea. We waited ages for our tea, which actually arrived after the sandwiches and cakes and tasted like it was stewed. Three pots later for me and pots of hot water for my friends to keep the tea hot and water it down, I finally managed to drink it without a nasty taste. The sandwiches were nowhere near as nice as usual and we had to ask for more, rather than being offered anymore. No Victoria Sandwich and scones that were literally half the size and cold. They used to arrive warm and were so light and so big. The patisserie was a disappointment too. Sickly sweet and nowhere near as fine as we used to get. A lot got left as it was not to everyone’s taste. I also picked up rubbish in reception. Some plastic packaging that several staff stepped over as they went through. The staff are not as attentive or vigilant as their predecessors unfortunately. Great Fosters you need to up your game or we won’t be coming back! End of an era when it was sold to this new outfit! Sad days.

title: Tea for two so disappointing!
comment: Arrived for afternoon tea Saturday afternoon nobody greeted us infact we felt ignored 3 people were on reception and seemed to be busy doing nothing. After waiting several minutes we had to approach someone who took us into the Tudor Room although there were several people in the room the atmosphere was very dull. We had a young girl serve us she was pleasant enough but not very smiley or chatty. She never offered us more sandwiches or tea which would of been nice. She was on the other side of the room staring into space and we couldn't get her attention to ask so eventually gave up. When we got the bill it was a shock to see it cost £99 they add a 12.5% service charge so be warned! It would of been worth every penny if the atmosphere was better and the staff were more attentive making you feel special. This was my first experience having afternoon tea in a luxury hotel sadly it did not live up to my expectations so I will not be returning or recommending hence my 1 star rating.

title: What has happened to this place?
comment: Such a disappointing afternoon tea. I came here a few years ago and it was such a great experience. I see the hotel has been taken over. It used to be classy and historic now it is gaudy and cheap full of furniture that would not look out of place in a Novotel. The service for the tea was terrible. Flat champagne; no milk or sugar and food not worth the £37 per head. Such a let down.

title: Lovely place for tea
comment: We had a nice afternoon tea here in a beautiful setting. It was summer so we were outside, but in the winter you can have tea inside by the fire and it's wonderful as well. The choices of tea were nice, and the food was delicious. Afterward we had a nice walk around the gardens. I would like to go back and stay in the hotel.

title: Disappointing experience.
comment: This an over priced hotel. The food was average. I talked to the GM after coming back home and she was hoping to take of the issues in my next visit to UK.

title: Overpriced no atmosphere
comment: Came for afternoon tea for a surprise birthday treat for my mother , was so disappointed. We were shown to our table . Which was set nicely and clean , there was no background music which is very dull maybe soft piano music or something calm . No extra sandwiches or cakes were offered and it was nothing amazing . Very sweet and not much choice of sandwiches. The reception wasn’t very welcoming . The bill came to £140 then 17.50 on top for optional discretionary service at 12.5% . We chose to leave £10 not £17.50 so she said she will get the manager , why when optional ????? We should of just not left anything as that’s very rude . The manager didn’t come and we left it ruined an expensive day and we will not return and definitely wouldn’t recommend.

title: Excellent traditional pub
comment: What an excellent traditional pub, the décor is great I guess circa 1930’s, the draught ale was in good condition, and the Pub food was good at a very reasonable price.  A good atmosphere and friendly staff.  We’re going back for more.

title: Lovely friendly pub
comment: We contacted The Woodman to arrange a family get together after my mother in laws funeral at Breakspear Crematorium. Steve was really helpful at a distressing time and made all the organisation very easy for us. We were given a small private function room with a bar and staff member and they laid on an excellent buffet for a reasonable price. Nothing was too much trouble and I would not hesitate to recommend The Woodman.

title: Great Place
comment: The Woodman has a wonderful atmosphere and friendly staff. The garden on a summers day/evening is absolutely lovely; the beautiful flowers make a gorgeous setting. Nice selection of drinks and a great gin menu too.

title: Best afternoon tea but shame you don’t want my custom on another occasion!
comment: I’ve given the afternoon tea four stars. In honesty it should be five because, as well seasoned afternoon tea goers, my friends and I agree they do the best scones, and the rest is pretty good too. The staff are pleasant and helpful, so no complaints, and we’ve been quite a few times. Sadly though I won’t be going again. I just called with an enquiry about a baby shower afternoon tea, to be put through to the events team who wanted to charge me an extra £350 room hire for my 15-20 (max) guests. I called back after a rethink to ask why we couldn’t just be seated in one of the usual areas, giving an example of the big room on the left as you enter the hotel (photo attached from my visit last week). I was told that would only take 12 people. It is a big room which could easily take 15-20 but the events team seem to have their rules and don’t want my business so sadly I’ll have to go elsewhere.

title: Classic style English excellence
comment: Beautiful location combined with all the sandwiches and hand crafted cakes one could possibly eat. Exceptional range of unusual teas including Peruvian chocolate and a very elegant white tea. Attentive service, combined with helpful commentary on varieties of tea. A splendid experience for a special occasion.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: It was really nice. Beautiful place, weather was good, staff were helpful. Food was amazing too. Really nice. It's expensive but cool

title: What are they doing to this Hotel!
comment: Have stayed at this hotel eaten dinner, lunch and afternoon tea on many occasions over the years and have always found everything excellent. Visited today for Afternoon Tea we were very disappointed that the new Owners had moved the Reception into the main lounge where there was once a beautiful table and views across the stunning gardens. One of the first things you saw when you entered the hotel was the beautiful foral arrangement, which was changed weekly, now gone completely. The new Reception Desk and grey carpet is completely out of character for a building that is nearly 500 years old. If the new owners continue in this vein they will ruin this beautiful hotel. Turning to the Afternoon Tea this was again excellent only one disappointment we were not offered additional finger sandwiches, which we have always been offered in the passe, another effect of the new Owners? We shall having dinner and staying overnight in April when I will have the opportunity to review the hotel more fully and leave a further review based on any further changes made by the new Owners.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Have had afternoon tea here on many occasions but felt this time it was not as good. The sandwiches were nice but scones and cakes were brought out at the same time as the sandwiches so the scones were cold when we were ready for them which made them hard and not as tasty. We had a very small portion of clotted cream and jam. Cakes were nice but not as impressive as our previous visits when there was a centre piece of a trifle in tall container and more selection. Have to say that staff were very attentive.

title: Afternoon delight
comment: Just a fab experience with great customer service from Emma and Archie, both are a credit to the hotel. Totally recommend for families and couples. Afternoon tea is fantastic - lovely sandwiches and lots of fancy cakes plus a glass of champagne. A love;y treat on a sunny day. Brilliant!

title: Excellent Mother’s Day Afternoon Tea
comment: Simply fantastic Tea. A beautiful location with amazing formal gardens. The Afternoon Tea was terrific. All elements were perfect and inventive. The value for the kids was also outstanding.

title: True birthday treat
comment: Had afternoon tea for a friend's special birthday and wasn't disappointed but then you get what you pay for. Weekend price is £37 for a good selection of tea, coffee and hot chocolate a volonté. For an extra charge you can hve g&t, 3types of bubbles and pimms. Service was impeccable and the sandwiches, scones and sweet treats were truly scrumptious. There was a GF and vegetarian option too. Definitely recommend as a special treat. The setting is lovely too and you can wander in the gardens afterwards.

title: Average
comment: Unfortunately in line with several other reviews here, I have to say the afternoon tea is overly disappointing. I read them beforehand but as the good outweighed the bad I thought I would disregard the complaints. There was a mix up in my order although this was sorted at the time and dealt with accordingly. However, the staff are not attentive at all, the man behind the bar bought me a plate for my birthday which was a nice touch but spolied somewhat by the staff, in general, not being overly fussed by us being there. We felt a bit like they were doing us a favour by fitting us in...even though we had booked in advance. We saw about 5 different faces serving us. The food was good, I am gluten free and vegetarian however we did not get offered extra sandwiches (despite other reviews?!) and the red pepper sandwich did not have humous in it despite the waitress announcing it did. It’s a pretty average affair for a high price tag in all honesty.

title: Nice pub - excellent for an informal function
comment: We needed to find a venue for a reception after a funeral at Breakspear Crematorium and had heard good reports about the Woodman under its new management . After an initial conversation with the manager we decided to take their standard buffet package.  It really was excellent - everyone remarked how nice the room was and how good the food was as well . There was so much choice - superb sandwiches , savouries , quiches, prawns served two ways, duck spring rolls, chicken satay , six types of cake, and more that I can't remember. There was a super quantity of everything , limitless tea and coffee . At a most reasonable price . We had the house white wine which was really most acceptable -   All the staff couldn't have been more helpful . Highly recommended.

title: Proper pub
comment: Proper pub great beer lovely beer garden well priced lovely staff it's a pub like a pub should be nuff said

title: Informal function - post funeral
comment: We chose The Woodman as the venue following my mothers funeral based on reviews and personal recommendation. The relaxed informal atmosphere is perfect for raising the mood of the sombre occasion, as well as the convenient location to the crematorium. The buffet provided an excellent selection of well presented tasty savouries and cakes with unlimited tea and coffee as well as the bar facilities. We were able to bring a memory stick to display family photos on the bar TV screen at the suggestion of Steve the manager, who was extremely helpful and accommodating. The staff on the day were lovely, and we couldn't fault the service. I would not hesitate recommending The Woodman for similar informal occasions. The perfect end to a difficult day, thank you.

title: attended a wake
comment: we attended my wifes aunts wake where all the food type requests were catered for by really pleasant staff who prepaired a brilliant buffet in a great room at a reasonable price, the pub has ample parking but is only a 3 minute walk from breakspear cremortorium. we highley recommend this venue

title: Staff problems
comment: We were given a voucher for afternoon tea and we're looking forward to using it which we did on 21st October, having booked 4 weeks before. We were booked for 2.30 and were sat down by 2.25. At 2.50 we asked when we would be served and were told "we are busy we have a lot of people in for afternoon tea" And this was our fault ? If they cannot accommodate more than a certain number they should not take bookings. We were told we could get more tea and coffee, which we did try to do but on 2 occasions we did this and never received them. A table behind us had trouble with their order and I overheard a member of staff moaning about the customers to another member of staff at the bar. Very unprofessional, maybe staff should be put on more training courses.  Customer service is never easy, I have done it, but the words I am sorry often goes a long way to alleviate unhappy customers. The shame of it is the hotel and grounds are fantastic and when we got the afternoon tea the food was great. I thought long and hard about writing this review and maybe writing to Great Fosters but on looking at the reviews on Trip Advisor noticed that any form of criticism is met with a dismissive response if answered at all, so felt writing would be a waste of time.

title: A truly magical afternoon
comment: I don't normally post reviews, but I felt that I needed to go out of my way to praise Great Fosters and its staff for an absolutely beautiful afternoon tea a few weekends ago to celebrate my mum's 60th birthday. The freshly made sandwiches, scones and modern desserts were delicious and on completely different level to some other afternoon teas I have had in the area. Not only was the food amazing, I cannot fault the attentive service from the staff and managers. Nothing was too much trouble for the both of us and it was lovely to give my mum the chance to truly relax and feel special with a glass of Champagne and cake. We even went for a walk around the stunning grounds and lake afterwards to make the most of such a beautiful and historic venue. I would highly recommend this as a very special place to visit and will be back soon!

title: Afternoon Tea Birthday Party
comment: My daughter had The Afternoon Tea for her birthday party, she said it was the best birthday ever.  I've posted pictures of the afternoon, the girls absolutely loved it.  Cakes, pastries, sandwiches and tea were absolutely delicious. The staff were amazing, helpful and friendly.  2 hours of playing in the beautiful grounds, that's how little girl's party should be.  Thank you Great Foster for make my child's birthday so magical.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: A lovely setting and such a grand building. The seating area was really intimate and cosy with a firelplace and sofas.  Food was good but for me did not match the exceptional location and views. It was not the most memorable tea I have had. One odd thing... on entering we seemed to be in an area where a bride was waiting with her bridemaids... more awkward for her than us I am sure!  Overall a nice day. Just needs an extra special touch.

title: Excellent
comment: Went for an afternoon tea treat for a 21st Birthday. Casper and Mitch couldn’t have done more to look after us and make the experience very enjoyable. Plenty of cakes and exceptional hot chocolate. We look forward to returning. Thank You!

title: Lovely relaxing afternoon tea ...
comment: Fantastic service Delicious sandwiches, cakes, tea, cofee and champagne. Fabulous grounds Had a simply blissful afternoon

title: Wonderful afternoon
comment: This was the second time that I had been for Afternoon Tea, and again it was faultless, the staff are fantastic, nothing is too much trouble. The afternoon tea is delicious, sandwiches, pastries and cake, a superb array of teas and the addition of a Pimms, Gin or Champagne makes for a decadent afternoon.  The Building and its grounds are superb, you can imagine Henry V111 walking around with his hunting dogs, Just a wonderful way to spend the afternoon.

title: Von Ryan’s choice
comment: One of the best afternoon teas I have ever experienced. Certainly beats the Ritz and Dorchester and other venues.

title: WOW WOW WOW
comment: Took my mother-in-law for an afternoon tea treat and I could not have been more pleased with my choice. From the moment we walked through the door we were made to feel very welcome and when I told the receptionist it was out first time, he seemed to step it up a gear. We were shown to The Tudor Room and this room is absolutely stunning. Out waitress Molly was absolutely excellent, taking the time to explain how the afternoon would pan out and informing us of what would be available. The service is second to none and you can tell everyone is trained to a very high standard. The offerings for afternoon tea are stunning and the only criticism, they give you too much! It was such a lovely setting and the room was full of mother's and their daughters. I can't wait to come back and explore some more of this stunning place.

title: Lovely afternoon tea
comment: All four of us really enjoyed afternoon tea at Great Fosters. The staff were very friendly and very efficient - getting the right balance. Good selection of ‘different’ sandwiches, warm scones, both fruit and plain, and a selection of fancy cakes. Very plentiful and served beautifully. I can thoroughly recommend afternoon tea here. We will be returning, hopefully soon.

title: Decidedly average
comment: Nice sandwiches and cakes, but the overall experience was somewhat disappointing as a special birthday treat. Despite the beautiful venue, there was no ambience in the lounge/waiting area where we were seated. No music playing, deathly quiet, and seated at a low coffee table with armchairsbeside each other, rather than a proper table and chairs. The armchairs have seen better days, with the bottom cushion of my armchair constantly slipping forward from under me. We so would have preferred a proper table, maybe in a different part of the hotel, with a highchair for the little one (it would have been too high for the table we were allocated).

title: Summer Afternoon Tea.
comment: We had an absolutely delicious afternoon tea outside by the moat. Such a beautiful setting. Service was excellent and all the staff were very friendly, polite and attentive. I would definitely recommend.

title: Anniversary afternoon tea
comment: Second time we have been to great Fosters, fantastic location and grounds. Afternoon tea was great good selection of cakes and sandwiches. Service was excellent all staff very helpful and pleasant.

title: Beautiful
comment: Stunning tea made the graduation celebration complete. I would definitely recommend this fabulous experience to anyone

title: Superb Afternoon Tea
comment: Great Fosters is a gorgeous setting on any day but when the sun shines the gardens come alive and are the ideal location for afternoon tea. The staff are friendly, helpful and offer a fabulous service, even when the sun beats down - nothing is too much trouble. Enjoy the ambiance and good food!

title: Great traditional tea in an excellent old school atmosphere!
comment: Love the setting in a very old estate/hotel with warm fires in the winter and a broad yard in the back for walks, etc. and enjoyable experience all around!

title: birthday treat
comment: My daughter took me there for my birthday treat. The greeting was great and we were made to feel very welcome. A table was reserved for us and we were presented with the list of things included in our afternoon tea and given a choice of teas. Soon we were given a beautiful selections of sandwiches and then the tea, we were offered more sandwiches if we could manage them!!! We then moved on to the scones, jam and cream which was excellent so tasty. The cakes to were beautiful and delicious. We couldn't eat it all so they immediately offered to pack it into boxes to take home. Would I go back YES for sure. The staff were excellent nothing was too much trouble. The surrounding are lovely and we enjoyed a walk around the gardens too.

title: Very disappointing Afternoon Tea
comment: To celebrate a very special birthday we'd booked months in advance and so were perplexed, on arrival at the booked time, to discover that our table wasn't ready. With the beautiful Tudor Room closed off for dining we were eventually shown to our table in the small and noisy bar area. Although our food was delicious and plentiful, service was minimal and we were forced to wait a long time for everything and to remind various waiters who had forgotten our order. Staff loudly (and unprofessionally) arguing behind the bar and constant to-ing and fro-ing past our table made our conversation difficult and it was a far cry from being the special treat we envisaged. A walk in the beautiful grounds afterwards was welcome although spoilt by many empty beer bottles and rubbish scattered under the shrubs and lots of rat traps. Great Fosters seems to have lost its way again and unfortunately us regular clients too. We'll definitely be taking our afternoon tea elsewhere in future.

title: Afternoon Tea Big Disappointment
comment: The hotel and grounds both beautiful and immaculate and my mother, boyfriend and myself expected big things especially having been recommended Great Fosters. We were greeted by an absolutely lovely lady who chatted to us for a while discussing the history of the hotel and we also spoke to some other lovely staff there. Sadly I have to say that our afternoon tea was ruined entirely by our waiter. We ordered 2 Pims afternoon teas and 1 vegetarian afternoon tea with mojito for myself. It became clear towards the end of the sandwiches that possibly the waiter had forgotten my veggie sandwiches. I actually had to share the sandwiches of my Mum and boyfriend as I was starving. After having 2 separate conversations about the missing sandwiches with the waiter I was brought a few veggie sandwiches that arrived at the same time as our deserts. He agreed they had been forgotten but blamed another waiter. The whole point of afternoon tea is to sample some tea...and our tea and coffee only arrived after asking a few times by which point our deserts were well and truly finished. In the end, the table having never been emptying, the bill arrived and the waiter seemed oblivious to the fact that this was all unacceptable. I mentioned again the fact I was disappointed about the sandwiches and he removed the service charge (wow and entire £12), made a joke and left with barely an apology. At £120 I expect much more than this. I didn’t want to create a scene so we called a taxi and left. The other staff were lovely and cocktails and food all very good. What a shame that one person could ruin our entire day. We have attended as a family of 3 at 1pm today 04/08/2018 should the restaurant seek to look up my reservation and get in touch under my real name with initials TK.

title: Very disappointing afternoon tea
comment: Having previously had a great afternoon tea experience here a few years ago we decided to treat our Mum again as part of her 80th birthday celebrations. Such a disappointing experience this time. Table wasn't ready for our booking on our arrival and we were told to wait in the room by the sides of other people already dining whilst our table was prepared. The Tudor room wasn't available for afternoon tea this time apparently, so instead we were finally seated in the Cocktail bar room at a table which had a constant flow of waiters and waitresses filing past in close proximity with food and drink orders for other tables - not very relaxing or conducive for what should have been a relaxing afternoon tea. The Tudor room makes for a much better afternoon tea venue in my opinion. We were also witness to some of the staff blaming each other for various misunderstandings at the cocktail bar too - very unprofessional conduct. Food was fine, but our order for a second pot of tea each to accompany our scones and cakes endured a 30 minute wait. All in all we felt forgotten, details on or initial order were missed and we felt that the service and ambience had much to be desired. Understandably we chose not to pay the service charge which had been added to our bill. I complained to the front desk on leaving and was told that it was because it was the weekend and busy. Our previous experience had also been on a weekend, so clearly not a good enough reason for such a bad experience this time. I made it clear we wouldn't return for future visits and was told that the duty manager would be in touch on the email we made our reservation with. Have heard nothing as yet. So very, very disappointing Great Fosters, shame on you.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: We had lovely afternoon tea, it was a beautiful day and the setting was amazing sitting by the most. The selection of sandwiches were delicious and the cakes were out of this world. It was lovely to see a good selection of tea and coffee. Our editor was Casper and he was very obliging and funny. Very attentive.

title: Great place to visit
comment: Great afternoon tea, unfortunately took a while to actually get our tea but enjoyed the experience. The service was also top!

title: Now a firm favourite for Afternoon Tea
comment: Have now visited a few times for Afternoon Tea and experienced very high standard of food and service each time. Staff are wonderful, friendly and attentive, you feel like nothing is too much trouble. It is such a beautiful setting in the garden and food is good value and very tasty. We will certainly visit again.

title: Excellent tea and lovely champagne
comment: This was a birthday present and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The weather was beautiful and we were able to sit outside in the gorgeous garden. Service was prompt and especially loved the Earl Grey tea.

title: Birthday Tea for Two
comment: Present from Grandson for my 80th birthday and taken on husbands birthday who was given a little cake with candle on.Thought this was a lovely gesture. Tea and service were great.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: A lovely experience - welcoming staff who did everything they could to make the whole afternoon tea superb. Everlasting supply of lovely sandwiches, wonderful choice of really scrumptious cakes followed by wonderful scones! Just amazing. Thankyou .

title: Fantastic Afternoon tea at Great Fosters
comment: Firstly Great Fosters helped us out when another venue cancelled, at very short notice, an afternoon tea for 9 to celebrate our Mother's 90th birthday . A very hot July afternoon under a gazebo in the gardens. Must have been hard work for the staff in the stifling heat but they and the tea itself were top quality.  There was no rush and we can say no more than it's great Great Fosters for us.

title: Brilliant afternoon tea
comment: We has afternoon tea in the garden what a beautiful setting the quality of the food was top notch and the staff where amazing nothing was too much trouble checking you where ok all the time It was an extremely hot day and we where under shade but the staff where in full sunshine and still served gracefully  An amazing afternoon can highly recommend

title: Free refills on sammies!
comment: This is such a rarity in England, but after they bring you the initial plate full of yummy sandwiches, they bring around a tray filled with more! You can choose more of whatever you like! We sat outside because the weather was unusually beautiful for England and the surroundings were gorgeous. When we were finished, we took a walk around the grounds. The staff were very courteous. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a place to have afternoon tea.

title: Beautiful building and grounds
comment: What a lovely place to have a traditional afternoon tea. We sat by the moat on a beautiful summer afternoon. The food quality was excellent as was the selection on hand. The service, however, left a lot to be desired. Getting sandwiches replenished was like drawing teeth. If it hadn´t been for one waiter, who although not allocated to our table, was aware that we were kept waiting too long, our tea would not have been such a nice experience. Also, if you have coffee instead of tea, getting a refill is again not very easy. In short we had to make too much of the running to get served, not good!!!! I would put it down to an off day and go there again, it is such a nice setting.

title: Excellent
comment: A lovely afternoon tea. The service was polite, efficient and welcoming. The afternoon tea was all delicious. The sandwiches were not dry as many others are from being made too far ahead, and the balance of flavours a bit different without being too adventurous. Scones and cakes all delicious too! The atmosphere sat outside was beautiful and the children loved exploring the gardens. Definitely would come again.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: Had a fabulous tea for Father's Day at Great Fosters. Booked a table indoors to be on the safe side and we had a lovely table in a bay window overlooking the terrace. The service was excellent- very friendly and helpful, and the traditional afternoon tea was lovely. The supply of sandwiches seemed neverending and there was a huge choice of cakes. Fortunately we were supplied with tasteful doggie bags to take home the leftovers. And of course the gardens are lovely to walk off the calories afterwards. Beautiful rose garden. Would highly recommend for a special occasion.

title: Perfect G&T afternoon tea at Great Fosters
comment: I booked this for my friends and my birthday. It was lovely. A beautiful setting outside next to the  pond and bridge. The manager and all the waiting staff were excellant. The food was delicious and the cakes were  outstanding. For our birthdays they gave us a birthday plate each with happy birthday written in chocolate and a yummy brownie  with a candle on top. This was a great experience and would highly  recommend it. Thank you to all the staff at Great Fosters for a great  experience.

title: Disappointment
comment: Very disappointed I'm sorry to say. The quality of the afternoon tea was not as impressive compared to our previous visit and certainly did not justify the increase in the cost. I doubt we will be returning, which is sad as it is such a lovely venue

title: Nice for a random lunch.
comment: Nice place, nice environment, food could be abit better and up to scratch. Nice staff and good drinks.

title: Alice would love it here!
comment: Absolutely fabulous! This has to be one of the very best afternoon teas ever, in quantity, quality and location.We got a warm friendly welcome and were shown in to the garden for our tea. Without exception, the staff were friendly but not over-familiar, very funny and totally charming. The sandwiches were fresh and delicious and we were offered more (tip: take all you want on seconds as it won't come again - however, be careful because the following cakes and scones are enormous!). There is a good range of tea to select (no Assam or Ceylon however. An oversight?) We both chose Darjeeling. Then come the cakes - fresh, moist and varied. The scones are warm and quite honestly the best I can remember tasting (we are old hands at afternoon teas,in many select locations) and the cream is plentiful and very thick, as is the jam. I also liked that we were told then and there not to worry about the amount as they would box up any we couldn't eat. We needed the boxes! On top of this the gardens are totally wonderful - OK, it was a warm and sunny day but do give yourself enough time to explore. The atmosphere is wonderful, warm and friendly like the staff, and I expected to see the White Rabbit hurry past and to turn a corner and see Alice chatting with the March Hare and the Hatter. I would turn this up to 11.

title: Pimms aftrnoon Tea @ Great Fosters
comment: I booked this for my daughter's birthday treat and it was absolutely fabulous. The staff were attentive and courteous and we felt thoroughly spoilt. The food was excellent and the setting by the lake and bridge was beautiful. The sun was out and all in all it was a fantastic experience. I would highly recommend. Thank you Sue Davis

title: Wonderful pre-birthday celebration
comment: We booked a table for afternoon tea with friends to celebrate my birthday and it didn't disappoint. It was such a lovely afternoon so we sat outside, the service, food and ambience were absolutely wonderful, soaking up the atmosphere in such a historic place. I loved the constant supply of sandwiches and the gorgeous cakes and pastries. When it got a bit cooler we came inside where a table in the bar had been reserved and they brought through a plate with 'Happy Birthday' written in chocolate with a small cake and candle, such a lovely touch thank you. Overall it was a lovely experience. We also stayed in the hotel for 2 nights which was wonderful and we shall definitely be back!

title: Wonderful afternoon tea in a beautiful setting - perfect day
comment: Visited the hotel for afternoon tea to celebrate a 70th birthday. The tea was lovely and served in a very relaxed way with plenty to eat and drink; more if you wanted it. The weather was stunning so had a table in the garden which is quite lovely. Staff very friendly and attentive - could not fault the experience.

title: Perfect!
comment: The Estate/ setting is absolutely beautiful. I visited with a friend and had AT outside by the bridge. There was a wedding going on and it felt so well organised in that they had sectioned a private bit for them. There were grounds to walk around (though we didn't have time to do so). The tea itself was lovely. The sandwiches were divine and we could have eaten them till we popped! The cakes were also good, but being such a hot day a few had heated and melted but that wasn't the hotel's fault really- it was a scorcher! The only thing we would have liked is a little more shade, but like I said this day was a scorcher. The scones were the best I've had (and I've had a lot!) there wasn't that drying aftertaste you usually get and they were light and well risen. We ordered the pink raspberry G&T AT, but they had run out of the elderflower tonic so we had to have regular- I think the elderflower tonic would have "made" the drink. All taken into consideration, we award this 5* and said we would definitely return. I'd say you definitely get what you pay for!

title: Wonderful Woodman
comment: A fantastic local, reborn in recent years to the great credit of the current owners/management.  The Woodman is on the outskirts of Ruislip, near to the Crematorium, as suburbia gives way to countryside. What strikes me most, on each visit, is the genuinely warm welcome that you receive. The pub consists of a a cosy public bar, tastefully decorated and welcoming and a lounge, as well as a spacious outside area beautifully bedecked with flower beds and hanging baskets.  The lounge is regularly in use for private functions during the day, doing a good trade from the nearby crematorium. Food is served at lunchtimes Monday to Saturday and is well worth a visit. There is a good range of traditional pub food and lighter snacks - including a soup of the day. Fish finger sandwich and chips is my guilty pleasure, but everything is prepared with real care, reasonably priced and served with a smile.  A gem!

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: We were looked after so well. Attentive without being intrusive, super nice staff who were cheerful despite working in full uniform in 30 degrees. Food excellent and a generally lovely afternoon!

title: Such a treat!
comment: Such an amazing setting! The choice of teas, coffees and food was really good. The service was very attentive. This was a birthday treat for my husband and his aunt and uncle who had come over from NZ. They were really impressed!

title: Lovely tea and beautiful atmosphere
comment: Absolutely loved afternoon tea at Great Fosters. I can't find fault with anything about our visit. The service was excellent. Food was perfect.

title: 4 Very happy customers
comment: My wife and i and 2 friends had afternoon tea at Great fosters outside in the garden everything was perfect they even made sure the weather stayed dry lol. Both the food and the service was impeccable. We have been here before on 2 occasions for Sunday lunch this is why we had to try the Afternoon Tea we were spoilt. We will not hesitate in returning in the not too distant future to sample more delights that they have to offer . We would recommend this establishment to our friends and family.

title: Fantastic Afternoon Tea!
comment: Wow! The staff at Great Fosters could not have been more thoughtful or accommodating! Friends and I visited for a wonderful, relaxing afternoon tea.  The garden was lovely with roses in bloom. Our tea sandwiches were delicious ... even a second round! Hard to resist, but the warm scones and clotted cream made it a little easier. No room for the delicate pastries ... had to take away in the cute little boxes.  The food was great, the staff attentive ... a perfect afternoon ... thanks Great Fosters!!!

title: Stunning service
comment: Stunning service in a truly beautiful setting. The food is delicious and plentiful. Really made to feel special.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: The whole afternoon was lovely. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous. We arrived early and asked to be seated outside and we were informed the table would be about 30 mins . We were shown to the patio where we had drinks whist waiting for the table. Once this was ready we were shown to the table on the lawn by the stream. The waiter was excellent friendly and polite. The actual tea was perfect and we were offered more sandwiches and we were given boxes to take home with the cakes we were unable to finish. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a pleasant afternoon tea in a lovely ambience.

title: Birthday Afternoon Tea
