comment: We had a fabulous Pims afternoon to celebrate our daughters 25th Birthday. Good selection of sandwiches and cakes. Kirsty felt very special with her little cake and candle and the staff were very attentive. It was a beautiful day and the setting was perfect. Thank you

title: Haphazard Service
comment: Champagne Afternoon Tea .. Service did not compare to the standard of a previous visit.. The Table was not laid ..although a booking had been made a few days previously ..There were no Champagne Glasses laid with the table setting .. I had to ask for the Champagne..one glass  of sparkling wine was brought to the table ,already poured, I then had to ask for one for my guest. On a previous visit a few weeks ago ..The Champagne was poured at the table .from the bottle .and I could see it was Heidsieck.. The Earl Grey tea was served long after the sandwiches were brought to the table .  I requested Earl Grey with lemon, expecting the lemon to be on a separate dish ..for me to add to my tea as required ..but the lemon slices were actually put in the pot with the tea!! At no time were we offered a refill of tea..or asked if we would like more sandwiches ..although we did request them: As a member of the Great Fosters dinning club ..I had a voucher for a complimentary Champagne Afternoon Tea ..when accompanied by a guest paying full price £44.. plus service 10% We had the left over cakes boxed up ..and went for a walk in the grounds ..telling the waiter we would be back ..expecting the bill to be ready for us. It was not ..There was a complete misunderstanding that I would be paying for my guest ..the waiter had previously thought that it was a gift voucher for 2.. But the voucher had been given to the Manager on arrival ..and confirmed at the time of booking .. Not the experience I had enjoyed on previous occasions ..over all ..Very Disappointing.. The staff were pleasant ..but there was clearly no direction given ..especially as they were not career hospitality staff.

title: Mrs
comment: Fantastic afternoon tea with exceptional service in the gardens of a magnificent hotel. Would truly recommend a visit.

title: 100% recommend
comment: My mum and I had a lovely champagne afternoon tea in the sunshine on the 4.30 time slot. Perfect time for afternoon tea! All the staff were great and very attentive, our main waiter who I think may be French was brilliant and well worth a shout out to as he absolute made our experience. The sandwich selection was perfect, and you could have a few extra if you wanted. The cakes were also lovely, and plenty of tea or coffee.  After tea we had a walk around the beautiful grounds. It was an afternoon of pure relaxation.

title: Perfect venue
comment: We recently held a family and friends gathering following the funeral of our mother. The service and help we received, in particular by Louise and Steve,was excellent. The buffet provided was plentiful, of good quality and very fresh and all at a very reasonable price. We were very well looked after by all the staff and nothing was to much trouble.  A lovely venue, clean and comfortable in the private room facility. I would not hesitate to recommend the Woodman for any small function.

title: A great pub
comment: I found this unassuming pub to be cosy and friendly. The staff were friendly, helpful and welcoming. The real ales are good and the sandwiches are fresh and very tasty. The bar was clean and cosy with plenty of space. The toilet facilities, which I understand were newly refurbished, were very good. A good lunchtime experience. WELL DONE!

title: Really welcoming great friendly service
comment: This is our local pub it has changed a lot since taken over by Steve and his family. Always accommodating and happy to help. The food is great well worth a visit.

title: Thank You
comment: We booked The Woodman for family to gather after a funeral. We were met by Steve who was fantastic and made a difficult situation much easier. Nothing was too much trouble and we were able to make changes to numbers right up to the day before.  The food was just right and the bar staff were welcoming and put people at ease. They kept us very informed of the bar tab and we were able to use the TV to share a slideshow of memories and we were able to put together our own playlist, which made the event feel very personal. Would recommend without reservation and would like to say thank you!

title: THANK YOU ☺
comment: Like previous reviewers we booked this venue for a wake following recommendation from the Undertakers as this area is not known to me. I cannot thank the staff enough for the excellent food and warm welcome. They were so attentive throughout our visit making sure all requirements were met. The bar was very warm on a cold snowy day and it was the perfect end to a very stressful time for us. Thank you all. Should I be passing through will definetly call in.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: I celebrated my 60th birthday with afternoon tea at Great Fosters in Egham ....overall the experience was very good. Unfortunately our waiter for the afternoon was told off by a female member of staff in our earshot for 'talking too much to the guests' at the end of our stay. This soured our enjoyable afternoon. In future she should have confined her comments to the waiter in question (name witheld) in private, which would have been far more professional. Also, they changed the rules regarding sitting by the pool bar for residents only and the Manager appeared to remind us of these rules....apologies when he realised that we had just finished our afternoon tea and were planning to revisit in the near future. Overall a good experience but staff need to realise where and when they can be heard by the clientele

title: Lovely afternoon tea but let down by service
comment: My friends & I celebrated a bridal & baby shower so I wanted it to be extra special. I booked Great Fosters based on its great reviews & location. We were however very disappointed by the service. My friend arrived early & didn’t feel very welcome at all. One of the staff looked oddly at the balloons she was carrying. She had coffee which came with biscuits & one of the ladies commented that she should’ve been given one biscuit rather than 2! I arrived a little late & was asked to wait. We have the table for 2 hours & had to insist to go to the restaurant. The guy who served us was lovely though. The sandwiches, scones & cakes including the tea selection were excellent! Afternoon tea is not only about the food but the experience & based on that, I probably won’t go back. It would’ve been nicer to have the table for longer too or have somewhere to transfer to. We’ve been to London restaurants & have never been asked to leave or at least been offered to transfer to another room. I would happily pay more for a better experience.

title: Birthday treat with excellent service & tea
comment: This was booked for a birthday treat for my birthday. Our booking originally was for inside but because of the glorious weather, reservations rang to say if we'd like a table outside in the gardens, to ring back, which we did. We weren't disappointed as our table was next to a little stream and was most pretty. The service we received was excellent from all members of staff.The afternoon tea was superb with a range of tasty sandwiches, followed by scones, cream and jam, and finally an assortments of cakes. As a surprise, I was presented with a small birthday cake on a plate with chocolate Happy Birthday written on. A nice touch. We were offered more sandwiches and tea . We tried quite a selection of teas (similar to wine tasting!) and by the time we reached the selection of cakes, we were beginning to feel full. Our waiting staff brought cute sized doggy boxes for us to take our leftover cakes home with us. After tea, we walked around the gardens which were gorgeous with a beautiful wisteria covering parts of a wooden bridge over a stream. Herons and geese with their goslings were close by. An absolutely lovely birthday treat .

title: Beautiful gardens, lovely tea
comment: I tried to book tea with two weeks' notice and was unable to choose our preferred time. Being busy I thought would be a good sign. We were offered the 4.45pm slot and accepted. What we did not realise was that 4.45pm was called second seating....however, we appeared to be the only guests for the second seating. With the weather uncertain I had reserved a table inside and our table was meant to be in the room which doubles up as the Michelin star restaurant in the evening. Perhaps pleasant when filled with dinner guests and candle light it would not have created any atmosphere for tea. I had expected a lovely lounge space with large windows overlooking the garden, not an enclosed, lonely one. Luckily the weather held up and the team were flexible enough to arrange a table for us outside at short notice. The gardens are beautiful and we eventually enjoyed a wonderful afternoon tea with gorgeous views. Staff was very attentive and the offering delicious.

title: Overall a good experience
comment: I booked afternoon tea for 8 for my son's 21st Birthday.  The positives - fantastic location and because of the good weather we were thoughtfully offered a table outside in advance of arrival - a very nice touch. I emailed a couple of times to let all concerned know of dietary requirements and these were catered for, albeit after further prompting.  I had also forwarned them that it was my son's 21st and said we'd be grateful if this could be acknowledged in some way, unfortunately, it was not. No verbal 'Happy Birthday' or plate with writing on or separate cake with candle, as experienced at other places. This was disappointing.  The service wasn't always as we'd of liked, although I feel this was more lack of training than lack of suitability for the role. Some of the bread was a bit dry and the sandwiches weren't that inspiring but like I say overall, it was a good experience.  We definitely felt we were being hurried up to leave at the end and I noticed a table of 2 didn't have the presence of waiting staff around them and possibly felt less pressure to move on.

title: Afternoon tea with manicured garden walk
comment: Great garden, on a nice summers day its wonderful to walk the gardens.  Afternoon tea was well presented and tasty, we were so full we got to take the leftovers home.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Booked afternoon tea for 18 for a surprise celebration of my younger daughter's 40th birthday. Our eldest daughter had her wedding reception there over 10 years ago. The location and gardens are exceptional, the staff extremely welcoming and the sandwiches and cakes totally delicious and a cut above The Ritz in London! All our guests were highly impressed also with the exceptional afternoon tea.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Excellent for both food and the variety of teas to experience. The service was also excellent. Both surpassed expectations.

title: Beautiful setting and wonderful offerings
comment: The gardens provided a beautiful backdrop and the scones are absolutely delicious. There were many teas to choose from, and the wait staff was extremely attentive.

title: Afternoon tea at Great Fosters
comment: Had a great time got there a bit early so had a walk around the gardens afternoon tea was v/nice. Staff were very attentive

title: Always fantastic!!
comment: Have been before, the hotel is lovely, amazing ambiance, great food and fantastic service. Table of five for a birthday treat. Thanks. Will be back another day.

title: Amazing!
comment: Wow. What an experience. From beginning to end our breath was taken away. Casper is amazing and an absolute credit to the hotel. To have sandwich refills is immense and the selection of cakes were to die for. Thank you for making my friends birthday so special

title: Excellent visit!
comment: Brought my parents for my mum’s birthday, and afternoon tea absolutely didn’t disappoint! Lovely grounds and building, wonderful choices of tea, sandwiches and cakes and fantastic service. Our waiter was charming and went above and beyond to ensure we had a perfect afternoon. Very impressed with the visit and would recommend for anyone looking for a memorable afternoon out.

title: "Lovely lazy afternoon tea"
comment: The quality of the food here never disappoints. The hotel is one of the most beautiful in the area, you should always try to make some extra time to walk round the gardens. The service was even better than normal due to the adorable Caspar!

title: Quite expensive but worthy
comment: Minimum spend is 36 stirling per person but really worthy every penny. Staff very friendly and helpful, the hotel was very old and famous, the garden is high and full of charming features. Walk around with family really a treat! Scones very fresh and can’t stop eating. Will come back to stay in hotel one night.

title: Gin Afternoon Tea
comment: My daughter bought me a voucher for her and I to go to Great Fosters for afternoon tea! What a wonderful experience! The tea was amazing and the service excellent!! Would highly recommend and will certainly go again. Thank-you, it was fabulous!

title: Lovely tea, beautiful setting
comment: What sets this tea apart is the lovely setting at Great Fosters, including the beautiful and historic buildings, the gardens, the history, the service. What a wonderful afternoon enjoying a delicious tea!

title: Gin Afternoon Tea in a fantastic venue and 5 star customer service
comment: The tone of the afternoon was set immediately, with staff members from top to bottom asked gracefully whether I needed assistance with my wheelchair, we were shown the accessible entrance and shown every attention until we settled at our table outside.  Miegal our waiter for the afternoon, was friendly but not intrusive, balancing attentiveness while allowing us a leisurely afternoon, catching up with a friend.  I loveeee afternoon tea and this one goes to the top of my list, surpassing top London 5 star hotels. Firstly, if you want to have an alcoholic tipple along side a lovely range of hot drinks, from a English sparkling wine, to champagne, Pimms and our choice Gin.  The actual tea, beautiful fresh sandwiches, with a top up on offer, traditional scones, warm, crumbly and melt in the mouth. Then a Victoria Sandwich for two, finally a plate of fancies, and to my delight, choux bun ( banana toffee) , Lemon and passion fruit meringue shortcrust tart, chocolate opera cake, pink ( raspberry?) macroon Alomond and moose cake and finally mini battenburg!!!  We certainly needed to walk off the sugar rush, and we escaped into the wonderful gardens, due to the age of the building, you do need to go round the houses to get to them in the wheelchair, but once again it was no trouble to be shown the route once again by the top man. This willingness I am sure is the leadership that leads the rest of the staff to follow.  Thank you, I am looking forward to cocktails in the garden with my husband later in the summer....

title: Nice food / Terrible Service
comment: Having decided to treat my Mother to a rare trip out I chose Great Fosters on the basis of reviews and recommendations. Whilst the venue and food were of a very high standard the service was a complete let down. When spending quite a bit of money on something such as afternoon tea I would expect milk to come with the pot of tea, I also wouldn’t expect to have to ask several times and be bought everything but milk! by the time the 3 jugs of milk did arrive the tea was cold. I have enjoyed a few afternoon teas with my partner including at Danesfield House and Foxhills and I must say based on service I would recommend them 1st before Great Fosters. This is even more of a shame as I had thought of treating my soon to be wife to a meal or stay at the hotel especially as she has fallen in love with the idea of your swimming pool but I would sadly now reconsider and look elsewhere based on this experience.

title: A very fine Afternoon Tea
comment: We visited Great Fosters for an Afternoon Tea as a treat to ourselves for a personal celebration.  We had pre-booked and were reassured upon arrival as they had our booking and had a table ready. The service we received was absolutely first-class, as was the food itself. We were fortunate to have a table with a great view across the grounds (the weather was atrocious, so no chance of sitting outside!) which added to our enjoyment of the tea. The hotel offers guests an large range of loose-leaf teas to accompany their food (no teabags here) which come in very fine silver teapots.  If you are looking for an experience that is a little bit special, this is the place.

title: Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters
comment: Wonderful food, beautiful location and excellent service. Could not ask for anything more. We tried different teas as recommended by the waiter and they were both very nice. The description on the menu you very accurate.We were offered extra sandwiches and when we cold not manage to eat all the cakes they provided a special box for us to take them home in.

title: Excellent tea in lovely surroundings
comment: Three of us had afternoon tea. The selection of teas was good with some unusual ones. My husband had chocolate tea, I had white tea and my daughter had Canton Darjeeling. The sandwiches were good and served before the cakes. The waiter came back with a huge plateful so we could have eaten as many as we wanted but needed to leave room for the cakes! Scones were fresh and warm with plenty of jam and cream. We as most guests took some cakes home in a lovely cardboard box as we were defeated after scones and a small Victoria sponge. The hotel has a lot of character and lovely gardens to walk around pre or post tea. The only thing I would say is that £30 is quite steep for a tea without bubbly

title: Mum & Dad 50th Wedding Anniversary Celebrations
comment: If you know Great Fosters, you will know what a magnificent venue it is. Well you can have a magnificent afternoon tea here and I thoroughly Recommend it. Warning!!! Don’t be a pig and go for seconds on the sandwiches, because you won’t be able to manage the cakes. All washed down with Copious amounts of delicious tea. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to do something different, but a bit special. It’s wonderful and the staff are fantastic. As you can tell, as a party of 8 we loved it.

title: Fabulous Afternoon Tea
comment: We celebrated our parents 60th wedding anniversary with a family gathering for Afternoon Tea on Easter Sunday. Great Fosters is a splendid and very impressive hotel and we were warmly greeted. We sat on huge comfy sofas around low tables in front of a grand fireplace and were treated to a delicious tea with a continual top up of lovely sandwiches, pots of tea and scrumptious cakes. The service was top notch - perfect pace and very attentive. My parents were thrilled with the occasion and we were all grateful that the rain held off so we could have a walk around the beautifully manicured gardens. Absolutely first class.

title: A Well-Kept Secret That Should Be Shared!
comment: If you are looking to have a traditional afternoon tea in a magnificent setting, this is the place for you. Laden with historical significance, you can enjoy a lovely array of teas, sandwiches, and pastries in Anne Boleyn's room, and stroll around grounds hunted by Henry VIII! The gardens are simply magnificent. We did not stay at the hotel, but I plan to on my next trip! Highly recommend!!

title: Absolutely stunning location, amazing service, delicious food!
comment: Absolutely amazing afternoon tea experience My friends and I went to Great Fosters after one of them had their Hen Weekend in Thorpe Park, and I can not praise the venue enough.  I booked an afternoon tea for four of us, 2pm on Sunday. The experience was magical from the moment we drove into the car park.  There was a butler at the entrance, who greeted us and showed us in. The estate is amazing, beautiful and I already wish to return just for the experience.  Upon entrance to the left, there is a room where high tea area is, and to the right, there is a huge three piece suite in front of a beautiful fire. We were seated there by a very attentive and proud member of the staff who informed us she had worked there 20 years and gushed about how much she loved her work. This had us all smiling, as I believe first impressions count!  Once our table was ready, we were taken through and had an open view into the garden. You couldn't have asked for a better seat, as I think we were allocated the best!  Caspar served us our high tea and went into much detail explaining each experience and we decided to go with the Pimms High Tea at £40 per head. Worth every penny I can tell you now. The sandwich round, they could have kept bringing over as everything we were served tasted so good! We even had extra sandwiches.  After a little break, we had our sweet round and ordered some mango noir tea that Caspar had recommended. Then along came the warm scones with clotted cream and jam, Victoria sponge, little pastries and cakes; traditional afternoon tea items. My friends ended up getting a takeaway box as we were all so stuffed. You will leave this experience, with a *very* full belly, a warmed heart and a desire to return very soon.  All in all, fantastic place, with wonderful staff and delicious food, cocktails and teas. 100% will return one day,

title: Great Fosters Hotel, Ethan, Surrey
comment: I recently visited this historic hotel for afternoon tea for two special birthdays. It was absolutely delightful & the staff extremely attentive. I have been to a number of afternoon teas but this one rated highly.

title: Beautiful hotel, special occasion afternoon tea
comment: We attended for a family birthday celebration. We were seated in the lounge area, which was very comfy and the table beautifully laid out. We ordered traditional afternoon tea, with special G and Tea, and Pimms, plus a selection of teas. The sandwich selection was very good, although the smoked salmon sandwiches did run out. We were offered second helpings of the other sandwiches. The scones were good, although not served warm. We did have to ask for extra cream and jam. The Victoria Sandwich was fine. The fine patisserie was very good, especially rhubarb macaron. We did get a refill of the teapot, but no extra milk. Our sitting was 4.30pm and after about 5.15pm service was non-existent. We packed up any left over patisserie ourselves and went to pay at the main reception, so that was a bit odd. Afterwards, we had a walk in the garden, which was lovely.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: On Sunday we took my daughter & boyfriend for an afternoon tea at this gorgeous hotel. We’ve had several here already but was first time for them.  It was a lovely sunny day so were seated out in the garden which was great but a little bit windy. The afternoon tea was delicious as ever with plenty of tasty sandwiches, were offered more after the original ones,a wide variety of cakes, so much so that we had to bring some home. After a walk round the pretty gardens was needed. We all thoroughly enjoyed our experience, the staff were friendly and attentive. Can definitely recommend here for afternoon tea, we will be back.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: My son booked this for my wife's birthday treat, so four of us had a great afternoon tea. With two of us vegetarian we had a good selection of sandwiches, loads of tea and refill of sandwiches! Then came the cakes, wow, lovely cakes, more tea and boxes to take home any cakes unfinished. Then offered coffees too. Service was excellent, Camilo our main waiter and the two boys with the cakes added to a great experience in the Tudor room. Not sure about the weekends but Would certainly Recommend a weekday as we went on a Tuesday and it was not busy so giving a lovely relaxed atmosphere. Finished off with a little candle lit cake for my wife as Camilo had found out it was her birthday treat, a nice touch. Yes, highly recommended for a feast of treats. The hotel is a historic building with delightful gardens and plenty of parking. A most enjoyable afternoon tea in real english style.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: The hotel is a stunning building with lots of history. We went for afternoon tea and service was excellent. All were very attentive with a friendly professional approach. Beautiful sandwiches and cakes with a lovely glass of bubbly. 2 of our children had nut allergies and were very well looked after. Will definitely go again.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: We visited 10th March, our table was booked for Aug 15.30pm. The building is extremely old, with plenty of character. Excellent decor throughout, very clean. We arrived early but was shown to our table within minutes. Our waiter was very polite and helpful. Selection of sandwiches, cakes, tea and coffee was very good. We accompanied ours with 2 bottles of wine. Having booked the last seating time was ideal as there was no rush to leave as our table wasn't needed. Service was excellent. No negative comments to make at all would recommend and visit again.

title: Disappointing 21st Birthday Treat
comment: The setting was fabulous but despite handing over a voucher clearly stating it was a 21st birthday gift not one staff congratulated my daughter. The tea the waiter poured accidentallly spilt on myself and the tablecloth and this was just covered up by another waiter putting another folded cloth over the spill - not even an offer of a cloth to wipe my trousers!  We had to ask for refills for tea and still then had to wait a while .  A real shame as the place was very quiet on a wet Friday afternoon and the experience could have been so much better .  Certainly not recommended as a “treat”

title: Lovely but expensive
comment: Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters is lovely but rather expensive and probably something you would only do for special occasions. Food was very good and very tasty and more than enough for two. This was a present from my husband, who opted for the Champagne afternoon tea - as a previous reviewer said, for an extra £12 each, you only get a very small glass of champagne. Probably not worth the extra. Service was great, nothing was too much trouble. Surroundings very nice - take time before or after your meal to take a walk around the grounds, unfortunately it was dark by the time we had finished so missed out on this experience. Overall a very pleasant couple of hours eating cake - who could ask for more.

title: A treat - but expensive
comment: We attended for Mothers Day for Afternoon, it is a lovely place with great grounds to explore. The afternoon tea it's self was nice, the basic option of £30 is reasonable, but if you want a sparkling wine (cheapest alcohol option), it is £42, which is £12 for the single glass you get - which is very expensive. The staff were kind and did a good job. Overall a nice experience, but would have felt better coming out thinking we got more value for money.

title: 100th Birthday Tea Party
comment: 19 Family and close friends celebrated my father's 100th Birthday on Saturday with a fabulous Champagne Afternoon Tea in the Anne Boleyn Room. That Room is ideal for such an occasion with the open fire blazing and the comfortable seating creating a relaxed atmosphere. The staff were really friendly and attentive but not overly so, just quietly very efficient. The variety of teas, coffees and chocolates catered for all tastes as did the sandwiches and cakes. Sandwiches were restocked quietly and without fuss and most of us had to resort to rescue boxes to take the remaining cakes home at the end of our time.

title: Afternoon tea ..but we also had dinner a few days earlier
comment: As occasional dining visitors, we had a voucher for Afternoon Tea so took the opportunity last Thursday.  The Drawing Room was quiet but comfortable and we had the bay window sofa awaiting us. Lovely surroundings but slightly stiff in atmosphere.  Driving precluded the alcohol so we were straight into the finger sandwiches followed by the cake stand. Standard choices, smoked salmon, roast beef, egg, cucumber etc. but very tasty and refills if you can manage. Scones with jam and clotted cream, Victoria sponge, mini cakes and tarts. I had a sugar-free stand although I still found it too sweet for my taste - but filling to the point of doggy bags. However, I found the sugar-free raspberry jam for the scones was very nice, fresh and true to the natural fruit. Teas from an excellent choice - with regular topping up and refills by the server and every attention to our requirements. Service was excellent. Dinner in the Estate Grill on Saturday evening was very busy but one we often enjoy. On this occasion, for me, the menu choices were not quite so appealing, neither starters nor main course, but there is always the Butchers Block, Josper steak and lobster to fall back on. Some dishes didn't quite work as hoped for us but we always enjoy the opulent Tudor setting and surroundings. The dishes are beautifully presented, the food is fresh and excellent quality and service is always first class.  It is moderately expensive but reflects the nature of the hotel and setting and to be honest is not so different from many quality restaurants nor hotels for afternoon tea and there is a bonus to be seen in the grounds. Can't wait for Spring and Summer. We will continue to enjoy the occasional lunch, dinner or tea and especially the beautiful setting.  The ratings and answers are for the Afternoon Tea.

title: Baby shower afternoon tea
comment: A perfect afternoon tea at great fosters on Saturday for a close friends baby shower celebrations. We sat in the cocktail bar away from the lovely open fire, nothing was said to prompt staff to plug a discreet heater next to our table but they did anyway so temperature was perfect for an unexpected cold and snowy spring day! Sandwiches were lovely as were the cakes, plenty for all. The staff were lovely from the moment we arrived and a special mention needs to be given to Casper, such a lovely man and made our afternoon with his humor. This was my third time visiting and will 100% re attend.

title: Birthday afternoon tea
comment: Lovely afternoon tea, sandwiches were delicious,and the cakes yummy, didn’t have enough room for them all, we managed to take home the ones we couldn’t eat. All staff members we came in contact with were all very polite and helpful. My only negative comment would be the atmosphere of the room, due to the weather we had over the last few days, many customers had cancelled there afternoon teas, with only 3 couples in the room it was very quite, i do feel you would benefit with some light music playing in the background, just to take the edge off. Also it’s nice for the staff to have some noise to zone into on quite days like our one. Grounds looked lovely, but with the temperatures so cold outside it wasn’t ideal for us and our small baby. One of our close friend gets married here next year October 2019, looking forward to returning back then.

title: Afternoon Tes
comment: Five of us went for afternoon tea. The welcome was extremely friendly. The food was wonderful. They could not have done enough for us without being too pushy. We will definitely be going again. It was a realt.

title: Afternoon tea from Heaven
comment: We decided to have an impromptu afternoon tea yesterday, rang Great Fosters and they accommodate us within half an hour. We had a walk in the fantastic grounds while our table was being prepared and then the feast for eyes and taste buds promptly began. The champagne, the food and the teas are simply celestial.

title: When in England
comment: A real English treat. Afternoon tea as it should be. More food than one can possibly eat served with a choice of wonderful teas, in a cosy sitting room with views to the amazing garden. Attentive service. Loved it!

title: Baby shower cream tea
comment: It's undoubtedly a beautiful venue, but as a veteran of this place my recent visit wasn't all I had hoped for. And this seems to be the trend in recent years. It was a special treat for myself and three friends to celebrate two babies on the way and have a well earned mummy break from our toddlers at home. The main issue is the 2 hr slot window they now work off, as you are just left feeling like your on a conveyor belt, which shouldn't be the case for the £30 a head classic cream tea. The cakes took over an hour to get out to us. Tea replacements had to be chased. The place was packed as usual with the added pressure of a wedding going on else where in the building. We thought we'd been offered an extension to 4pm due to the delay. But this was just a misinformed member of staff and we were thrown off the table by a senior member of staff. I appreciate this is the system but a 2 hour slot is not long enough. 2.5hr perhaps? The other issue was communication - I had called ahead and asked if we could do anything special to the table as was informed I would only be permitted up to 2 balloons and nothing else. A well meaning customer service agent did offer to do two chocolate plates with 'congratulations' which I confirmed on the day, but these never appeared. Rather embarrassingly as the host, I arrived to find a friends husband had arranged beautiful flowers from a local florist and a bottle of champagne from the venue as a surprise for his pregnant wife. So very thoughtful, but it would have been great if the venue had mentioned this had been arranged when I called in that day. Would the venue not benefit from supplying 'venue appropriate' bespoke packages for special events i.e. extended table sittings and tastefully themed decoration options for baby showers or birthdays? Food for thought...

title: Great Afternoon Tea!
comment: Everything from the setting to the sandwiches to the service was excellent! There was a lovely selection of freshly prepared sandwiches (vegetarian option was also very good) with re-fills offered once we had cleared our plates. The scones were also warm, one with fruit and one plain, served with generous portions of clotted cream and jam. The cakes were delicious with a mini Victoria sponge (large enough for 2/3) and small cakes including macaroons and chocolate delights! There was a varied and interesting selection of teas and coffee with re-fills swiftly provided on request. All in all a thoroughly lovely couple of hours spent at this very interesting building and gardens and left with a doggy bag as we could not get through it all.

title: Afternoon birthday teas for two friends
comment: Lovely warm venue with great atmosphere, wonderful staff and food. Waited on hand and foot! My two friends also thought it was a lovely treat.

title: A special birthday
comment: The afternoon tea was excellent, and on par with the best I've had at other locations. What makes this extra special is the setting. There are lots of little places to snuggle into. The grounds are stunning where you can walk off a few of those calories. Parking not an issue. A beautiful old hotel that is worth checking out. The bedrooms are unique (four poster bed). Definitely worth a visit.

title: Fantastic Birthday Treat
comment: I took my husband for his birthday. The setting is beautiful, and the staff were very attentive - Miguel who looked after us was great! The food was the best we have had at an afternoon tea, and the Victoria sponge was the star of the show. My husband was also given an extra birthday treat which was a lovely touch. Thanks Great Fosters!

title: Christmas present that I saved for special occasion.
comment: My Husband and I went on a very quiet Tuesday afternoon, as that happened to be his birthday and our Wedding Anniversary. We were the only people there for afternoon tea. The service was very good and I mentioned that it was my Husband's birthday and an extra little cake appeared with a candle in it. The sandwiches were ok, the bread on some were a little dry and the fillings not particularly to our taste but we ate them all the same. The English Breakfast Tea was nice and strong, just how we like it and we had two pots of that. The Scones and cakes are absolutely delicious and we took home the ones we didn't have room for. The grounds of the Hotel looked very pretty with the dusting of snow that we'd had.

title: What a Letdown.Awfull.
comment: My wife wanted an afternoon tea at Great Fosters as a part of her birthday present. Booked afternoon tea for 2 expecting it to be in one of the "period rooms"We were taken to a room with no character and sat at a table for 2 which clearly looked too small.We elected to have an afternoon tea with a glass of Nyetimber Sparkling wine .This was £12.00 more than the standard tea price.We had half a "stingy" glass each.The tea was nothing special but each different serving had a different waiter,each being cringingly polite.The bill also added a 10% service charge, as my wife has been a waitress we always leave a tip but at Great Fosters we would not have left a tip as the whole experience was not worth the money.I would not recommend anybody to have an afternoon tea at this place .

title: Great afternoon tea
comment: Had afternoon tea as a Christmas gift from children but have been here many times over the years. A lovely setting. Best visited in summer for afternoon tea.  The Tidor rooms are superb for dinner if you can get a reservation.

title: Wake
comment: The Woodman provided a lovely buffet for a recent wake.  Limitless tea & coffee was available, wide variety of sandwiches and other bits. The room was a perfect size for a small gathering with use of your own bar, with separate toilets. Would definitely recommend. Thank you

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: It was a cold snowy day on the 2nd March 2018. We decided to go to have Champagne Afternoon Tea which was very nice.  Great Fosters was very quiet and due to this I felt a little lacking in atmosphere,the bar was a little cold but the staff were very helpful Casper was brilliant and made us feel very welcomed.  I think I would like to try it in the summer when you could sit outside in the gardens and feel the warmth of the sun.

title: Lovely visit
comment: Beautiful venue weather not good so didn’t look around the grounds. Afternoon Tea exceptional, good variety of finger sandwiches and offered more if required. Lovely scones with jam and cream plus a small Victoria sandwich yum. The little cakes were really good. Couldn’t eat everything so was supplied with boxes to bring remainder home. Well recommended.

title: Beautiful
comment: Had my wedding here and since have returned many time, I love everything about this place, the only nick is sometimes the staff aren’t always 100% happy rep help

title: Delightful
comment: Afternoon tea at Great Fosters was a truly special experience. The service and food were top notch.  If you need gluten-free, as does my husband, they accommodate brilliantly. My husband thoroughly enjoyed the sandwiches as well as the pastries. They were very high quality.

title: Great
comment: We had a lovely time. But unfortunately we both found the room to be very cold as the heaters were not on or the fires were not on either

title: Delicious and abundant afternoon tea!
comment: Excellent service and a superb offering of exquisite cakes and sandwiches, served by a welcoming real fire and with a beautiful view of the stunning gardens.

title: Gluten Free - absolute delicious
comment: This was just as wonderful as we hoped it would be - me and my Mum came to pretend to be ladies for the afternoon.... we both had the gluten free option and it was very good. We had 10 sandwiches (yep I know!) and the cakes were generally fantastic - we ate them all, no lie. The scones were fab and the only thing that I thought could have done with a little extra love was the Victoria Sponge - the cream and jam were delicious but the sponge could have been a bit lighter but it's gluten free so this is generally what happens lol!  All in all fantastic, with great service and in a lovely setting! Thanks for a wonderful afternoon!

title: Birthday Celebration with an Afternoon Tea
comment: We celebrated my wife's birthday with an Afternoon Tea . The venue is stunning and the food was excellent. The staff were very helpful and friendly. I would highly recommend Great Fosters.

title: Outstanding
comment: We went to great fosters for my sisters 50th birthday, we had afternoon tea and it was as usual outstanding, the attention to detail was first class, we were all very well looked after by the staff and the quality was superb, we had drinks afterwards in front of the fire in the main hall and felt very relaxed throughout, never hurried and nothing was too much trouble.

title: Nice place, service could of been more consistent
comment: Came her with four teenagers and two adults. Lots of staff on reception to see us to the table. Seated at the table with a nice view of the ornamental pond (it was getting late so the view was gone in about half and hour). I have been here before anyway. The gardens are worth a wander around but unsurprisingly the teenage contingent were not that bothered. It took a while for someone to come and take our order and when I mentioned that one of the children could not do any sandwiches with mayonnaise the staff were not particularly forthcoming in offering suggestions. If you have people that are picky with fillings on sandwiches, the hotel doesn't seem that able to do a simple cheese or ham sandwich (this option was not offered to us). Teas and drinks were ordered but we had already eaten the sandwiches before the tea and hot chocolates arrived. When the hot chocolates did arrive they were luke warm as they had been obviously sitting for a while on the counter top. However, once these issues were sorted, we had a huge amount of food. We had additional sandwiches, beautiful scones and lovely raspberry jam. The cakes were plentiful and we were offered more tea whenever we wished. We even took home cardboard boxes filled with cakes. The setting was lovely, the room really nice, but some of the service and problem solving could of been better. I would recommend the venue for afternoon tea, my comment would be for this star of hotel a bit of flexibility would of been helpful. It would of been nice to have some water on the table for all the guests.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: We arrived early but this was not a problem. Sitting by a lovely roaring fire, after a morning spent walking in the cold, was wonderful. We were called to our table and seated by the window facing the impressive grounds. From beginning to end it was a very relaxing afternoon. The sandwiches were each on different breads and all delicious and, to our sons delight, were replenished. To follow a very inviting cake stand comprising warm scones, a Victoria sponge cake and a selection of mini cakes most of which we took home as we were so full after the Victoria sponge. The service was impeccable, not rushed and served with a smile. My only gripe was the flavouring of the mini cakes. One was liquorice and the lemon meringue and the ginger cake only raced of mixed spice. This in no way spoiled our tea. I would highly recommend going here. We are now planning a weekend stay here later in the year.

title: Fantastic service in a lovely traditional bar
comment: We were looking for a traditional pub to hold the wake after my mum’s funeral and the funeral director recommended the Woodman. We’re so glad she did as the location of the pub in relation to the crematorium was ideal, particularly for family and friends who didn’t know the area. Steve and his team were fantastic, both in helping us to prepare a really memorable event and also on the day when they provided great service and excellent food and drinks. We were able to add many personal touches on the day, such as our own music and photos and many of our guests commented on how we couldn’t have found a nicer, more traditional venue. I highly recommend this venue.

title: Thankyou
comment: We held my fathers funeral here last thursdayand the day was made so much easier by the five star service given by the team.The room was so warm and welcoming and it was lovely to be able to add our own personal touches such as personal photos and running photos on the tv using USB. The food provided was excellent and I cannot thank Louise enough for her kind attention.It made a difficult day so much better.Everybody said how lovely it was. Woodman is such a lovely traditional pub.Thanks again to all at the Woodman.

title: Wonderful afternoon tea for birthday celebration
comment: We enjoyed a wonderful afternoon tea at Great Fosters on Saturday afternoon. This was for a special birthday celebration and our experience certainly lived up to expectations. The historic atmosphere of the hotel, delicious food, and excellent service are perfect for a special occasion. All the special requests we had made beforehand were remembered and we can highly recommend the gluten free afternoon tea which is among the best, if not the best, we have ever had.

title: Great stay / Excellent service
comment: I booked the hotel as a surprise for my wife for our wedding anniversary and I have to say a big heart fell thank you to the staff members and service my wife and I received.  We arrived to a warm welcome at reception, we had a few questions about the grounds which were answered and we were shown around . We had afternoon tea in the main room , and I have to say I throughly enjoyed the selection of sandwiches and cakes, the variety and gluten free range was excellent. The team were very friendly and courteous. They made us feel very special and at the end they surprised us with a cake as it was our anniversary. We continued our stay with a lovely walk in the grounds followed by dinner which was excellent, the service we received was first class. A special thanks to the restaurant manager who was aware we were not drinking that day but gave us a bottle to take away as a gift. Would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Afternoon Tea - Disappointing
comment: Unfortunately the sandwiches whilst looking nice didn't match on taste. No seasoning or individual flavouring was evident. The mince pies looked like the foil had been taken off them out of a box. The eclairs looked shop bought with a fancy chocolate sheet added. The scones were nice and warm. My tea cup on arrival was stained all around the inside and was changed. Service was personal, friendly, polite and professionally delivered. The hotel inside and out was gorgeous but the food was underwhelming.

title: A refined Afternoon Tea experience on the outskirts of London
comment: Great Fosters feels surprisingly secluded despite being located close to the M25. First impressions of the hunting lodge are impressive. The reception hall in this Tudor manor provides a wonderful introduction and setting for your Afternoon Tea experience. Once comfortably sat in the Anne Boleyn room, opposite a working fireplace, it was easy to switch off and enjoy the surroundings. Service was attentive and friendly. The array of sandwiches, cakes and teas was excellent.  Following the Afternoon Tea try to fit in a walk around the well presented gardens.

title: Great venue for afternoon tea
comment: We brought my in laws here to celebrate his 90th birthday and were blown away by the service and ambience. The food was delightful and generous, with a great choice of teas. They also took the trouble to bring a mini cake with a candle for the birthday boy! He really enjoyed himself and we will definitely be back.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: Wonderful hotel for afternoon tea beautiful Georgian interior . We sat in a cosy lounge and enjoyed good sandwich’s and cakes so much we took boxes of cakes home! Only disappointing aspect was being charged £16 for a couple of plain ham and cheese sandwich’s for my daughter who is 2!! Given there were 3 adults and we were offered seconds of pre made sandwiches I personally feel they could have offer the extra sandwiches as a complimentary gesture or a nominal charge. Other than that impeccable service and quality throughout. Will most certainly return in the spring.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: Absolutely beautiful Afternoon! Service was amazing and food was to the highest standard and plentiful, great surroundings and just lovely. Thank you to Miguel and all the team at Great Fosters for making my daughter's birthday memorable.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: I purchased this voucher as a birthday present for two people, subsequently increased to four by the recipient. Apparently that all greatly enjoyed the experience. Thank you and best regards.

title: Delicious afternoon tea in a gorgeous setting.
comment: We had a beautiful afternoon for a friend's special birthday. The food was delicious, the service and staff were fantastic and it was in the most beautiful setting. I would definitely recommend it and shall be returning. Thank you for a memorable afternoon.

title: Excellent afternoon
comment: A lovely afternoon in a beautiful building. The staff were so welcoming and friendly. Would highly recommend and would go again.

title: Very helpful and accommodating for both local and visiting customers.
comment: As with many reviewers we visited this small lovely local pub after attending the nearby crematorium yesterday. Due to it's close proximity it is a popular venue for visitors to the crematorium, so half of the pub was already booked for a wake which only left the other smaller half available. Despite it being busy and packed with customers, the helpful staff were more than happy to provide our party of fifteen with drinks all round and also a wide range of very freshly-made sandwiches which were truly delicious. What was also impressive was that the locals were very tolerant of (and probably used to) the continual flow and ebb of non-regulars from the crematorium and the atmosphere was friendly and welcoming. The pub and the toilets were spotless and empty glasses and crockery were almost instantly collected so that the tables were clean and ready for use again. There are also seats and tables outside the pub which would be lovely in good weather. The prices, range and excellent quality of refreshments on offer were very fair and fresh and I applaud the Woodman for their faultless customer service, and their honesty and not taking advantage of their location by serving poor highly priced produce to a captive clientele. I would certainly recommend this pub and will certainly make a trek back to sample their fare in happier times.

title: Slow slow service
comment: Given that all the food is pre prepared, it was very slow service for us and others in the room. Some people got sandwiches before drinks, we were offered more sandwiches before we had even got drinks or the first serving of sandwiches. Nice staff but customer service just too slow. Expected better from 4 star hotel. Couple in room got a freebie anniversary cake which was nice.

title: Special afternoon tea
comment: Having spent a wonderful afternoon celebrating a friend’s 98th birthday I wanted to leave a review as the attention we received at Great Fosters was fantastic. Staff were exceptional and the selection of teas and variety of cakes was just lovely. Thank you Great Fosters for a fabulous afternoon.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: We came for the afternoon tea. Everything was totally perfect. We felt so comfortable and relaxed. After tea we had a walk in the beautiful garden. We love the place and will definitely come back soon!

title: 5* Afternoon Tea
comment: Great Afternoon Tea for five girls to celebrate Christmas early. Beautiful surroundings, friendly helpful staff, endless supply of tea, superb scones, classy little cakes, great ambience in a beautiful room with a log fire. Very impressive house and grounds which you must wander around. Very impressed with this visit and I go on quite a few Afternoon Teas, surprised it was only £30 as I have paid more at other hotels . Well done to the staff, will definitely return, thank you.

title: Amazing Afternoon Tea at The Great Fosters
comment: The food was delicious especially the salmon in their own beetroot bread. Lovely atmosphere, magnificent building, friendly staff an all round brilliant afternoon.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: I had a lovely time during my Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters. We were located in the cocktail bar with an incredible view on the Hotel's gardens. Amazing and well prepared staff, a special thanks goes to Casper our lovely waiter that took care of me and my family. I hardly raccomend it to everybody!!

title: Anniversary afternoon tea
comment: We were married at Great Fosters 2 years ago and decided to have afternoon tea to celebrate our wedding anniversary along with my parents and 4 month old baby. Excellent service and especially happy to have been seated in the Tudor room which is beautiful. Great and plentiful choice of sandwiches, scones and patisserie along with a large selection of teas. Really enjoyable and can't wait to return next year!

title: Excellent service
comment: When you have a function to plan, this pub took all of the hard work out of it for us. We held a wake there for approx 50 people and I cannot thank the team enough there, especially Steve and Louise. Nothing was too much trouble. The food was excellent, and plenty of it. Cannot recommend enough.

title: Excellent afternoon tea
comment: The afternoon tea was first class which we enjoyed in the quiet and historical surroundings of the old building.  Plenty of free parking was an added bonus. We had booked in advance and were able to select a time convenient for us and strongly recommend this rather than just arriving. We were greeted and shown to our table which had been prepared ready for us.  After placing our order the tea and sandwiches arrived promptly, followed by cakes and scones. We were offered more sandwiches and certainly felt very satisfied with the quality and quantity. We didn’t feel rushed and in all we stayed for about 2 hours, allowing time to relax, chat and admire the surroundings. Ideal for a special occasion or a treat with family or friends.

title: Delightful afternoon tea!
comment: I absolutely love this hotel. The service is second to none, such high professional quality. The staff are so welcoming, friendly and really make you feel comfortable and at ease. We enjoying the traditional afternoon tea. There was an excellent range of finger sandwiches and plenty of them. Followed by warm plain and fruit scones, jam and thick cream. Then there was a small whole Victoria sandwich and some small festive cakes to end. Plenty of fresh tea or coffee. All very tasty and great to look at in detail. Would highly recommend for a chilled afternoon. Great view across the garden and beyond.

title: Birthday treat
comment: From beginning to end, lovely service and wonderful food... Next time it will be a presecco afternoon tea, thank you

title: Thank you
comment: Attended a wake for a very dear friend last week, and I cannot thank the staff at the Woodman for their kindness. The room was cosy with its own little bar and facilities. The food was excellent and the staff could not have been more helpful or attentive. Thank you all for making a very difficult occasion so much easier.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: A party of six, including my mother who was with us for a few days and and a suggestion of our youngest daughter who said “Nan likes afternoon tea”, our visit to Great Forsters was “exceptional” or as described by my mother as “a wonderful afternoon, the best afternoon tea I have ever had”. Yes, it might appear more expensive than some of the venues in and around Windsor that offer afternoon tea, but only a short drive (from Windsor) where we had a great, varied selection of sandwiches, scones, and an amazing selection of cakes. The service we had through the afternoon was excellent. So all good, quality of food with “volume”, a fantastic setting in an informal dining area/drawing room and service to compliment.

title: 70th Birthday Treat
comment: Had a lovely Cream Tea treat for my birthday. Loads of really lovely sandwiches and cakes came out really stuffed and happy!. Staff were really pleasant and helpful and had a lovely walk around the beautiful grounds

title: Perfect location, excellent service and quality food!
comment: Afternoon tea at Great Fosters should never be rushed. It is a truly memorable place to meet friends or entertain

title: Delicious
comment: Top class food and teas. Great selection, superb quality. The location is exquisite and relaxing at the same time. Dress up, doll up and enjoy the spectacular setting.

title: Baby Shower
comment: Had a lovely afternoon tea celebrating my friends baby shower. Very accommodating when helping with hosting the shower. Food and cake was lovely. A beautiful venue with great service.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: As ever a delightful afternoon tea at Great Fosters. My friends had not been before but now can’t wait to return. All the staff are so welcoming and nothing is too much trouble. Lovely roaring log fires, beautiful building and delightful grounds. The sandwiches, scones,Victoria sponge and individual cakes were amazing. We couldn’t finish it all but they bring boxes so you can take them home to enjoy later. Best afternoon tea for miles around. Cannot be beaten.

title: Mum and daughter Afternoon tea
comment: What a great way to spend a wet Monday afternoon. The hotel is so pretty at this time of year. We were booked for an afternoon tea. Good choice of tea and the sandwiches and cakes were lovely we even took a doggy bag home The staff where very friendly and looked after us. Would recommend this as a treat.

title: Great Fosters really pays attention to detail!
comment: The 6 of us meet up for Afternoon tea every year at a different venue. Great Fosters Afternoon tea was one of the best experiences we have had. Every aspect was excellent: the placing of the extra large serviettes, the serving of the tea, the cake stands and the description of each tea treat on the stands. The atmosphere was warm and cosy too.

title: AfternoonTea
comment: Really impressed with the whole experience. Staff were very courteous and helpful. Went as part of our 10th wedding anniversary and what a great Choice that was ! We sat outside and enjoyed the gardens to their full glory . Will definitely go back, a real gem !!

title: "A Superb Afternoon Treat"
comment: Had the most amazing afternoon tea. From the minute we arrived we felt throughly spoilt and the food was so delicious. The staff were all very welcoming & attentive. We had exquisite finger sandwiches which were replenished with more tea & latte's. The cakes & scones were superb. Such a relaxing afternoon & it was nice to dress up too. Will defintely be going back again. Thank you

title: Gerri+ Nick
comment: We held a wake for John on 21st March, the event went without a hitch due to the attention to detail by Steve and his lovely staff. From the first phone call to book the venue to day of the wake nothing was to much trouble with every request we made being answered with yes of course we can. The welcome was really warm + friendly the food was excellent and plentiful with all dietary needs catered for . A lot of our guests commented on the amount, quality and variety of the food. There is also a good choice of well kept beer + real ales. A big thank you to the Woodman. A ***** pub.

title: Five Stars Plus
comment: We held my sister in law's wake at The Woodman this week. It went like clockwork and we can't praise the staff enough for the friendly caring service and attention to detail. We would never have thought of showing photographs on the TV screen or having background music, but Annette suggested we try both and they worked out very well. The room was perfect for the occasion, the food excellent, and the bar prices fair. They all did an amazing job guiding us through a stressful time. Nothing was too much trouble. A very big thanks to Annette, Gemma, Louise, Paige, and of course Steve for making a sad occasion a pleasant experience. A lovely professional team who could teach others a lesson or two. Linda

title: Disappointed
comment: To start with the positives the setting was lovely and the food was of good quality. Service was a bit of hit and miss and the staff did not seem to communicate very well with each other. This was meant to be a treat for my 82 year old mother, who lives abroad and was visiting for the weekend. We arrived on time and had to wait for our table to be set up, which we would not have minded if at the end of the two hour slot we were not being rushed to leave. We ordered a Pimms afternoon tea, but the Pimms did not arrive until about twenty minutes after the sandwiches and tea. So we were already in the middle of eating sandwiches and drinking tea when we were finely able to have a toast. We asked the waiter for a couple extra sandwiches, which took so long to arrive that the other waitress assumed we had finished and started clearing our plates. Having to wait for the sandwiches meant we had less time left for cakes and only managed to eat one each when the waitress asked if she could put the rest in a box for us, gently hinting we should have been finishing by now. A few minutes later the waiter reminded us our two hour slot was up so I asked for the bill, coats and tried to get mum, who was still finishing her tea, out of the bar area as quickly as possible. Luckily, my mum, who does not speak much English, did not fully understand what was going on, but I was deeply disappointed with the experience.

title: Cosy atmosphere, with great service!
comment: Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters was an absolute delight! Not only do the rooms have a cosy vibe but the service was excellent. Our tea pots were filled up when neccesaary, and they were more than happy to top up the sandwiches. On another note, if anyone gets a chance check out the grounds..they are beautiful! Overall a lovely experience & would go back again :)

title: Must-do if you're in London (or west of London)
comment: Excellent - as ever. We also treat my parents to afternoon tea here when we are back in UK visiting. Service, food, setting all impeccable. The staff deserve special praise - super-professional without being stuffy. It's great for families as well (provided you watch the nippers so they don't fall in the moat) - there's space for them to run off steam, and look out for the koi carp in the moat. Tip: if you get a late-afternoon booking, they might well offer you extra sandwiches! (As everything is made fresh day to day)

title: Lovely Afternoon Tea for Two Treat
comment: I bought this for my husband for our anniversary and we really enjoyed it. Really lovely sandwiches and hot scones and cream and so many gorgeous cakes like works of art. We sat in the cocktail room which overlooks the garden which was cosy. Only the early tea sittings are in the tudor room. The staff were friendly and attentive.

title: Amazing service in beautiful grounds
comment: Amazing service in beautiful grounds We had afternoon tea & the staff couldn't have been more attentive Everything was delicious & a tour of the grounds was a wonderful way to relax. I will be back asap!

title: Birthday Treat
comment: A hotel that actually listened to our needs prior to our arrival. Baby's high chair sorted, menu requirements sorted. Casper our waiter, catered for all our needs. Good variety of sandwiches and refills. Tea and Coffee replenished as and when needed Fresh scones, mini Victoria sponge and a great selection of cakes. Poor weather meant we were unable to walk around the splendid grounds Fourth time at this hotel for afternoon tea and will be returning soon.

title: Special 57th anniversary tea,
comment: Very enjoyable tea. Very friendly welcoming staff, will definitely go again. Also looked at Gardens which were very interesting and appreciated view of Building.

title: varied selection of sandwiches and beautifully crafted cakes
comment: My partner and I took afternoon tea in the Tudor Room which is a very beautiful old room with a marvellous tapestry. the sandwiches were wll presented and of good quality and varity including the artisan bread. The cakes were quite artistically prepared - the bana one was particulaly delicious. the choice of teas was not wide but satisfactory.

title: Afternoon Tea at the Great Fosters
comment: Overall, the atmosphere and scenery was amazing! However, i wasn't impressed with the service. I felt like they forgot we were there- we had to ask for more tea/coffee and for them to bring the cakes out. We felt like we were waiting for ages until our food was brought out to us. Considering we spent a lot of money for afternoon tea - this did affect my overall experience and I wasn't very satisfied. I also felt like you do not get a lot of food for what you pay.

title: An elegant and relaxed afternoon tea
comment: We were a party of 4 and we enjoyed a delicious afternoon tea in beautiful surroundings. Despite lingering over our drinks, sandwiches and yummy cakes, we were not made to feel rushed into leaving; thank you. A bonus was being handed the cakes we hadn't eaten; something to enjoy later. Highly recommend especially for a special occasion or a treat for overseas visitors.

title: afternoon tea
comment: Excellent service and definitely 5 star service. Arranged for afternoon tea for 2 adults and 2 children 9 and 6. The kids loved it. The staff could not do enough to accommodate them; from providing specific sandwiches for fussy kids and umbrellas for them to continue to play in the maze. The staff anticipated our needs before we even asked. Couldn't fault the service, presentation or food. This is the first time i have ever felt the need to give a review. Would recommend without hesitation.

title: Elizabethan charm
comment: This place is so beautiful. Such an amazing history. Over the years Great Fosters has worked hard to mix the history with commercial reality. At one time it kept monkeys in the garden. I used to swim in the unheated open air swimming pool. How,I would have loved a high tea after the cold. I so love the afternoon tea , served with elegant grace. ,

title: Excellent afternoon tea in a fantastic setting
comment: We had a family celebration - 5 of us - 1 'normal', 2 vegetarians and 2 vegans, so we returned to Great Fosters for afternoon tea (we've been several times, always an absolute delight). We booked a couple of weeks in advance. The building is stunning, both inside and out, and the beautiful gardens - worth coming early and having a wander round first. The various rooms used for afternoon tea are spacious, with comfortable armchairs and sofas around the tables. It's also relaxingly quiet, so easy to have conversations without having to raise your voice over intrusive music or echos from reflective surfaces. Service is impeccable and attentive; nothing is too much trouble. The range of teas is extensive and exciting, sandwich fillings are perfect, and each one is in a different type of bread. The cakes are just delicate, beautiful and tasty. The vegetarian and vegan options are equally wonderful.There's always more than one can eat, and it's assumed you'll take the remainder home as cake cartons are brought to the table without asking. And you don't have to worry bout how much to tip; 10% service is included in the bill. Finally, whatever time you book for, you have the table for 2 hours.

title: Afternoon tea at GF
comment: We were welcomed at the front door, introduced to the waiter and he was brilliant - as was the tea. He stated that we no doubt had breakfast tea so suggested we try another from the many on the menu. He helped explain the finer detail. The sandwiches came, they were excellent, the ham and mustard being the most disappointing, but the mustard was French so made a change. After emptying the plate, they produced a tray for us to select any more that we wanted. Then the cake stand arrived .... I better leave the rest as a surprise treat - you won't be disappointed !

title: Great food. Great service
comment: The tea was amazing. They even had a gluten free service for my daughter who was in heaven! More amazing was the manager walking outside with us and telling us about acres, moats, history, rooms, ownership, etc. Just a wonderful day in Surrey!

title: Afternoon Tea with history.
comment: A beautiful setting, excellent food and service and a thoroughly good afternoon. The staff are very attentive and friendly and we ate in a relaxed atmosphere. The house and grounds have a quiet, calming tone and you can feel the weight of history as soon as you walk in. A beautiful place to explore and eat fabulous food.

title: Great Fosters afternoon tea
comment: What a lovely afternoon spent with family at Great Fosters. The afternoon tea was fantastic in a historic setting. From the moment we were welcomed by the Managing Director, treated so well by the hotel staff, especially Emma, we all had a visit to remember again. We think one of the best afternoon teas in the country having tried many including in top hotels in London.

title: Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters
comment: Had Afternoon Tea with 5 colleagues to celebrate a forthcoming wedding in our team. Would totally recommend. We were all starving - since we had all skipped lunch and the staff were incredibly patient in bringing us extra sandwiches . The whole set up was wonderful - could not fault anything. The scones, jam and clotted cream were the best I have ever had. The cakes were incredibly sophisticated - very, very good value at £30 and we all then had 'doggy bags' to take home all the food we were unable to eat. Wow - would definitely be up for doing this again.

title: Lovely Afternoon Tea
comment: I visited Great Fosters for Afternoon Tea with my Friend to treat her for her Birthday. Last week 4th October. This was my 3rd visit for Afternoon Tea at this Hotel and again it did not disappoint. The Afternoon Tea is really lovely and I would recommend Great Fosters to my Friends. After you have finished with your Tea the hotel have really lovely landscaped Gardens to walk round

title: High tea like Henry VIII
comment: Wonderful historic building in manicured grounds. Excellent food and service. Takes you back in time. Expensive but worth the experience.

title: Special afternoon
comment: Lovely setting, staff were exceptional and the cakes amazing! Choice of teas and coffee, highly recommend!

title: Afternoon tea is just not the same
comment: We go to great fosters each year for an afternoon tea as it is so amazing however it has changed and although it’s nice it is no where near as good as it used to be. Our favourite part used to be the finger sandwiches, not only were they incredibly tasty you were also offered a second round. Instead of cucumber & cream cheese, ham & mustard, egg, salmon & cream cheese it’s now egg, salmon and capers, coronation chicken and cucumber. These are in rolls or very stodgy bread in the case of the cucumber roulade. These are the most disappointing aspect of it now. The scones and cakes continue to be nice. We used to take bits home but we finished it all today. Service was hit and miss, they were very attentive getting us sat down and serving the afternoon tea however we had to go and find someone for another pot of tea as no one re-appeared. Unfortunately this is a yearly tradition that will no longer happen. I wish I had checked the reviews before going to see that other people had experienced the same. If you’ve never been before it might be worth a visit (however it’s expensive) but if you’ve had an afternoon tea here before be prepared to be disappointed with the changes.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: What can I say great place nice grounds staff could be more friendly but was busy Did two types of sandwiches and cakes as wife does not do meat or dairy well worth the money

title: Will remember always
comment: We have become major fans of Great Fosters over the last decade and had our first afternoon tea there during this visit. The sumptuous and varied spread on three-tiered etageres compared well with tea at Raffles in Singapore and the Ritz-Carlton San Francisco, but exceeded both in the atmosphere of the Anne Boleyn room. Our only advice is not to plan dinner afterwards! Maybe a soup or salad at 9pm, but that's all. Oh, also, to include the champagne in the order.

title: Lovely
comment: We had a lovely afternoon tea. Good variety of sandwiches, really nice scones and a lovely Victoria sandwiches. Election of little cakes. Couldn't finish so brought some home in boxes! Staff very attentive without being obtrusive. Great day

title: Anniversary afternoon tea for two
comment: We had our wedding reception at Great Foster's 21 years ago, we had been given a gift for afternoon tea, so combined the two. We were seated outside, the service was fantastic, food was divine, they even presented us with extra cakes on a plate with Happy Anniversary decorated in chocolate.

title: Wonderful.
comment: Booked this for my sister's 50th birthday. We arrived at 2pm and left at 8pm, moved from the sumptuous lounge where we had a very generous afternoon tea, there is only a two hour sitting which wasn't enough for us as there was so much chatting and not enough eating / drinking going on, we were full by this stage so they boxed up the left overs for us in pretty little boxes and moved us and our drinks to the balcony as the weather was fine, the service / staff are amazing, so friendly and attentive and such a beautiful venue. Highly recommend it for a celebration or special occasion. Ok, so I'm vegan and my afternoon tea stand was a little less amazing and abundant than my friends, which was quite funny actually but there was definitely some effort and some yummy alternatives, actually I was full but didn't have any left overs like the others did, I've certainly had more disappointing vegan option experiences! Thank you for a lovely day from all of us.

title: Afternoon Tea for Four
comment: I was a bit sceptical about visiting Great Fosters, as on the outside it appears tailored to an older generation. However, I was really pleasantly surprised! The venue was easy to find, plenty of parking, the staff had a note of our reservation and took us straight through to our table which was already laid out for us. I was a little disappointed by the variety of teas available but the teas that we chose were all nice. One of our guests is dairy-free, which we detailed in the notes when I made the booking, and they brought out an entire set of sandwiches, cakes and scones specifically for her, without any dairy which was a really great touch. The food was really good quality, and there was plenty to eat. Personally, I didn't like all of the sandwich options, but they then brought a plate to select additional sandwiches with the fillings you liked best afterwards. We didn't manage to eat all of the cakes but they were more than happy to box them up for us when we asked. I would visit again for a special occasion.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Took my Mother for a belated birthday tea with some of the family. My niece is gluten free and they presented her with a great selection of cakes/sandwiches. We were meant to sit by the moat but typical British weather it rained. Not a problem for the Hotel they moved us to a lovely decorated private room. The service was excellent and plenty left over for us to take away in cute carry home boxes. I would DEFINATELY recommend this fantastic hotel for afternoon tea. Next time we are going to visit for lunch and visit on a sunny day to really take in the great views of the grounds ! Many thanks

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Excellent service from the moment we arrived until we left, food was well presented and plentiful if you wanted more. Setting was wonderful sitting out by the moat and wandering round the gardens after was an experience

title: Disappointed
comment: I've been to Great Fosters 3 times now for afternoon tea - the first 2 visits were so special, I've recommended it to many. However my last visit was a little disappointing. I'm hoping it was a one-off, and not that it's gone downhill.  The positives - polite and attentive staff, good food, beautiful building, and a lovely walk in the grounds afterwards.  The negatives - too-loud background music, which was turned down when we asked. - uncomfortable seating, with chair and sofa very different heights & not right for the low table (the chair was changed on request). - we asked for our tea to be served after our prosecco and it was served at the same time. - NOT ENOUGH CREAM for the scones in a cream tea!!!! We were served 6 scones and one small ball of clotted cream. We were served a second ball on request, but when we asked again we were told they had run out. So we ended up with scones and jam for our second round. It was mid afternoon, so I can't imagine what happened with later guests.  - and finally, one of the reasons I like the place so much is that they have always returned to the table with offers of more sandwiches, until you say 'enough'. This time we were only offered seconds of sandwiches, and then our plates were removed to bring out the cakes and scones.  All in all it felt a little less generous and special, not such good value for money (not cheap) & rather poorly organised.  Not so sure I'll be revisiting.

title: Birthday afternoon tea
comment: Fantastic. Three adults and three children were celebrating 3 birthdays. The setting was amazing, the tea was fabulous, the service was out of this world. Mr Richard Young and Olivia really couldn't have done anymore to enhance our experience. Old school service that can't be beaten. Thank you so much xxxx

title: Birthday tea
comment: We have enjoyed afternoon tea in many places over many years, and enjoy giving marks out of 10 for each. In over 30 years we have only given the full 10, 3 times, and the last was for Great Fosters. I honestly couldn't find a single thing that wasn't perfect, from the food to the tea and to the excellent service. You could show the best London hotels a thing or 2 ! ( I recently had tea at a 5 star hotel in London at great expense and gave it 7 ! ).Many thanks

title: Nice evening
comment: I recommend Sowa Restaurant. Delicious traditional food and lovely staff always smiling and helpful. Especially recommend Klaudia ❤️

title: Very unprofessional
comment: Unfortunately, once again Sowa showed a complete lack of professionalism. I booked a table for 10 people two weeks in advance. Five days before a lady called me asking if this booking is confirmed, because they have 10 other people eager to take this place (!?). For my own peace of mind I paid a deposit next day. On Sunday, the day of booking, we came to decorate the table for baby shower. There were only a handful of people in the restaurant, it was before 1pm and the restaurant wasn’t busy yet. I ordered a beer, but after 15 minutes I was still waiting. When asked I was told it’s being poured(!) While one of the girls was still eating a starter, the waitress came up to me asking if she can start serving main course (!) It still did not dawn on me that they were trying to get rid of us quickly.
