Everything cleared up a few minutes later, when the same waitress came up in the middle of our meal and quietly informed me that they have another reservation for 4pm and we were a little bit late ... I was astonished! True, some of our party was late (our pregnant girl with her sister and a friend. She’s forgiven, as she wasn’t feeling very well) but it does not mean that if they came on time we would have left earlier, which is what I said. The food was generally good, but some of the dishes were lukewarm rather than hot. It was a baby shower and apart from lunch, we had planned various games and were not in a hurry to leave, especially since some of the girls came from quite far. The waitress was nice and I suppose it was not her fault she had to tell me what she did, but an hour or so later we heard her apologize to the table next to us, saying 'they thought we would have left by now'! If the ladies informed me when I was booking that they needed the table at certain time this would be fine, but coming in the middle of the meal is out of order. Just as they should have ask for a deposit when taking the reservation and not call a few days before, telling me that they have other eager diners. I suspect this is when the restaurant double booked.  Although we wanted to stay longer and chat more, we didn’t feel welcome, so we moved to a pub down the road and carried on.  Unfortunately, this is not the first time in Sowa that I feel as if they’re doing me a favour that I can eat there. Service is nice when everything is ok. As soon as something goes wrong, you get sulkiness and an attitude from waitresses. Forget about a smile or hearing "sorry". We chose Sowa because our pregnant friend likes this place very much and that's the only reason.  I have stopped going there a long time ago, mainly due to poor service and food being a bit of hit and miss in the past, due to frequent changes and ‘improving’ classic dishes.

title: Not great
comment: My sister, mum and boyfriend came here for dinner. We are all polish bar my boyfriend.  The 'special' pierogi (wild boar with chanterelle sauce and cranberries) was not great...tepid in temperature, with hardly any sauce and about 5 cranberries..not worth £16!!!!! The pork knuckle is very off-putting with it being mostly fat.. My sister who ordered regular pierogi had to send it back for it to be warmed up.  Not as amazing food as people seem to make out. However, the atmosphere of the restaurant is nice and the service was good.

title: Tasty and cosy
comment: Just in time for a coffee break or lunch with a friend as well as a family meeting or a climatic date. Delicious food, beautiful decor and atmosphere, great service! We ordered salmon with interesting black lentils risotto and goat cheese salad. Sauce served to salads is an absolute hit, they do not serve anywhere so good! Everything was served quickly and very tasty.  You must finally push the dessert, because all are delicious !!!!

title: A lovely find and great for gluten free
comment: This was my third visit to Great Fosters for afternoon tea. The venue is beautiful and it's enjoyable to be able to walk around the extensive grounds before/after your tea. The staff are always very friendly and attentive. I think the gluten free afternoon tea selection is by far the best I've had anywhere. The sandwiches are excellent and there's a good selection of cakes and scones. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because this time I didn't get as much of a selection of sandwiches as I have had before (although the ones I had were enjoyable). Also, I was slightly surprised to pay a service charge this time where I hadn't before. I think the last time I visited I actually purchased the afternoon tea as a voucher on the Great Fosters website beforehand and presented it upon paying, whereas this time I booked and paid the bill when I finished. Although both situations amounted to the same result, I was surprised to have to have to pay a service charge second time around. Nonetheless it hasn't put me off returning!

title: Awesome place
comment: Another visit to Sowa confirms the high level of restaurants both in terms of service level and quality of dishes. Sensational, slightly spicy pumpkin cream, equally good mushroom soup, perfectly prepared deer and of course the specialty of the restaurant, hand-made dumplings with a delicious chanterelle sauce. Delicious food, remarkable taste combinations, professional service, interesting decor and sweets - what more could you want for happiness? Sowa provides us with everything. I have no idea how anyone can think differently. We have never been disappointed. Always smiling and helpful staff, with a lot of knowledge about the menu.

title: lovely afternoon tea
comment: My wife and i were treated to afternoon tea at great fosters and what a treat it was. friendly staff and lovely food.

title: Top hole!
comment: We have been fortunate to have had afternoon tea on several occasions and it is always a delightful experience. The tea is excellent (this time we had the Pimms) and the food is consistently good. We opted to eat in the gardens but alas the rain came down and we were quickly found a table in the delightful dining room. The staff are first class and a walk around the gardens should never be missed.

title: Beautiful venue, very generous cake selection!
comment: Service was great and the venue was beautiful (we were lucky with the weather so were able to sit outside in the garden by the water!) The cake selection was very generous, more than enough for everyone and they were all delicious. Great tea selection too! The salmon sandwiches on beetroot bread were very tasty, although the other sandwiches were the average selection you would expect at an afternoon tea.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: We were a table of 5. Our waiter was very attentive without being overbearing. The atmosphere was lovely and we were seated outside. The grounds are immaculately kept and provide a beautiful backdrop for the meal. The tea and sandwiches were exquisite, especially the smoked salmon on beetroot bread. The scones were the best I've ever had, neither dense nor claggy, and generous amounts of cream and jam were laid on.  So why only 4 stars? Well, at £30 per person I feel I have a right to be fussy, and the cakes let the side down. The chocolate tart was rough around the edges and bitter. The chocolate and pistachio cake was average at best. Local patisseries in France can do a better job and charge a fraction of the price. These are minor quibbles and all in all it was a fabulous afternoon. Top marks for the tea, sandwiches, scones and service. Just the cakes need a tiny bit of refining in my opinion.

title: Pretty Good
comment: My husband and I visited Great Fosters for our anniversary. The staff seemed rather dazed, we were asked for our order twice, by the same person, and things seemed to take rather a long time to turn up - we were waiting for our tea, first food for nearly half an hour. Also, not given milk and missing cutlery on table. However, once we did get our food, it was very nice, with as many sandwiches as you could eat, though not all amazing. Nice selection of teas and coffee. Patisserie and scones very nice, Victoria sponge not the greatest - sponge rather stiff. Venue very pretty but again it took a while to flag someone down to pay the bill so not really the service you would expect at such a lovely venue.

title: I do really like it!
comment: I do love their tastes and their way to serve the food. There is a very small taste difference between their food and my mom. But Mums know better, always!

title: Great Food and service
comment: Having a Polish Father! I love pierogi and every time I come to London; I head always for Sowa! The serve, food and location is fantastic!

title: Loved it!
comment: Great food and good service. Very clean restaurant with friendly ambiance .  I recommend the cheesecake. Just delicious. I'll be going again soon!

title: Afternoon Tea after Graduatiom
comment: After my daughter's graduation I went with family for afternoon tea here.The food was incredible and staff excellent.Could not fault anything.Thank you so much!!

title: Afternoon tea
comment: I booked Afternoon Tea for four adults at this beautiful Elizabethan mansion. We had a warm welcome as always and we were taken to our table.It was a lovely warm sunny day so it was a very nice experience dining outside. We had a wonderful tea prepared and served beautifully by the staff.It was my friend's Birthday treat.She was very happy and enjoyed the whole experience as we all did. After a lovely stroll around the grounds admiring the sculptures and the topiary we left feeling like we had enjoyed an amazing afternoon.Thank you to everyone at Great Fosters!

title: Afternoon Tea - A Big Let Down
comment: We were looking forward to having Afternoon Tea outside looking at the pleasant gardens. Unfortunately the weather was not really suitable for sitting outside so we had to sit inside. The room which is in keeping with the property, was far too dismal for afternoon tea in our opinion. We have been to many other similar properties to compare it with for tea. The food was very disappointing the worst we have had anywhere. The coffee was very burnt in the caffetierre. The sandwiches some quite dry on the outside and the fillings had no taste bar the mustard with the ham. You could hardly see the fillings. The scones were passable. The cakes again should have been more tastey. The service was good.

title: Afternoon tea not quite reaching excellence
comment: Afternoon tea is a favourite treat, and it should be more than just the food and drink: it ought to be a memorable and delightful experience in which the service includes attention to detail and enhances the enjoyment of the event. At Great Fosters we found the sandwiches, scones and cakes to be good but the service was rather a let-down (eg water poured on the table cloth and just left there; hot water served in a teapot that still had gunk in it from previous use, even at the second attempt: the waiter noticed the first time and went away to sort it out, but ignored the black bits in the water on the second attempt). Walking round the gardens afterwards was the best part of our visit. On reflection this was a slightly disappointing experience especially as other reviews had been so positive. Four stars is generous.

title: Proper English afternoon tea wt all the bells and whistles
comment: Went here for afternoon tea for a friend's 50th birthday and we weren't disappointed. Lovely grounds, lovely old house and above all amazing afternoon tea. There was a choice of afternoon tea wt few types of champagne, g&t and pimms or the non alcoholic version. There was a great choice of teas and coffees too. We had a vegetarian option and a diary free one which both people commented on that it was tasty and plentyful. They came around 2x wt sandwiches and the cakes and scones weren't only deliscious but there was loads of it! I would definitely recommend it to anyone as a treat and would love to go back. Thank you to the waiters who looked after us so well too!!!

title: Birthday tea
comment: We had been given vouchers as Christmas presents but had been unable to visit Great Fosters until now. We had visited their website so we had some idea of what to expect. The actuality far outweighed what we were expecting. Beautiful surroundings, very attentive staff and mouth-watering food. Myself and my daughter are gluten intolerant and we usually find that we are not offered the same variety of food as others. Great Fosters is different - we had the same selection. We will certainly make time to visit again.

title: Disappointing Afternoon Tea - Poor Service
comment: Returned for Afternoon Tea at the wonderful Great Fosters. Booked, which I hoped would be a wonderful afternoon reunion with some friends. Great service upon arrival and we were taken to our table, which was outside behind the hedge overlooking the bridge. From this point forward we were practically just left !! Had to flag down staff for a menu, again to order after 30 mins of sitting there, other tables had 1 pot of tea per person, we had 1 pot between 5 with no strainer..... every part of the meal we had to ask for something repeatedly which was forgotten.  Seems the staff are not as attentive as they used to be and certainly not as knowledgeable about their products. Nearly waited an hour after Tea to order a G&T, but we decided to go else where. TIP -Do not go if there is a wedding on & don't sit outside - out of site out of mind.

title: Topped up tea, topped up sandwiches, too many delicious cakes so carried away home.
comment: Great Fosters is stunningly beautiful. The tea rooms are delightful. The staff are very attentive and professional. The afternoon tea was served in a very traditional way. A lovely time sharing family memories.

title: Delicious tea in atmospheric surroundings
comment: Wonderful tea, lovely choice of teas, plentiful and scrumptious sandwiches, cakes and scones. Very friendly and helpful staff and impressive management. Highly recommend.

title: Best afternoon tea I've had
comment: I've had a lot of afternoon teas across the world, this was by far the best. The setting is beautiful, particularly the outside tables. Staff are well trained, they know their stuff and deliver a professional timeless service. The menu is delightful with various different drink options, e.g. Gin, champagne. The bread on the sandwiches was very fresh and the fillings delicious, with the waiters bringing you extra sandwiches if you want them. The scones were big and we couldn't eat them all. Lovely selection of cakes. A nice touch to give boxes to take home any leftovers. Would definetly go back.

title: Nice
comment: Nice place but nothing special in my opinion. The traditional apple pie we tried was just nice but not special. Staff is strictly professional but not trying to be friendly.

title: birthday bash
comment: Amazing experience,would recommend it to anyone, the food was first class and staff so friendly and helpful, also the gardens were beautiful lovely day out was had by all .

title: What a treat! Stunning food and great place to experience polish hospitality.
comment: I wanted my colleagues from work to experience good polish food. Sowa didn’t let us down. The food was amazing, the manager Ania was extremely accommodating when it came to cater for 20 people. Everyone left full, and very happy! Could not have asked for a better service. I know that many of my friends will be back there again. Thank you for a great evening !!

title: Another delightful afternoon
comment: We have been to Great Fosters for afternoon tea on two occasions in recent weeks, having been the lucky recipients of vouchers from friends and family. We were blessed with fine weather both times and have to say that sitting outside in the beautifully landscaped gardens is one of life's most civilised pleasures. The staff are attentive and charming, the refreshments plentiful and delicious. This is a wonderful experience either to give or to receive and is recommended without reservation.

title: Excellent
comment: Took mum for a 7th Birthday treat, as soon as we entered we were greeted so well. Escorted to a nice table outside, blankets are on the chairs if needed. Everything was nice, the afternoon tea was great, the grounds are beautiful.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Excellent afternoon tea, excellent service, sandwiches and cakes were plentiful and of very good quality, highly recommended. We also had a very nice walk in the grounds afterwards and appreciated the attentiveness given to my 88 year old mum.

title: Fabulous way to spend an afternoon.
comment: Cam across this hotel whilst searching for afternoon tea. The setting was lovely, staff very helpful and friendly and the afternoon tea delicious.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: My boyfriend and me visited for an afternoon tea. The hotel and its grounds is absolutely beautiful. Food presentation was great. The only thing I didn't like was Victoria's sponge. The scones were my favourite part, absolutely delicious and fresh. Sandwiches, cakes and tea were very good. The service was very friendly and professional.

title: A delicious afternoon tea in the beautiful surroundings of Great Fosters
comment: We managed to get a table outside as the weather was so beautiful. The setting is outstanding at Great Fosters and sitting at a table sipping the variety of different teas available whilst eating a delicious afternoon tea in the sunshine on a Sunday was just perfect. We had ordered a gluten free tea. The variety of cakes was very good and anything we couldn't manage was put in a very pretty box, which matched the tea cups, to take home. Our only comment on the gluten free option is that only white bread was offered. It would have been nicer to have had a selection of different gluten free breads, which are readily available nationwide now. Perhaps something for Great Fosters to think about in the future.

title: Tea by the bridge
comment: The afternoon tea here was amazing. It was my first experience of afternoon tea, and was in such a nice setting, with lovely food and great service. It wasn't cheap (but then I say that about most things!) but was definitely a special occasion and one that we will remember. Thank you to all.

title: stunning location
comment: afternoon tea out in the gardens was a beautiful setting. From beginning to end the staff were lovely and helpful. We were lucky it was a gorgeous sunny day too. We chose the champagne afternoon tea. One of us had the vegetarian and the other traditional and I think the vegetarian sandwiches were actually nicer, the traditional ones whilst nice were not particularly special. The scones were gorgeous. It was not the best afternoon tea I have had, but the location and service more than made up for that.

title: Sowa Patisserie = TOP
comment: I came her with a friend that loves this place very much and now I know why! Nice and comfortable place, good prices and multiple choice of chocolates and cakes. We ordered two cappuccino and chocolates (muesli, champagne,cocoa and orange): everything was delicious. Recommended!

title: Afternoon tea for Father's Day was an absolute delight!
comment: Brought dad here for afternoon tea for fathers day as I have heard good things about it! Upon arrival the location is idyllic and the building is magnificent - very Tudor in appearance and beautifully decorates inside. We were shown to the Tudor room where were going to be seated for our tea. The staff were all very friendly and professional and our main waiter was very attentive. Three of our party were vegetarians and there was a separate menu for vegetarians which was fabulous!  The service was efficient and were never left waiting a long time for anything .  The sandwiches were lovely and a waiter came around with a platter of sandwiches to refill your plate if you wanted more - they were delicious!  The tea was also replenished when asked for. The cakes were lovely and the scones were warm. We had to ask for more jam and cream as they didn't give us enough an they were more than happy to oblige.  We were all so full we could not finish everything and were offered a little box to take the remaining cakes and scones home.  The only downside was that the room was stifling hot - although it was 30 degrees out and not the hotels fault but it did ruin the ambience a little.  Have been for many afternoon teas and cannot fault this one at all! A wonderful experience had by all!

title: Lovely spot and great service
comment: We met some relatives to share afternoon tea and we entranced. This is a delightful location, we were able to have tea outside on a gorgeous day surrounded by the lovely gardens. The tea was varied and interesting, the service excellent. All in all a thoroughly enjoyable experience.

title: Cathy
comment: Had a lovely afternoon, the service was excellent, the sandwiches and cakes were amazing and we will be returning. There were two things however I would change, firstly I didn't expect to use the same cutlery for both the sandwiches and cakes. After finishing our sandwiches the waiter took the plates away but picked up the knife and forks and placed them at the side of the new plates to re-use.. The other point is that we ordered champagne and Pimms, they arrived at the table the same time as the tea, I think there should be 10 -15 minutes to enjoy your champagne/ Pimms before serving the tea especially as it's an extra £16 / £7 per glass.

title: Delicious afternoon Tea in a beautiful setting
comment: All the Food was delicious although the partisseries were a bit too sweet for our taste. The setting is superb and on a warm and sunny day like we had the staff did everything they could to help us keep cool. A most enjoyable visit which I strongly recommend.

title: Lovely
comment: My friend and I had a lovely tea and then took a leisurely walk round garden, would recommend as a special afternoon

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Fabulous setting in historic venue with beautiful indoor rooms and lovely extensive gardens. Tea was served on a hot summers afternoon under a gazebo in the garden. Sandwiches, scones, cakes, lots of choice of teas and the addition of Pimms or similar. A great way to celebrate a birthday with friends!

title: English Perfection
comment: My sister and I booked a spur of the moment afternoon tea - wow we weren't disappointed. Sat by the moat in the fantastic sunshine, overlooking a perfect English garden sipping on champagne, tucking into tasty finger sandwiches (that kept being refilled) delicious cakes and exotic teas. With the resident Dagon flies fluttering by. What's not to love!? The service was attentive but not fussy. The price is on the high side but you get value for money. I'd recommend it to anyone - don't forget to ask for your 'doggy bag' if you can't manage all the food!

title: Great afternoon tea and superbly catered for!
comment: I booked the afternoon tea at Great Fosters for my baby shower and had 10 friends and family join me. Everyone was overwhelmed by the beauty of the place, and we were all very comfortable. The teas were delicious and the range of teas and coffees suited everyone! I would also like to praise the staff and chef. I'm gluten intolerant, my best friend cannot have dairy or yeast and my mother in law is diabetic. Other hotels scoffed at our dietary requirements, but not Great Fosters. Not only were they able to cater for our needs, but they did it exceptionally well. We had our own plates of sandwiches and cakes, but were not made to feel "exceptional". Which is utterly wonderful. The staff were charming and we were able to enjoy some time after the tea on the terrace which we all really enjoyed! I'll be back soon!

title: Beautiful location, average food
comment: We had afternoon tea as a family. The lodge and location is amazing. Beautiful grounds, historic interior. The afternoon tea was ok, but not great. The sandwiches were very average, the Victoria Sponge was very dry. The scones were nice and the desserts quite lovely. Presentation was a bit lackluster. Nothing wrong, but for the price you pay, I would expect slightly higher quality food. The service was good though.

title: Lovely tea with friends at Great fosters perfect summer day!
comment: We really enjoyed afternoon tea at great fosters, 6 friends and one very well behaved little girl! Excellent experience and the service was excellent. The food was lovely. Our favourite cakes were the Victoria sponge and carrot cake. The only one we didn't like was the bright green mousse cake! It's just the colour we didn't like. The scones were lovely. Choice of teas was great. After such s lovely welcome and lovely tea we had a walk in the garden, lovely ponds and gardens.

title: Great restaurant
comment: One of my favourite places to eat in London, always tasty food, friendly staff and great views. Highly recommended!!

title: Polish "pierogi" and cakes
comment: Polish pierogi and cakes are really good and tasty. We have visited on Saturday evening and this restaurant was busy. Service was slow, however friendly. There is poor selection of wines and even poorest selection of beers. Only one or two polish beers in bottles, no draughts. The game dishes some of us had were dry however nicely presented. There was 12.5% service charge added to the bill, which was beyond our appreciation. restaurant do not accept AMEX CC cards.

title: Fantastic
comment: Amazing staff and food (Ula ) , will always eat there when we travel to London . The presentation and taste of food lovely

title: Polish pleasure
comment: Was taken to this restaurant by a friend. First visit to a polish restaurant and we were not disappointed. The handmade beef check dumplings were delicious and the lovely sides that went with it. For mains between us we had duck breast, salmon & saddle of deer. We all tried a bit of each other's and it was all mouth watering. But make sure you save space for dessert. I have never seen such a delicious array of cakes and desserts to choose from you can also take away any of the cakes & patisseries as you'd like or think you could manage ( huge portions). The only downside was that the service was a little slow but always friendly. Would definitely go again.

title: Decent work meal
comment: Nice little place in Ealing, very cultural and well decorated. Dim lights make for a chilled evening. Wish there were more options on the menu and more soft drinks. Food was food though and VERY strong margarita cocktails! Only bad thing was that there was a hair in my colleagues dinner!

title: Pleasantly surprised....
comment: Our friends suggested a Polish restaurant in Ealing for an evening meal. I wasnt quite sure what to expect to be honest. Now I would certainly recommend and hope to return. Pierogi is a Polish filled dumpling and a speciality here. I recommend it as a starter but not main course (personal preference). For starters, 2 of us had Polish Soup: potato puree with a soup with sausage slices. Delicious. Two others shared a mushroom Pierogi (8 pieces which was too much as a starter for 2 people) very tasty. I had the Wild Boar Pierogi for main, which although nice, I wished I had a main as per the other three. Variously pork knuckle, pork chop and a fish dish: massive, filling tasty portions and presentation way above what I expected here. 2 of us had desserts: a selection of 3 cheesecakes and a selection of 3 apple desserts ( strudel, pie and apple chocolate cake). With 6 glasses of red wine and 2 beers, £103 for 4. Great value, service with a smile and great food. Definitely be back.

title: Just amazing
comment: I always buy birthday cakes there but it was the first time I had a lunch there. And it was so good that the day after I went there with my family for a dinner! Everything 1st class - the service, quality and taste of the food.  Also very good prices and big portion.

title: Good food, reasonable prices
comment: I ate here recently with a friend on a Saturday evening. There's a reasonable selection of Polish dishes on the menu (not as varied as at some other eastern European restaurants, though). There's also a good choice of Czech beers, but the vodka selection was relatively limited. The service was quite good - food was served quickly, but beer orders seemed to take longer than other drinks. Worth a visit if you're in the area, but not if travelling from further afield.

title: If you like Polish food. . .
comment: If you like Polish food. . .then you will like this place. Simple menu. Tasty food. Big portions. Well presented. Excellent service and beautiful decor. Would return and reccomend :)

title: Cakes to die for - lovely surprise
comment: So glad we wondered in. Lovely atmosphere and good service. Credit where credit is due. Lovely cakes and a decent offering of desserts considering we just wondered off the streets. We fancied something sweet and wanted something new. Sowa delivered this. We will definitely be coming back for the cakes. Coffee was ok and unfortunately lacked barista style but the cakes made up for it. Everything tasted fresh and was prepared wonderfully- well done and keep up the good work.  Please note 50% of the deserts do have alcohol in them so make sure you do ask. And please remember “cheesecake” here is very different but good in many ways.

title: Amazing service and delicious food
comment: I never normally leave reviews but felt inclined to do so after visiting for Afternoon Tea with my mother and daughter. The service was impeccable (especially Olivia) and the food was plentiful, fresh and delicious. They made a special birthday plate for my mother and ensured my three year old daughter was well catered for. We will definitely be back!

title: Special birthday treat
comment: We were able to sit outside and enjoy the lake and rose garden. The service and setting were wonderful and the cakes delicious. This really made our special celebration a memorable event. Thankyou to all the staff

title: Girls' Birthday Afternoon Tea
comment: Attentive waiter who introduced himself when we arrived and then looked after us for the tea, talked us through the sandwiches, took 'group photo' but left us to enjoy the experience. The food was lovely - we were offered seconds of sandwiches, the scones were warm and the cakes light; a good choice of teas and fresh pots offered when the first pot was either too strong or empty. And we were given doggie boxes to take home any uneaten food. A beautiful venue with a wonderful wood panelled room as soon as you go through the little entrance door within the big entrance door! We ate in the lounge where there was a fire lit. We went on a lovely sunny day and were able to walk freely in the gardens afterwards - it was all very civilised!

title: Wonderful birthday treat
comment: Fabulous food, wonderful grounds in a stunning setting. The staff are lovely and the tea is a really nice treat - great food and plenty of it. You could not be disappointed and the 22 goslings on the little stream in the grounds made our day! We will be back .....

title: Fantastic Polish lunch
comment: Drove from Kew to Ealing Broadway to pick up something had ordered at Argos. Whilst in Holland & Barrett buying a pack of Wheatgerm got chatting to the blonde assistant about good places for lunch. She was Polish and suggested Sowa, so went there. Had a lunch special at £9.50 which included free soup and lemonade. Had to choose Pierogi, of course, but question was which as choice of meat,cheese & potato or mushroom & sauerkraut? Lovely waitress offered to provide a medley plate containing all three . Soup was terrific carrot & corriander. My favourite of the Pierogis was the meat, least enjoyable was mushroom & sauerkraut. Just as we had starfed eating another waitress asked if we wanted sour cream as it went well with the cheese & potato Pierogi. 12.5% discretionery included on bill, which I would normally gripe about but in this case the service was over and above standard so I had no complaints at all.  Thank you for a lovely experience.

title: Great dumplings in lovely surroundings
comment: What a lovely treat for my Polish partner. We were recommended this place to try out and I didn’t let us down. Lovely atmosphere, great surroundings and amazing food. Good work!

title: Good quality food, friendly service & very popular with locals!
comment: Italian kitchen, loads of tasty looking pizzas, very helpful, friendly & fast service and tasty food. Popular with locals & families. Recommended!

title: Perfect.
comment: Shortly, very kind team members, we got Amazing cod , I never ate so good fish.  Nice decor, and comfortable chairs. Next to transparent wall bakery with delicious cakes.

title: Dinner with Dad
comment: A really nice evening & meal. We were new to Polish food and had a great meal. The food was freshly prepared and very tasty. The service was friendly and helpful. Great value as well.

title: Fantastic Afternoon Tea
comment: One of the best afternoon teas I've had. Excellent customer service. Lots of sandwiches which were refilled. Fancy cakes and lovely warm scones. Lots of hot drinks to choose from. I would recommend the hot chocolate. We were given doggy bags to take home the sandwiches/cakes that we couldn't finish which was great! Highly recommend

title: Bordering on haute cuisine , excellent place !!!
comment: Fantastic food and service, inexpensive, delicious and beautifully presented. We had fish of the day and a wild bore dish. Both amazing! I am from Poland and never had such delicious food in Poland (sorry Mum!)

title: Great
comment: Lovely intimate venue, great food and perfect for a day away. Would happily recommend to anyone for tea or even just to visit

title: A wonderful birthday experience!
comment: I took my friends over from Australia and Geneva for a champagne afternoon tea at Great Fosters. The atmosphere in the great house is mysterious and wonderful and the Anne Boleyn room is steeped in history - tea was out of this world with warm and attentive service. The different breads used for the sandwiches were tasty and mouth melting and the home made scones and beautifully sculpted cakes were all so delicious and tempting. A vast array of world teas and coffees are available as are seconds. We chose Pimms to start but champagne or prosecco is also available. For those who could not finish, cakes were packed up for us to take away. We had time to walk round the beautiful gardens and the Wisteria looks especially wonderful in May. All in all an amazing and memorable afternoon which we would highly recommend!

title: Lovely, lovely, lovely
comment: In no particular order  1st Lovely - the food was a delight especially the sandwiches and scones - yum, yum - and what we didn't eat was no problem as they gave it to us in a doggie bag 2nd Lovely - the service, smiles and helpful all the time  3rd Lovely - the location, after our tea we had a walk around the grounds - just beautiful.  Highly recommended

title: 1st class service
comment: Three of us visited here yesterday for afternoon tea. I can't recommend this place enough. Food was amazing but the staff - outstanding. I have very strict dietary requirements atm & Rosie made sure that each detail was repeated back to the kitchen. I was pleasantly surprised that they could accommodate me. Then we were 45 minutes late but Darren (I think, gentlemen with the glasses in reception) made us feel so welcome & made sure the staff would still see to us. They both made us feel so special :)  The rest of the staff are all very professional & very friendly. Would say hello when passing them in the corridor, nothing was too much trouble for them. I can't praise the staff enough. Thank you all so much for a wonderful time :)

title: Outstanding in all respects
comment: Set in beautiful gardens this beautiful Elizabethan Hotel is only a few minutes from the M25. Our afternoon tea was excellent. A wide and plentiful selection of sandwiches, cakes tea and coffee served by helpful and friendly staff. We plan to repeat the experience soon.

title: Wednesday weekly dinner
comment: Wednesday is our girls night out and tonight we went to Sowa in Ealing. Fabulous food, fabulous staff.  A lovely evening had by all. They also have a cake section which is rather super, but so many choices. I'm taking my granddaughter there on Saturday to buy some.

title: Food always amazing!
comment: The food is delicious ! Always amazing and with attentions to the details. Each course just make you to want more and more.  Staff, is ok. Sometimes you will have to wait long for attention but trust me food will let you to forgot that !

title: Best Polish food in London
comment: Amazing service, ambiance, food, cake shop (cukiernia) - regular hang out for Polish dining. Thank you!

title: Not only for polish people
comment: Very nice place not only for polish taste. So good pierogi galicyjskie-ruskie... Clean restaurant and nice customeer service. I will be back soon for more:)  Its not easy to make pierohi as you can see om the attached photo.

title: Piece of Poland in the middle of London
comment: Amazing and real polish food, great atmosphere and polite staff. Like at home ;) Starter, soup, main course dessert and coffee...and I’m done

title: Pleasant time and wonderful food!
comment: I visited sowa several times already, I liked the well decorated plates and wide range of dishes you can offer. I enjoyed the staff who were very helpful and friendly. Special thanks to Claudia for her professional service and well chosen wine. I also had a desert which was delicious and very enjoyable. I will visit sowa again! :)

title: Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters
comment: Had a great time today at Great Fosters. Camilo was our server and he was so personable. He had us laughing the whole time. And the food was excellent too. Gorgeous day out by the pond. I will remember the afternoon for a long time.

title: Tea for 3
comment: I was delighted to be able to use my gift of tea for 2 and to add another guest so that I could treat my Brazilian 25 year old granddaughter and her boyfriend on a rare trip to England. It was the last day with me and we all loved the experience. In fact we made it out lunch which was just as well as the food was presented in abundance and was delicious. To be able to wander round the magnificent grounds of the hotel completed the day  and will remain for us a memorable and lovely experience. A particular me too for the charming waiter and friendly staff. Thank you Great Fosters.

title: Quintessential afternoon tea and beautiful surroundings
comment: Everything was on point and service was impeccable. Shout out to Daniel and Rosie for taking care of us. The food was delicious and plentiful, and the selection of teas was especially nice. One nit, we were served in a room with ten tables, three were occupied. It was a bit awkward to converse without any background music.

title: Disappointing
comment: Went with a friend for afternoon tea with sandwiches and cakes. The price is £36 included service per person. They brought to our table10 small fingers sandwiches (5 pieces and 5 different fillings for each person). It was disappointing to see these presented in a small flat dish with a few small leaves salad in the centre of the plate as decoration. However worst of all the sandwiches filling was very poor and you could hardly test anything apart bread and butter. Shameful for the price they charge! On the other hand the small cakes, served after the sandwiches, were nice and tasty and much better presented. Mrs T Leroy

title: Pre Wedding Afternoon Tea
comment: On a beautiful Sunday afternoon we enjoyed an absolutely delicious array of tasty sandwiches on assorted breads.... The most mouthwatering scones followed by a selection of exquisite dainty cakes and a beautifully light Victoria sponge. Copious amounts of tea served by wonderfully attentive staff.... All washed down with a lovely glass of champagne or Pimms. Thank you for making it such an enjoyable time.

title: Love it!!!!
comment: I love that place!!! Great sweets and service!!! The waitress is polite, helpful, smiley!!! And the food is dying for!!!!

title: Top quality food and service!
comment: Another visit to best restaurant in Ealing and again top quality food and service. The restaurant was full on Wednesday evening so make sure to book a table.  Great value for money as well.

title: Yummy 😍
comment: Amazing taste and the look of food! ❤️❤️ I have ordered goats cheese salad and it was very tasty  Handmade pierogi's are also delicious. I definitely recommend this place if you are looking for authentic polish cuisine

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: We decided to take my 92 year old mother there for a Mothers day treat. She loved it!!! We were greeted by every member of staff that we passed and nothing was too much trouble. This was my 2nd visit for Afternoon Tea and my daughters 3rd! Would highly recommend especially if you come in the warmer months when you can enjoy a walk around the grounds.

title: good food and well presented
comment: 6 of us had afternoon tea yesterday 30/3/2017 at Great Fosters to celebrate big birthdays. We ordered the Pimms afternoon tea. As soon as the Pimms arrived so did our tea and coffee and sandwiches. I think it would have been more apt for us to enjoy our Pimms before having the tea was served. The service was good but initially a bit too attentive. For the first 15 minutes there always seemed to be at least two people hanging around our table, giving us no private time. Sandwiches delicious, scones warm with clotted cream and jam, and the cakes beautiful and tasty. Far too much food but attractive little boxes brought the left overs home. Altogether an enjoyable afternoon.

title: Superb belated Mothering Sunday Afternoon Tea
comment: My sister and I treated our Mum to afternoon tea at Great Fosters on Sunday 2nd April to belatedly celebrate Mothering Sunday. The hotel is stunningly beautiful being Grade 1 listed and of Tudor age, so a delight for any history buffs. The setting is also delightful especially as we were blessed with sunny weather. The afternoon tea was faultless as was the service. Our only disappointment being that we were unable to finish the sumptuous cakes, so these were boxed and taken home instead. Thank you to the team at Great Fosters, we hope to return. Highly recommended.

title: Excellent Afternoon Tea
comment: The staff where extremely friendly both on arrival and during the tea. Children are welcome, the youngest member of our party was 4 years old, the staff made such an effort to make it a lovely experience for all of us. The Afternoon Tea itself was excellent. They have several options as well as a standard afternoon tea, which can be mixed and matched between the party. All the food tasted wonderful and was well presented. You start with sandwiches, which can be refilled, and were all equally tasty. Then you are presented with your cake tiers, the scones were light and moist and served with generous helpings of clotted cream and jam, the mini Victoria sponges and other mini cakes/tarts were all well flavoured and delicious. For children they bring a separate plate of cakes more suited to their taste, they went down very well. You can also change teas as often as you wanted. A lovely touch to finish of the afternoon was their take away boxes which you can fill with any leftovers. We finished of our outing with a walk through the beautiful grounds. Will definitely come again and would highly recommend it.

title: A little disappointed on this occasion
comment: Afternoon tea on March 29th for 3. We were a little disappointed on this occasion compared to previous times; food quality (cakes and sandwiches) and service was not of as high standard as previously and hence not as good value for money; ambience also lacking this time.

title: Perfect Afternoon Tea
comment: Had a lovely afternoon tea, gorgeous scones, couldn't fault the whole experience. Stunning location, beautiful gardens to wander round & friendly, helpful staff. Will definitely visit again, can't recommend highly enough. Thanks you.

title: Coffee and fabulous cream cakes
comment: Met a friend for coffee and went to Sowa after being recommended by a friend. A real treat , although it took me quite a while to choose a cake. It was so good that I got a box of cakes to take home. We are going to have lunch there at the end of July to celebrate a birthday.

title: Excellent Food and service - internal layout not so good
comment: A special Afternoon Tea birthday celebration which didn't disappoint. The initial sandwiches were well presented but not as exceptional as Hanbury Manor in Herts. However, they surpassed themselves with the second part of the tea, with a wonderful selection of cakes and well made scones. The tea selection was also very interesting and varied. I had their White tea which was very nice.  The only disappointment concerns the initial entrance. The hotel entrance/lobby area is grand - centuries old decor but it feels rather soul-less and the grand fire should be roaring with logs rather than being used to house some large candles. The tea rooms are a collection of different rooms and we were placed in the Cocktail Bar where the view onto the pretty gardens was very limited - so at this point, we could have been in a Holiday Inn rather than in a grand and historic venue! I feel that the management should address this area - to again draw comparison, at Hanbury Manor, the teas are served in a very large grand room and this does feel very special compared to Great Fosters.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: I cannot fault the staff at great fosters for afternoon tea! There was a mix up with the booking and they did everything on thier power to ensure we not only got a table but amazing service. They could not do enough for us! Food was also amazing would definitely recommend.

title: A truly magnificent experience
comment: From the moment the old wooden door is opened, you are greeted like an old friend and treated like royalty. I can't recommend Great Foster highly enough.

title: Special place for a special tea party
comment: We enjoyed a splendid afternoon tea here with some friends. We sat in a cosy lounge with a log fire. The staff and food were excellent. I was sorry we were unable to explore the unique garden, only seen through a window. I liked the fact that we could take the uneaten food with us. Everything was delicious, though I did think such a wonderful place could have run to proper Devonshire cream with the scones. Altogether though an excellent place for a special occasion and one which we enjoyed very much.

title: Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters Doesn't Disappoint
comment: We've been multiple times and the overall experience at Great Fosters is great for guests. With a wonderful and very filling afternoon tea and gorgeous grounds and historical house this is a place we try to take all of our out of town guests. And it's always a hit.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: The service at Great Fosters was as always exceptional. Only one issue with yesterdays afternoon tea for a group of us. We had invited our friends from Devon and Hampshire to join us for tea and to see the beautiful building in which we were married many, many years ago. We had phoned before hand to mention that one of our group is allergic to mayonnaise and mustard. Unfortunately this had not been taken into consideration or the message had not been passed on to the kitchen staff. No alternative sandwiches had been prepared and could not be prepared 'as all the sandwiches are premade'. It was a disappointment but one we had to overcome and the staff were pleasant. The weather was lovely and we were able to stroll in the grounds after tea, and soon forgot about the incident.

title: Beautiful old building
comment: I was taken here for a birthday treat. The tea itself was excellent, but to get the very best of it, go in good weather when you can eat outside, the gardens are outstanding. Quite expensive.

title: Afternoon Tea at an historic site
comment: Enjoyed afternoon tea for my wife's birthday. Very attentive staff and more than enough sandwiches and cakes. We were able to eat outside, alongside the water. We walked around the grounds and had the benefit of watching a wedding party in progress (probably cannot be guaranteed on every visit, ha!). Would certainly visit again.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: Am only leaving this review as I was asked by Great Fosters to do so. Sadly my experience could have been so much better. House and grounds were beautiful, food was ok (nothing more), service fell short of what I anticipated from this standard of establishment.

title: Very English afternoon tea!
comment: A wonderful place to go for afternoon tea. In the winter there are lovely fireplaces and in the summer a beautiful garden to sit in. The service is very good and the interior of the house is wonderful. Definitely worth a visit!

title: Nice cakes and pierogi
comment: We came here on a Saturday and it was pretty busy. It's nicely decorated and atmosphere is quite pleasant. The food was fresh and delicious, we had mushroom soup and pierogi. The only negative was the speed of service- we waited at least 20 minutes before the waitress came to take orders, then another 15 minutes for the bill, then again for the card machine...

title: Once again outstanding!
comment: Once again we visiting on a Sunday with my family from Poland. Everyone orderem something different and each of us was very Happy about the quality of the dish and presentation. Service was very helpful and nice. See you again soon!

title: Delicious
comment: Absolutely delicious! Lovely waitresses, very helpful when it came to recommendations. Really generous portions too! My partner and I didn't have a vegetarian mains but the starters and dumplings have options for vegetarians and they're very filling and full of flavour! Definitely recommend trying this place. If you have a sweet tooth, you're spoilt for choice as you have the patisserie section attached where all the desserts are displayed. Can't fault Sowa. Thank you, we'll be back!

title: Amazing cakes
comment: The cafe does good food, but what made us choose their cakes for our wedding was the *amazing* meringue-filled soft, light, and oh so tasty cakes back in 2012. I also went to the same Polish brand for an anniversary cake in the year or two after that, which kept her very happy. I'm lactose intolerant and there are choices that work ok for me too there, or at least not so creamy with the meringue mixed in with sponge inside the cake; just an awesome thing to have inside the cake.

title: Great for coffee and cake and juice
comment: Sat in the upstairs part at the rear for the first tie and enjoyed a first rate cappuccino - really creamy froth plus a slice of blackcurrant and chocolate cake which was excellent and also this time a large jug of freshly squeezed orange juice. The prices here are reasonable and the service is very friendly.

title: Great 🍽
comment: Very nicely designed restaurant with great warming welcome.  We have tried Pierogi's which were very tasty and filling.

title: Great food great service
comment: The food was wonderfully presented and tasted of authentic Polish food. I was told that all the meat is brought over from Poland which is much tastier. Our waitress Claudia was charming and attentive which added to a very pleasant evening.

title: Best of polish cuisine!
comment: Meals are all delicious and of a decent size. Service is always on the highest standard, fast and satisfactory. The only downfall I could find is lack of space and it does get really crowded sometimes.

title: Great place for afternoon tea
comment: We went for a family birthday celebration with ages from 21 to 96 and wide variety of dietary requirements and had a wonderful afternoon.  The building and setting are stunning, the service outstanding and the variety of rooms available means that it really can feel very intimate. The quality and quantity of the food was also excellent. Will definitely be going back!

title: Great Tea..
comment: From the moment we stepped through the door our afternoon tea experience was made special, we were made to feel special by the staff and the food was delicious. It is something we will be doing again in the very near future. Thank You Great Fosters!!

title: Excellent service & afternoon tea.
comment: A birthday treat from my husband and it really was a treat. The a service is impeccable and nothing is too much trouble. Beautiful surroundings and lovely ambiance. The selection of sandwiches was very good and the cakes were very good too. Would highly recommend a visit.

title: Let down by seating area
comment: I wonder why we were put in the Bar area, in such close proximity to each other. It was impossible to have a private conversation, plus tea should be served in a Drawing Room/lounge, not a Bar. We weren't offer a refresh of tea or given a pot of hot water but the food takes a long time to arrive, in stages, meaning the tea got quite cold before the scones arrived so we asked for a new pot. The food was excellent!

title: Afternoon tea
comment: We were given a gift voucher for Christmas. Arrived and greet by friendly informative staff. Shown to our seats in the tudor room, beautiful. All food explained service was great. We could eat as much as we liked. Any leftover food was boxed up so we could take it with us. Beautiful gardens to walk around. I would recommend this venue to everyone, we will definitely be returning.

title: the best midwinter treat
comment: as usual both food and service were wonderful. my children (9 and 11) loved the sandwiches and cakes. a log crackling in the background, soft voices, and solicitous and impeccable service made this a perfect treat on a very cold and dark midwinter afternoon.

title: Amazing Location especially Afternoon Tea with Champagne
comment: Went for Afternoon Tea with Champagne to celebrate my husbands birthday. great collection of Teas and Coffee, unlimited  Super choice unlimited of sandwiches Whole Victoria Sponge for 2 Freshly baked scones, Home made Jam and large portion of cream Amazing selection of mini cakes First Class Service

title: Great afternoon
comment: A friend was moving away and several of her friends decided this would be a good send off, we ask her and she couldn't have been more pleased. We were in a room with a open fire last March which was very cosy, all in all with the afternoon teas was a great success.Lovely

title: Exceeded all expectations
comment: We had a fabulous visit for afternoon! I am getting married here in august and decided to combine a tour of the grounds/hotel to my maids and mum with a pre wedding get together. We were in a private area with a roaring fire to make the atmosphere even more cosy. The waiters were delightful and the food, cake , champagne and teas were delicious. All in all the whole experience was 'spot on', I have experienced afternoon tea at the ritz and this was far better.  THANK YOU!

title: Afternoon tea
comment: We were treated to afternoon tea as a gift. Tea is in an intimate room with half a dozen tables. The staff were all very friendly and we felt welcome. We had four different sandwiches, were offered more, warm scones, Victoria sandwich, and a selection of other cakes and pastries. It was all fresh, tasty and well presented. We were given our left overs to bring home in a box as we were unable to eat everything. A lovely afternoon treat.

title: Best Restaurante in London
comment: I have been in Sowa Restaurante on business dinner and we enjoyed it very much .  Food was extraordinary , well presented in very nice atmosphere .  Service was prompt and pleasant . Definitely will bring some more clients for lunch or dinner .  Highly recommended .

title: Not that good
comment: The food was nice, but I think that the value of the portion was too little and too expensive, and I think than the meat very fat. And the service is not good, the waitress disappeared for a long time. We went there because we saw some good reviews, but yes the service is not good.

title: Waitresses are not bothered
comment: We were looking a while for place to eat good polish food. We chose Sowa based on fact that most likely they are connected with Sowa brand which we know from Poland and we can highly recommend it. They are associated with them but what a disappointment. We've ordered two different plates: pork knuckle and pork cutlet. Cutlet was fine in size but no seasoning at all. Knuckle was a good size but 80% was bone, 5% fat and just a bit of meat. Same - no seasoning at all. Knowing precisely what is roasted pork knuckle we were really disappointed. After we finished our plates, waitress didn't even bother to ask us if we want any dessert (especially they have door connecting them with patisserie next door!). After 20 minutes of endless waiting I've just ask for the bill. Another surprise came when paying for food. When we came I've asked if we can pay by any card and it was confirmed that yes. Surprisingly when it get to payment, I've been told that cards yes but not Amex and ideally not credit cards. A bit of a bummer as Amex becoming more and more popular. We left with a really sour taste in our minds. Considering that I'm polish and my wife is Mexican so we normally talk in English or Spanish, I got to say, that previous review - which apparently has been marked by owner as racist comment - its truth. Tables where are only polish people were attended differently.  To summarise: you better off to any other polish restaurant which is run by local guy, who's actually cares about his business. This place? Loads of money pumped in, but failing at home warmth and good traditional polish touch.

title: Stylish and very tasty polish cuisine
comment: I am a regular client so I came on Sunday for delicious chicken salad.  It was so lovely , light and crispy like heaven in a mouth I have been recommending this restaurant to my family and friends. I am considering myself as a connoisseur of food . So this one is a five star restaurant of the Polish Cuisine in London so far !

title: Damian
comment: This is the Best Polish Restaurante in London with no doubt . I've been there few times with my none Polish friends and they all love it. They now become Sowa regular customers too. Food , atmosphere, and service is always brilliant ! Well done Sowa Restaurant - 5 Star !

title: VERY VERY DISAPPOINTING AND WELL OVER PRICED
comment: We went to Great Fosters for a Christmas treat a champagne cream tea in the hall with a lovely fire and a Christmas tree what we got was sat in the cold window in a small cocktail bar with 10 men on a wedding party which were very understandable loud and excited before the wedding I did complain straight away how cold and noisy it was hoping to be moved this didn't happen the cakes were nice the sandwiches were hard not fresh at all I did also point this out at the time giving them the chance to change things this didn't happen so I wrote to the manger after our visit as I did think they would understand the problems I got a email back which was even more disappointing I did have a cream tea there in the summer sat outside it was very very busy the sandwiches were fresh as were the cakes and I did really enjoy it which made me rebook for the Christmas how very disappointing ...I have had a lot better and a lot cheaper cream teas but with Great Fosters its all about were you are so I thought I wont be going back .....back to Penny Hill park for me

title: Totally unsuitable seating for 90 year old and any pregnant guest
comment: I have been before which is why I booked again but it was not like the first time. Considering we spent £150 plus with extra drinks as 2 people did not want tea to drink ,for 5 people overall it was poor. In our party was a 90 year old celebrating her birthday and a heavily pregnant lady and the table we were given( despite having booked some time ago )was a very small low coffee table totally unsuitable for afternoon tea for them. We asked to move but were then set up in a side bar in the modern part of the house, but again not what we had experienced the first time and embarrassing considering this was a birthday treat for a 90 year old!So disappointed as I had said how good it was the first time !

title: Ok afternoon tea
comment: We visited for my birthday and it was the first time my husband and children had been for afternoon tea. There was a nice selection of everything although i've had better and I feel there needed to be some back ground music as it was very quiet and we felt we couldn't talk too loudly and there wasn't much atmosphere.

title: Disappointing
comment: This was a treat I was really looking forward to, expecting to be seated in the Hall we were put in the small cocktail bar on our own, there was absolutely no atmosphere and felt very undervalued, sandwhich's were delicious but the cakes were run of the mill, nothing outstanding, will not be going back.

title: If you are not Polish, you are not welcome!
comment: The place is nice and cakes are awesome, but the atmosphere is below any expectations. I have been to the place three times and every time I felt that I am not welcome because I am not Polish. Every time other customers (Polish) insistently spoke to me in Polish and when I replied in English they looked at me with antipathy, with a silent question ''What are you doing here???". Sorry we are not in Poland, and even in Poland that kind of behavior is unacceptable. Also, Polish is not international language, why do they expect other people to know it?  Last time we went for a dessert (four people) all different nations and race. Waitresses just ignored us. People who spoke Polish arrived after us, but they were served first! That was total disrespect. We just left the place... left for good...

title: Exquisite
comment: Booked for my wife and friends as a birthday treat the staff were attentative and courtious through-out the afternoon. The food served was extremely good and tasty, the sandwiches were kept in constant supply and the cakes exquisite. They all took away the remaining cakes between them. When picking them up, everyone without exception had been impressed with service, surroundings and food served. Well done to the staff of Great Fosters for making my wifes birthday treat go so well.

title: Gorgeous & Impeccable
comment: One of the nicest afternoon teas in the area if not all of England. The service was perfection and food delicious. Beautiful gardens even though it's winter. Hope to return when it's warmer.

title: Nice treat
comment: Lovely setting beautiful building very nice afternoon tea for a special treat.very close to Windsor easy access to the m25

title: Nice place and service
comment: We usually visit this place for an afternoon tea or hot chocolate with dessert or croissant. Lovely atmosphere, very nice service. But we definitely need to try their dishes too.

title: Omg
comment: Omg....The food was amazing. Seriously the way how they serve it....Wow. Good selection of drinks. Definietly come back soon.

title: Great food BUT not the service!!
comment: Went with a friend with an allergy to mushrooms, we've asked for them to be served separately and told the waitress about the allergy a FEW times, but no one mentioned that there will be mushrooms in the beetroot soup that my friend ordered. After an hour he ended up having problems breathing. I would suggest educating the staff on the allergens in the dishes, because despite that I'll definitely be coming back, because the food was amazing.

title: Perfect birthday dinner place
comment: Only one world......satisfied! Food was amazing, tasty and well presented. Our server Annia was lovely and helpful, thank you for making our dinner so special. Plus it was easy to order the yummy birthday cake from the counter. We'll definitely come back....very soon!

title: Simply the best polish restaurant in London!
comment: We've been several times to Sowa in Ealing, London over the past year. Each time we have been impressed by the quality of the food, service and comfort of this great polish establishment. We hosted my Mothers 90th birthday there and had several family meals there. The pierogi are made in glass booth, so the diners can see how they are made by hand. The various main courses are really well presented, piping hot and delicious. The seats are worth mentioning as they are comfy to sit, while you enjoy a relaxed meal. Check out the delicious cakes in the coffee/cake counter next to the restaurant.

title: Failed intelligence test!
comment: My two sisters and I chose Great Fosters for afternoon tea because it is close to where I work.  We all arrived separately and two of us failed to get in without help. There is a high step and a massive front door, which two of us tried to open but couldn't because the actual door you walk through is the centre bit only! Luckily we were both rescued by the doorman, who successfully hid his smile at our stupidity.  My youngest sister was then escorted to a table, where two ladies were already seated, who she had never seen in her life before. Coincidentally two groups of three were booked in for afternoon tea that day. We all thought it was hilarious. This is the best afternoon tea I have been to since going to the Ritz for my Mum's 70th. You are given a menu, with five options for the afternoon tea, we all went for the normal one, as we were all driving, which was £28. There are also tea and coffee choices and you can have any combination of you want to. We chose 'normal' tea and stuck to it throughout. It is replenished as often as you like. Sandwiches were then brought out, one of each type and I think there were about five of them. The waitress then came round with more. After sandwiches came the cakes - two scones each a small Victoria sponge between us and loads of other cakes. We failed and ended up taking a lot home in the boxes provided for this. The waiters and waitresses were lovely, there when you needed them and unobtrusive when you didn't.  We didn't feel in the slightest bit rushed. They allow two hours for the tea but as ours was probably one of the last slots, we weren't having to vacate for the next party. Service charge of 10% is added to the bill, which the staff we dealt with definitely deserved. The room has a lovely relaxed feel, with comfortable armchairs and sofas. I can't wait to go again!

title: Another delightful visit to Great Fosters
comment: Our visit this time was for tea to treat a dear friend for her 'milestone' birthday. It did not disappoint and she was overjoyed with the occasion. Beautifully laid tables with crisp linen and china crockery in a warm and cosy setting overlooking the immaculate gardens really cheered up a grey December afternoon. The mouth-watering sandwiches, thoughtfully described by the charming waitress, were delicious and we could not help but give in to temptation when offered a few more. We soon regretted that decision though when the selection of cakes was served - on a pretty 3-tier cake stand. Two types of scones with jam and clotted cream, a victoria cream sponge cake, just big enough for 2 and a top tier of luscious individual cakes. We barely made a dent in them and were delighted to be able to take away in a pretty box to enjoy later. All of that was accompanied by copious amounts of tea served from a silver teapot. Truly an occasion to relish.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Beautiful building and grounds. Have had afternoon tea at the Ritz and the House of Lords and this was far superior. Great service, and lovely sandwiches, cakes and selection of teas, plus decent champagne! Would return.

title: Festive afternoon tea
comment: Pleasant afternoon for our yearly girls get together. Last year we went to Coworth Park in Ascot which was amazing! Thought we'd try somewhere different this year. I had requested the table in front of the fire but sadly this was not guaranteed nor available when we arrived. We were given a table by the window instead which was nice but a bit cold. The staff were very helpful and brought us a heater. Nice choice of sandwiches and cakes on offer. The tea was also nice but we made a bit of a mess pouring the tea ourselves. I think it would be been nicer if the tea was served by the waiters. Overall happy and we would certainly go back.

title: Excellent
comment: Delicious afternoon tea, freshly cut sandwiches and scones to die for Impeccable service nothing was too much trouble.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: We all had a fantastic afternoon tea at Great Fosters, as soon as we arrived our waitress Olivia was there for our every need, she was such a lovely young lady, making our experience even more special. We had an excellent array of sandwiches, and cakes, choice of teas hot chocolate and coffees. So much we just couldn't est it all, but was able to take home in little boxes.

title: Wonderful afternoon tea
comment: We had a fantastic time food was excellent, our waitress Olivia made our experience extra special she was a delight thank you.

title: Special birthday visit
comment: I took my Mum here for afternoon tea to celebrate a special birthday - my teenage daughter and my Mum's friend were also with us. This is a really beautiful, historic place with a wonderful atmosphere, especially as we were there just before Christmas. The tea was spectacular, with lots of fresh, tasty sandwiches and more scones and cream cakes than we could manage! We brought some home (they were very happy to box them up for us). The service was excellent, friendly, efficient and bringing a special birthday plate without any prompting or request. A really lovely afternoon. I was amazed how popular this was, so book early.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: One of the best English Afternoon tea services I have had so far. The food was great and the service was excellent. I'm sad to say I do not have the names of the young lady and gentleman who served us but they were wonderful . As it was a my daughters birthday and I had mentioned this when I made the online booking the staff had gone to the extra length of making the tea service extra special for her.  Thank you !

title: Best afternoon tea!
comment: I have had a few afternoon teas over the years. This is the best I've had and I'm not sure what you would do to better it and that includes the Ritz especially for value and location. It is well priced and always consistent. Fantastic sandwiches, all made with flavoured bread that compliments the filling. We had several!  Buckets of top quality tea and fresh scones. The cakes are lovely and we ended up taking most of them home for our dinner.  Staff are wonderful, attentive but discrete, excellent service and not stuffy. We were made to feel welcome and comfortable. We have been on a busy Sunday and a very quiet Wednesday just gone, and the standards were the same on both visits. We will return. Why wouldn't you with all that an a lovely, characterful setting. Highly recommended.

title: Great Place for an Afternoon Tea
comment: The afternoon tea at Great Fosters is one the very best I have ever had. We have had afternoon tea there a number of time and it never fails to delight.

title: An excellent afternoon tea in this historic characterful hotel
comment: An excellent afternoon tea with variety and choice throughout from alcoholic or non alcoholic, types of tea, range of sandwiches to delicious scones. Attentive staff, relaxed atmopshere and delightful gardens to wander. Highly recommended.

title: Super Afternoon
comment: A group of girlfriends and I visited Great Fosters yesterday for an early Christmas Tea - an annual event. Gorgeous Christmas decorations accentuated the already beautiful oldy worldy atmosphere. And the Afternoon Tea was of course scrumptious with excellent waiting staff and plenty of top ups on sandwiches and tea. My only negative feedback is that if 2 people are having the same choice of tea then each should be given their own teapot. Different people drink at different rates and prefer different strengths (I asked for extra water to dilute mine with), all the pots look the same so keeping tabs on your own is easier this way, and in our situation the table was large and those "sharing" were at opposite ends of the table. Not doing so automatically seemed an unnecessary err.

title: 21st Birthday Tea Party
comment: Thank you so much for a lovely tea party! Both Sophie and Timi took really good care of us and I would definitely recommend!

title: Afternoon on a winters late afternoon
comment: The hotel looked beautiful both inside and out with subtle and tasteful christmas lighting and decorations. Excellent and helpful staff and fab afternoon tea - with left overs packed up prettily to take home!

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: The Great Fosters Hotel was well presented both inside and out. Our booking was for 4:30 pm and as we arrived early we walked around the gardens, only to find a bride and groom having their photos taken on the bridge over the lake. The tea was great too much to eat and we took the remainder home, staff very good and helpful.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: Fabulous! Afternoon tea - Excellent service, wonderful food (especially the freshly-baked scones) and wonderful ambience. 5 star +

title: Unhurried Afternoon Tea
comment: Another wonderful afternoon at Great Fosters. Friendly staff, good food in an amazing settling. Perfect for a treat any time of year.

title: Sumptuous Afternoon tea
comment: We enjoyed a wonderful afternoon. The service was excellent and the venue so historical,a great house with delightful gardens.  We were served so many sandwiches with amazing range of filings. The lightest warm scones and a fantastic array of cakes. So many that we couldn't manage them all, so we were given little boxes to take them home with, which was a very nice touch. Thoroughly recommend visiting for tea.

title: Excellent afternoon tea
comment: Really lovely afternoon: very relaxed atmosphere, beautiful historic building with a stunning view of the gardens and tasty food. Always a consistently great experience at Great Fosters.

title: Excellent Polish Restaurant
comment: Excellent and very tasty food + lovely presentation. A la Carte menu is very delicious and all prices are reasonable. Staff is very helpful and kind. We wanted to say special THANK YOU to ANIA. It was absolute pleasure to have dinner or Sunday. Our friends were very happy with authentic polish food. We highly recommend Sowa restaurant - SMACZNEGO ...

title: Champagne Afternoon tea
comment: Excellent service by Olivia. Afternoon tea was a delight from the sandwiches through to the delicious cakes. Unlimited tea and coffee. The surroundings were very relaxing With a roaring fire and comfy armchairs.

title: Excellent !!!
comment: Highly Recommend to every food lover !!! The food is super tasty and always on time!!! Very reasonable prices!!! Great atmosphere + super friendly staff , perfect place to have a great time with your family or friends ;) Cheers M@rek

title: Great Traditional Polish food
comment: Great polish variety of dishes served with a modern twist. Fantastic flavors to raise your spirit and full your stomach. Very good option for something different. Little expensive but the quality deserves it.

title: Family gathering
comment: Spent a wonderfully relaxing afternoon with family. Very helpful staff who were attentive but not intrusive. We had tea in a great room with sofas and fire, which made it very cosy. A party of 8 catered for including seafood allergy, vegetarian and vegan! All the food was super. Some of our party were from abroad and some history lovers so a super treat for them in such a historic building and beautiful gardens. Well done Great Fosters!

title: Fantastic Afternoon Tea
comment: I have just had the most amazing Afternoon Tea. From the moment we stepped into the hotel the service was outstanding. We were asked if we were celebrating anything special and when we told them the very happy reason for our visit we were given a complimentary glass of champagne to toast the occasion. The whole experience was wonderful and the food outstanding. We were even provided with a pretty box to take home the cakes we were unable to finish. The hotel is fascinating and a perfect setting for a celebration, the gardens are beautiful. What a find. I think we will have to come back in the summer to enjoy the garden, I can't wait. Once again, thank you for making my afternoon so very special and memorable.

title: Sumptuous afternoon tea
comment: Sumptuous Afternoon tea in a wonderful hotel, with log fires and steeped in history. Cannot beat. wonderful on a dark Autumn afternoon , and in the summer months.

title: Superb Afternoon Tea
comment: I booked this venue to celebrate my friends birthday with an afternoon tea. I had found it whilst browsing online and having read all their positive reviews I booked us up. When we reached the front door of this splendid looking establishment, we were greeted by a rather lovely and very friendly staff member.  We were welcomed in and shown to our seats and was then offered a menu to choose which afternoon selection we would like. We made our choice, the drinks were delivered, followed by some extremely tasty finger sandwiches. They even offer more if you run low, which some places do not. A cake stand was served with some truly amazing looking cakes, some scones and a little Victoria sponge cake.  Everything was wonderful, the food was delicious, the staff were very friendly and attentive. The venue is stunning and has grounds which you can go for a stroll around once you are finished eating. One of the most thoughtful options at this place is they will box up anything you are unable to manage.  We really enjoyed visiting the Great Fosters for the celebratory afternoon tea. I will definitely be returning in the future as I have many a friend who will absolutely love this place too.

title: Lovely cakes
comment: Been to this patisserie/restaurant couple of times. Both times were very pleasant. I tried the pierogis which I found a bit doughie but understand that's the normal texture for Polish dumplings. But the cakes are delicious and a huge selection. I'd like to try each one and will definitely return for the cakes and tea experience. Lovely bright clean & comfortable environment since the renovation and extension. I can image it's very popular for celebrations that involve cake.

title: Great food, great service.
comment: Myself and a group of friends had a lovely lunch here last weekend. BIG portions of tasty food, it was an absolute pleasure to eat here.  After having a terrible time at a Polish restaurant West of here a year ago, it was great to see and taste how it should be done.  If you're other mad about Polish food, try this place out and you might just change your mind.

title: Perfect cake place
comment: Very nice and cosy place where you can enjoy luxury desserts and nice atmosphere. Highly recommended

title: OK, but not much more than that
comment: Surroundings were very impressive, and lovely gardens to walk round afterwards.  The tea itself was OK, but not outstanding. Sandwiches were done well and fresh. But cakes seemed to be "mass produced" and a little dry on the whole. Not extra special as one would expect for the price.

title: The best Polish food in London
comment: Myself and a couple of friends went for a lunch last Sunday and we all enjoyed the meal a lot. You can tell that a chef has got a hand for presentation and likes to feed his customers well coz the portions are quite generous:) No one leaves this place hungry! So if you like a modern and decent take on traditional, hearty Polish cuisine this is a place for you:) Moreover if you've got a sweet tooth as well the next door patisserie offers a wide array of super tasty cakes!  The place has been newly renovated to a modern decor and offers a comfy seating in a friendly atmosphere. The staff is very helpful and attentive. It's a definite must go in London. I will return undeniably:)

title: A Great visit
