comment: Once again I visited Sowa Restaurant and was once again very happy with the service and the atmosphere at the restaurant on a Saturday evening. I tried the steak from the A La Carte menu and can definitely say that I'll be going back to eat it again, I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone :)

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Had a lovely afternoon tea here with family, beautiful room sat beside an open fire, very cosy. Staff were excellent, service was very good but they weren't hovering over you which is nice, no pressure to finish & be out by a certain time. Couldn't finish all the delicious pastries so they boxed them up for us to take home. If you have the time take a walk through the gardens & grounds.

title: Great Afternoon Tea Experience
comment: Went here for a birthday treat with my family. The service was excellent and very attentive, the sandwiches, cake and scones were delightful! To top it all off the venue was charming to explore especially the gardens. I would highly recommend the afternoon tea and I will be back to try out the dinner menu.

title: What a Treat!
comment: Four of us took afternoon tea on a Sunday and we all thought the whole experience was excellent. We were shown into The Tudor Room which was laid out beautifully and made the whole occasion feel special. The finger sandwiches were delicious and plentiful, with some unusual breads, and when we had finished them we were offered more. There was a wide choice of teas which were served in elegant silver teapots and also the option to choose coffee or hot chocolate - a nice touch I thought. Then came the cake stand - Wow! The warm scones with jam and clotted cream were as light as a feather and absolutely delicious - there was a fresh cream Victoria sponge to share between two and the patisserie on the third layer was a work of art. The cakes tasted as good as they looked - millionaire's shortbread - blackcurrant macaroon made with fresh blackberries and fresh fruit tartlet to name but a few. There was so much to choose from that we couldn't manage to eat everything- but Great Fosters has that covered and boxes up what you can't manage (in a box to match the china- again a nice touch) so that you can finish it later (much later) when you might have some space! Some of us chose the Pimms afternoon tea and this seemed to compliment the food well. The drink was beautifully presented - full of fruit and flavour. The service we had was excellent with friendly but very professional staff and all in all it is difficult to see how Great Fosters could improve on this experience. We all said that this was the best afternoon tea we have had and the benchmark for others. Thank you Great Fosters for a lovely experience and - keep it up! Marks out of 10 - 10

title: Afternoon tea in an idylic location
comment: I booked this following my sisters recent visit, it met with my expectations fully, beautiful building, lovely, well maintained grounds, you must arrive a little earlier before your booking for afternoon tea to have a little walk around. We were greeted by the staff, who make you feel welcome, they were friendly. Soon, we were shown to our room, here we were shown our lovely, comfortable seats. Given the menus, great coffee, tea and hot chocolates to commence. The afternoon tea itself was lovely, a really nice, well thought out selection of sandwiches and sweet treats. Copious amounts of tea. Our booking began at 16.30 and we left at 7 pm. The staff attended to us well and made sure everything was replenished. I attended with family, my sisters 25th birthday but it is really suitable for all.

title: Superb afternoon tea
comment: Booking was simple and when we had to change it - no fuss. Perfect. When we arrived, we were well looked after and our waitress was lovely. Food was AMAZING and plentiful, plus they boxed up the cakes we couldn't manage without us having to ask, which meant we didn't feel silly asking.  Great Fosters managed to make the experience beautiful and lovely without being at all pretentious - a hard tightrope to walk in my opinion. We had time to walk round the beautiful grounds afterwards. Not only would I would recommend this to anyone, I will definitely go again some time.

title: Pretty good Scones, I like Stu and his team, they are very professional, worth a trip for the scones
comment: I have been there since the 80's, scones were very important for me as when we used to go there, scones, shortbread and fired were the only things you could eat for 20 years, they are come on since then, but the baked good remain good.

title: Relaxing afternoon in a beautiful place
comment: The food is excellent, I am gluten free and I was given my own selection of sandwiches and cakes which was just as generous as my fellow companions traditional tea. The service was very good, the waitresses were friendly and helpful. This was a special treat for my in laws and they were thrilled with the whole experience.

title: Random find...fabulous restaurant
comment: We spotted the restaurant while walking down the street and it looked so inviting we popped in for lunch. The lunch menu (around £9 per person) was incredible value. The borsch soup was the best ever along with the pork shoulder main course. My wife loved her vegetarian salad. The staff are great and very friendly. This was a real find, absolutely recommend and will visit again when in area!!

title: Greatl!
comment: We went to Sowa for our anniversary dinner and had a wonderful night. The Pierogi are just great. My partner had beef and I had duck. The meals were large, very tasty and beautifully presented. They had a good wine selection. Service was friendly and very attentive. I will be going back!

title: Sowa Restaurant
comment: When visiting Eaing, I was looking for a nice place to eat dinner. The Sowa Restaurant with the adjacent Patisserie seemed to me the perfect place. Genuine Polish cuisine combined with friendly staff presented itself as a perfect opportunity to spend an evening. Especially nice turned out to be the desert which has been served afterwards. This Restaurant has my highest recommendations in terms of service and quality.

title: Outstanding
comment: My wife and I have made many visits to Sowa Restaurant and it never fails to deliver nothing but the best quality Polish food. I have also invited friends and family and they have all been very impressed and still returning to this day. Also the menu is changed on a frequent basis so you never get board of the same food. The price is affordable and you never feel like you've over paid for your meal, also every time we leave the restaurant, we always leave with additional cakes as they are to die for. And a quick note about staff, if you are not Polish and it's your first visit they will take there time and go through the menu with you but English menu is also available, nothing is to much for the staff and they make you feel very welcome. SO IF YOU LIKE GOOD HOME COOKING THEN SOWA RESTAURANT IN EALING BROADWAY IS THE PLACE TO BE.

title: Beautiful
comment: Fantastic setting, lovely afternoon tea , staff really friendly and helpful.....a really super experience..will definitely visit again

title: Wonderful experience in idyllic surroundings
comment: Wow…wonderful Pimm’s Afternoon Tea!  From the warm friendly welcome to the stunning relaxing surroundings, this is an absolute must! Staff were extremely polite and attentive and the selection of teas, sandwiches, warm scones and cakes were fantastic and generous. Any left over cakes were put into a beautifully presented box to take away!  Will definitely be back!

title: Afternoon tea
comment: What a fantastic experience. Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters is fabulous, finger sandwiches, scones, Victoria sponge and lots of lovely cakes. We did not leave hungry! Even took some 'doggy' boxes away with us. Can't wait to go back again.

title: Fabulous Tea & Beautiful surroundings
comment: This has to be the best Afternoon Tea that i have ever had, and i include the Ritz and Savoy in my list. The staff could not be more helpful & attentive, the food was a feast both in taste & sight, and the gardens were spectacular. It really was a lovely afternoon.

title: Disappointed!
comment: I took my Mum for afternoon as a Birthday treat on Saturday 8th October at 5pm! We had been before a year ago and where put in a nice room with a lovely young girl serving us! This time we where put in a tiny box room with people that where eating burgers & chips! We had about 5 different servers, the service wasn't great and everything took a long time! The scones weren't warm and the so called fruit ones had all off 2 raisins in them!!!  There was a £7 service charge which I thought was crazy!!!  Definitely don't think I'll be returning after this!!  Very disappointed

title: 56 Anniversary tea
comment: Excellent tea, helpful and attentive staff, warm and inviting room/setting, will definitely go again.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Lovely venue, lovely food, lovely grounds and all in all a lovely afternoon.the staff were very friendly and professional. We were early for our table so had a walk around the gardens when were superb.

title: Pierogi to remind us of Krakov
comment: We went to Sowa (pronounced Sova) for my husbands birthday. We got a warm Polish welcome and choice of delicious food. Previously we have had main courses that are often accompanied by distinctive sauces, fruit and vegetables. This time we went for Polish Pierogi, to remind us of our visit to Poland. It was made in the restaurant so we could see the chef preparing it.  And then we had one of their super cakes from their patisserie. Great coffee and all for a reasonable price. We love Sowa

title: "Stunning experience"
comment: Great selection of Polish food! The atmosphere makes you feel like home. We really enjoyed our time in this restaurant. We had a few starters and mains and couldn't find a fault - everything was delicious. Order is ready in a very short time. Food was absolutely fantastic and very well presented. Interesting and relaxing interior and very attentive service. Reasonable prices for great quality food.   I would greatly recommend this restaurant to anyone eating in Ealing area.

title: The Great High Tea!!
comment: I attended with my friend Harry. I could safely say that we do 'Afternoon Tea Crawling'! Great Fosters had been recommended previously and we were not disappointed. The service was excellent. Very warm and friendly atmosphere. We were able to have drinks outside initially, over looking the beautiful gardens. The actual tea was delicious! The sandwiches were just right. Every filling was tasty and the bread was just the right texture. The scones and cakes were also lovely. I found the cakes to be very delicately made and there was quite a variety of them as well. We also admired the rooms in Great Fosters as we could not help but have a wander. The rooms were obviously for dining or private gatherings and they were beautifully kept with a fine decor and a sense of grandeur. So far Harry and I agree that afternoon tea at the Great Fosters has topped our list. We will most certainly be returning.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Fantastic afternoon tea catering also for all sorts of allergies. Excellent choice of sandwiches , cakes and different teas .

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Had a great afternoon enjoying the facilities at Great Fosters with my Partner.  Food was excellent as was the Service.  Thank you for such a lovely time.

title: Excellent Service
comment: We had a delightful afternoon with you at this beautiful venue. The service was fantastic and so friendly, Dee was amazing. We upgraded to the Pimm's Afternoon tea, and I have to say it was so acceptable on this summer's afternoon, sat by the pond. The choice of sandwiches were of a varied choice and we were offered more!! The cakes were very delicate and well presented, and for someone who doesn't eat scones I just had to try one. We were offered our remaining cakes to be boxed up (our grandchildren were also delighted) A truly wonderful gift given to us by my daughter and son-in-law. We'll be back!!

title: Fabulous afternoon tea
comment: This is one of the loveliest afternoon teas that my mother and I have shared. The hotel and grounds are beautiful, the food is amazing and the service is very attentive. We've been twice now and on both occasions have enjoyed the afternoon thoroughly. Absolutely lovely!

title: 80 th birthday treat
comment: Enjoyed my mother's 80th birthday treat with a pimms afternoon tea. The welcome was great. Service brilliant.  Food wonderful.  The amount of food you got was great. Are to many sandwiches so took some of the cakes home. Selection brilliant.  Asked for 1 gluten free when we arrived and they were happy to help.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Went with a friend for afternoon tea at Great Fosters. Lovely location, great food, very good service. Staff are very friendly and helpful.

title: Amazing afternoon tea
comment: Treated an American visitor to afternoon tea here. The food, service and atmosphere were excellent. The choice of food catered for every taste. The hotel is interesting and the grounds lovely. No faults could be found.

title: Superb Afternoon Tea
comment: We booked Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters as part of our friends 50th birthday celebrations. We were warmly welcomed by the reception staff and shown to our table in a very beautiful room. We were then looked after by several staff members, all of which were extremely polite and helpful. The finger sandwich fillings were all very delicious and we were pleased to be offered seconds. The cakes arrived not only on a 3 tier cake stand but also on a separate side plate. As they all looked so delicious we tried to cut as many of them into 3 as possible so that we all got to try a small piece of each one. The tea itself came in individual large silver teapots and was also delectable. We are definitely looking forward to returning to Great Fosters.

title: Afternoon Tea in beautiful surroundings
comment: Warm welcome, great service, beautiful decor and gardens, plenty of food and more offered,  Afternoon tea was a delight. You need to make a reservation We will return...........

title: Sumptuous high tea in a beautiful setting!
comment: We had the Pimms option, as a present from some friends of ours for my wife's birthday, and have to say that it was really superb. We sat in the gardens, which are looked after by 7 gardeners, and are really beautiful. The service was first class - with perfect timing so you neither felt you were waiting too long between "courses" or being rushed. Never seen so many choices of tea, lovely sandwiches (with "seconds" offered as well). The fruit scones were the real highlight though, which were clearly straight out of the oven. Very nice fancy cakes too, although we had most of these boxed up to take home with us after we'd stuffed ourselves with the scones! Really recommend for a special treat!

title: Best Polish restaurant in London!
comment: Last week me and my family visited Sowa Restaurant, we had really great time there. From the entrance  we were warmly welcome by little blond waitress ( Klaudia). When she find best place for us she told us about special of this restaurant. Her knowledge about food was impressive, so we follow her advice and all of us take żurek for starter ( amazing! ), then everyone choose something for himself. Me - wonderfull goose leg, my aunt - chicken breast and my uncle beef roulade. The presentation all of this dishes; outstanding. You can see that restautant is managed with passion and food is made with heart. Best polish food outside of Poland.

title: Lovely Afternoon Tea
comment: Went for afternoon tea here yesterday and it was a pure delight. The setting and building itself are wonderful and the grounds are fantastic you must have a wander around them. Afternoon tea was really lovely, there was an excellent selection of sandwiches and cakes as well. There was also an amazing amount of teas you could have, i had the peppermint and it was the best one i have ever tastes. If you cant finish all your cakes they will box them up for you to take away. It was well worth it and i will definitely go here again.

title: cake to die for
comment: fantastic afternoon  great service nothing is a problem to the staff very attentive .Fantastic location right next small lake.Food and cakes we unbelievable and then you can walk round the grounds to burn a few calories off afterwards .

title: Fab afternoon tea
comment: I was given voucher for my birthday for afternoon tea for 2. My husband and I had a lovely afternoon, initially not sure what to expect.  We arrived early and had a lovely walk around the great gardens on a beautiful summer's day. After which we enjoyed a great afternoon tea. We would recommend this, but would say go on an empty tummy ad there was lots of food.  All the staff we saw and spoke with were extremely polite and very helpful.  Thank you for a lovely afternoon. We will be visiting again.

title: Delightful!
comment: I took my Mum for tea and had the standard package. Having been to a number of places for tea, I have found it hard to find a local place that is of a high standard like the London hotels. From the minute we arrived we were made to feel really special. The sandwiches we're delightful (we had seconds!). The cakes looked really impressive and we're delicious. We couldn't manage them all so they boxed them for us to take home. The highlight of our visit were the staff. They really took good care of us. My Mum and I especially liked it that they explained what was involved and what were could expect. A very relaxing experience in lovely surroundings. Would highly recommend.

title: Amazing afternoon tea in beautiful setting
comment: The food was delicious, with really generous helpings and even offers of seconds. Every table seemed to come away with a takeaway box. The range of cakes, sandwiches and tea was really impressive- the sandwiches in particular were amazing, each made with a different kind of bread. My favourite were cucumber in basil bread. The setting outside on the terrace by the bridge is beautiful, so request that in advance if it's a nice day. It was a very hot day and the staff even had suncream on hand.

title: Second visit and still exceptional.
comment: I went there a few years ago on a beautiful sunny day it was the best afternoon tea ever.  This weekend I went back with friends. We sat in the cocktail bar. I asked to be seated in a bright room. The room is lovely and small. This also mean you are close to the staff working at the bar but that didn't bother me as they are all very nice and as discreet as possible. One of my friend did find the constant coming and going an issue. Something to consider if this might bother you. There are many other tables in other rooms.  The food was as lovely as before. I wish the carrot coronation sandwich were still in the menu. They were delicious. Scones are perfect but then that Victoria sponge. Hmmm. Light as a feather.  After we took a walk in the gardens. What a lovely estate.  For me, this is the best afternoon tea as it combines great food and service as well as English countryside. And yet so close to London.

title: Sadhglobetrotter
comment: Positives Wonderful afternoon tea, best scones ever. ,Beautiful location with gardens, grounds. Negatives Ugly tea set,chipped plate. No tea pouring service, poor etiquette  When serving guests. Presentation not impressive  Let's hope next time is better

title: Fantastic Afternoon Tea
comment: One of the best afternoon teas I have had. Went as a group of 4 to celebrate my husbands birthday. Sat out near the moat on a sunny Bank Holiday Monday - lovely location and gardens. The food was superb with extra round of sandwiches offered all on different flavoured breads. Tea was also topped up. Had to take some of the scones home in a little box. Sat on the terrace after and had some cocktails. Would recommend.

title: Lovely hotel and very attentive staff,
comment: I booked afternoon tea as a treat for my wife's birthday and we were not disappointed, such a beautiful hotel with amazing grounds. We booked on a very hot sunny day and so had tea in the gardens. We had a superb selection of delicious sandwiches and cakes. The staff were what made it so good, extremely pleasant and so attentive. We has plenty of time to walk around the grounds and lakes.

title: Can't wait to visit again.
comment: We went to this restaurant not knowing what to expect as it is fairly new on Ealing scene. It certainly was a great find! The interior is very tastefully decorated with restaurant separated from cafe patisserie area by the glass partition.  However the biggest surprise was the excellently presented quality food. The service was unintuitive and fast just as it should be. We visited many Eastern European restaurants in London but this was by far our best experience.  We already booked another visit!

title: From Moscow with love ...
comment: My son who lives in Moscow on arrival in London said - dad take the children to Sowa Restaurant in Ealing ... you have told them about this new place on the Skype !!! Yes , yes ... granddad take us there we would like Polish raviolli with chees & potatos , cakes & ice-cream

title: Sumptuous Polish cuisine
comment: I visited this restaurant earlier this year and the food is absolutely delicious. They have a great variety of pierogi dishes which are exceptional and the Pike was also well cooked and presented.

title: Atmospheric
comment: We were celebrating the Christening of our young baby girl. I will stat by saying that the portions are bigger than average and wonderfully balanced creativity with Polish delicatessen difficult to find around Ealing. The staff are warm and welcoming, speaking English very well! In the private room we have booked, the restaurant staff have turned on easy listening and relaxing music. We also requested from Sowa to bake a special cake for the occasion and it was delicious.  Iryna, Alex and Pavlo.

title: Lovely tea
comment: Beautiful setting on a sunny afternoon. Offered extra sandwiches after we had eaten the first lot and then lots and lots of lovely cakes. Had to take about 6 home with us as too many to eat!

title: Afternoon tea
comment: Afternoon tea is the Best meal of the day: Great Fosters produce the countries best. Great service and food. Superior sandwich selection: each with different types of bread . Amazing choice of cakes, scones and assorted teas, coffees and campaigns.

title: Beautiful afternoon tea and walk in the gardens
comment: We had the most lovely time once again, this is our third time for afternoon tea and we will be returning. Lovely surroundings, great service and yummy food.

title: Champagne Tea
comment: We were given a voucher for us to have a champagne afternoon tea at Great Fosters. The staff made us feel so welcome and the tea was delicious. Choice of teas and coffees extensive and the sandwich fillings were interesting, plus gorgeous cakes, scones, cream and jam. We sat in the bar lounge, which is a small cosy room overlooking the beautiful gardens. The terrace looked inviting - if it hadn't been raining! Two ladies in the opposite table were celebrating a birthday. It is a real treat for such an occasion. Would recommend it.

title: 90th birthday treat
comment: My family and I took my mum out for tea on her 90th birthday and had a wonderful afternoon. The sun was shining, the gardens were stunning, the staff were attentive and friendly and the food was delicious. My mum felt she had been treated like the Queen! I really cannot find any negatives - it was a fabulous day.

title: Phenomenal gluten free afternoon tea
comment: Phenomenal afternoon tea at Great Fosters last Sunday. If you need gluten free, as I do, this is one place you will definitely not feel like a second class citizen. The whole tea was very tasty, but the gluten-free scones deserve a special mention - the best I've ever had. Beautiful setting and great service. A lovely afternoon. Thank you.

title: Lots of lovely cakes
comment: A very pleasant afternoon for my Mother in laws birthday. The sandwiches were very tasty. I think we ate a few too many as we didn't have enough room for all the cakes. There were so many, which were all delicious. Luckily we took them home.

title: Superb Scones
comment: I took a friend as a birthday treat and it exceeded our expectations. The staff were all very welcoming and we had a lovely table by the window. If the weather permits, the Terrace is a perfect location, overlooking the beautiful gardens. It made a pleasant change to be served the sandwiches in instalments, rather than just piled on a plate, and the choice was a bit different to the usual fare - especially the vegetarian option. The pastries looked amazing, but luckily we were given a gorgeous little cardboardd box to take the leftovers home in as we couldn't manage them all. However the piece de resistance were the scones. We both agreed that they were the best we had ever had and between us we have sampled a fair few afternoon teas! Afterwards it was lovely to be able to take a stroll round the beautifully manicured gardens and work off a few of the calories that we had just consumed. There was ample parking and I would definitely go here again. In fact I'm trying to think of an excuse for a return visit.

title: Great food and top hospitality
comment: This restaurant is a gem, and the best polish food I ever tasted. The service was second to none; they are value and splendid decor I can't wait to be back

title: Great Polish Food
comment: This Restaurant has Great Food very Professional and friendly staff that it is working at this Restaurant i highly Recommend this Restaurant to everyone

title: Very Good, but not great Afternoon Tea @Great Fosters.
comment: This is my 3rd Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters. All 3 were in different rooms. This one was outside and the weather was perfect. The table was set beautifully and included a wrap blanket that was needed as the sun lowered behind the hotel. The sandwiches and pastries were as good as usual. The variety of pastries was very much appreciated and they were different than my other visits. The tea itself has lots of flavor which I find superior to the tea served at Fortnum and Mason in London. Why I haven't given my favorite place to dine and have Afternoon Tea in Egham is due to the less then excellent service. Two errors were not bringing all (3) the pots of tea requested at the same time and forgetting to bring one guest her requested Vegetarian sandwiches. We had to wait too long for those corrections. I was very disappointed by the shortcomings in the service this day! It seemed less than satisfactory compared to previous visits. As usual the gardens and beauty of Great Fosters were a feast for the eyes! I do hope the servers improve their skills for Great Fosters sake!

title: Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters - How delightful
comment: I was bought Afternoon Tea for 2 as a Christmas present and finally got round to having it yesterday. It was well worth the wait. The staff were attentive & the quality of the food was excellent. Lots of variety & all tasted delicious. Went for a walk in the grounds afterwards which was amazing. The grounds are stunning with lots of secret paths & places to get lost in. There was a wedding taking place which looked divine - what a place to have you wedding!!!

title: Wonderful Staff, Tea and Cakes
comment: We loved the whole thing.There were even rugs to keep us warm n the delightful moated gallery where tea was served. We loved to the estate the lake amphitheatre and the outdoor pigs.

title: Summer Pimms tea
comment: We went for afternoon tea to celebrate my son's 40th birthday. Had a lovely table for twelve by the moat under a gazebo. The Pimms were excellent and the tea excellent. Plenty of sandwiches with extras if wanted. Too many cakes!! But doggy boxes to take left overs home. Staff were very attentive and obliging. It was very leisurely and quite delightful.

title: Lovely Tudor setting.....
comment: From the welcome you receive the minute you walk through the tiny Tudor door you know you are in for something special. The manageress was so helpful by putting us in the garden( we should have asked previously) which has a lovely overlook onto the moat, the lovely gardens and the beautiful building which is a bit like hampton court in miniature.  Food was really nice and well presented in usual afternoon tea style though we did upgrade to one including a Pimms glad we did - excellent Pimms. Highlight were the cakes which included an entire Victoria sponge in addition to 2 types of scones and other delectable little pastries. Lucky they gave us a nice little box to take some away. If you have time have a wander round the grounds. Super gardens and fountains, lakes, bee hives, hidden tennis court, various modern sculptures and a fantastic topiary garden. Service throughout was friendly and efficient. Will definitely go back- maybe for  Lunch or dinner next time.

title: Mmmmm - Afternoon Tea
comment: We've been going to GF for over ten years and have stayed at the hotel, had dinner in the barn area, attended Xmas events and had afternoon tea many times. However, the atmosphere and service has taken a distinctive turn.  The grounds and house continue to look wonderful. Can't be faulted and brings us back.  However, for a birthday treat, we had booked a table for Sunday which was quite a sunny day. I asked for an table umbrella but were told this wasn't possible. So we ended up sitting in hot sun with two small children which wasn't great. As we had two kids who don't like afternoon tea, we wanted to order one for them to share. Again were told this wasn't possible and had to order two lots for them which meant most of it went back as they didn't eat it. A bit of a waste of money I thought.  So we left feeling a bit underwhelmed and thinking that GF has definitely changed. In the past, their attention to detail and customer service was just exceptional and made the place. I hope this changes as its a wonderful place.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: Having stayed there, dined too we thought an afternoon tea a must. The staff were their usual high standard and polite. There are certainly more staff than needed and that adds to the service standard. We had the Bollinger tea option, worth every penny. The food, selection and quality were as expected but appreciated. It may not be cheap when you add other drinks and options; it is not expensive when you consider all. A must for anyone that enjoys civilised times.

title: Fabulous Afternoon Tea Treat
comment: My wife and I were given a voucher as a thank you present for Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters and recently experienced this really wonderful treat! As we arrived at Great Fosters we could see that it was a beautiful historical building with character set in spacious grounds and we felt to be special guests. We were given the option of a table inside or outside, but I think eggs is not always the case if they are busy and your choice needs to be made when booking. We sat outside and enjoyed wonderful views of the gardens and grounds. The afternoon tea was delicious and the staff could not do enough for us to ensure that we enjoyed our experience. We were given more sandwiches on our request, but then couldn't finish the delicious cakes. This wasn't a problem because they offered to box anything up that we couldn't eat. After we had finished our afternoon tea we wandered around the beautiful and extensive grounds and thoroughly enjoyed our thank you treat!

title: Fabulous afternoon tea
comment: We had tea in the beautiful gardens today, we were given a voucher for my birthday and have been looking forward to using it. We waited for the summer and weren't disappointed. The sun shone and our experience of tea here is lovely, every time is better than the time before and we will definitely be returning next summer.  The sandwiches just keep on getting replenished and the scones and cakes are plentiful and delicious. Just don't book tea and dinner on the same day as you won't enjoy your dinner!!!

title: Beautiful location and excellent food
comment: We very much enjoyed our afternoon tea at Great Fosters. We were offered more sandwiches after we had finished all we had been given at the start. As it is almost impossible to finish all cakes the waiter suggested to all guests to take the cakes home in a box, which is a great idea! We left our cake box at the bar and went for a walk through the beautiful gardens which are very peaceful. If it is a sunny day I would recommend sitting outside even though the inside area is very nice as well. The staff are very friendly and welcoming.  The only negative point is that they only had strawberry jam which I thought was a shame as all other (cheaper) afternoon teas I had at other restaurants / cafes offered a variety of jam.

title: Lovely afternoon tea
comment: Had a lovely afternoon tea in the garden by the moat, courtesey of a voucher from our son. Sandwiches and cakes were yummy, plenty of tea and great staff. Also get a "doggy" box to take home the leftovers. Would definately recommend.

title: Delicious modern take on Polish classics with a twist ..
comment: The Sowa (owl) patisserie, bar and restaurant was recently opened following the refurbishment of the former Cafe Magnolia. Very pleasant decor themed on its namesake The Owl and pictures featured Polish cities. Good cosy areas  Freshly prepared, beautifully presented dishes in generous portions Steak Tartare, with all the condiments to start and succulent pork loin for main with a herb salad together with an irresistible platter of Pierogi which are freshly and visibly prepared in front of you by a lady at the open pierogi station ... a really nice touch !..empty plates all round ! Service was efficient and friendly and the ladies engaged their customers in conversation and were more than happy to explain the menu for those unfamiliar with Polish cuisine. The cream slice Mille feuille pastry Karpatka was delicious too!

title: Fantastic food, fantastic place!
comment: It was my second visit there and second lovely experience. The place is chic, bright with lovely background music (it is important for me) and lovely customer service. I have ordered traditional Polish food veal with mashed potatoes and it was gorgeous! The food is fresh, lovely presented and nice portion too. And the cakes.... U lalala! Royal cake is my favourite! I find Polish food very comforting and tasty. We will definitely be back soon for Pierogi! :-)

title: Special (90th) Birthday Party
comment: Our group booked the whole restaurant earlier this month, at indecently short notice, for a big bash with family and friends (52 guests in all) to celebrate a major birthday. We worked with the owners to define a two-starter, four-main-course menu. The collaboration was excellent, and they even designed, customised, and word-processed the menu for us to send out ahead of time. We, in turn, provided them with a schedule of who was having what, and the staff made nice name cards, which every guest put on the table in front of them - and everybody got the right dish placed in front of them at the right time. Throughout the evening, the staff were really friendly and accommodating, and nothing was too much trouble. Regarding the food, despite the 'mass catering' element, we were amazed that their usual quality (several of our party eat there quite regularly) was not in any way compromised. I had the Steak Tartare as a starter and found good quality beef, with just the right quantity and quality of condiments. Mixed well, it was the best Tartare my wife had eaten in many a year, she said. My main was Pork Tenderloin with Chanterelle sauce, internationalising a Polish classic. The other starter, Spinach and Feta Dumplings, was well received. The alternate mains, Duck Breast, Boar Meat Pierogi, and the vegetarian option of Potato Pancakes (another classic Polish dish) with Forest Mushrooms, were all acclaimed, with the latter, perhaps, evoking the greatest superlatives. The dessert was one of Sowa's legendary gateaux. Sowa, well known across Poland, originally made their name with these creative and opulent cakes. At their suggestion, they decorated and personalised the cake for the occasion with ingenuity. With regard to wines, we took the house Prosecco as a welcome glass, and then the house white and red wines throughout the meal, which were all quite acceptable. For the toasts, we brought our own Champagne, on which we were charged a pretty standard London level of corkage. All in all, a very successful evening was, in no small measure, achieved through the cooperation, willingness and heart, of this excellent establishment. Our party was slow to wrap up and leave, but at no stage were we made to feel that we had outstayed our welcome. We will undoubtedly repay the compliment through repeat visits in the near future.

title: Polish Fine Dining without the heavy cost!
comment: I came here with my Polish fiancé as we have looked through the window ever since it opened and we were so impressed with what we saw that we HAD to come in for lunch. I have eaten a lot of Polish food in London and also in Poland so I had pretty high expectations! The food is sensational. You can watch them making it freshly right in front of you too, which is a great idea. It elevates Polish food from what you usually see to something stunning to look at and equally delicious. I had the steak tartar to start and wild boar pierogi as a main and they were so beautiful to look at and to eat. The cakes look amazing but I was too full, but the fiancé got one and she loved it. Sure the service is a bit slow, but these days everybody seems to be in a hurry. Take some time out and enjoy your food, relax! The price was very good considering how wonderful everything was.  We will be back, with more people so they can see just how good Polish food is!

title: A special tea with a friend.
comment: I wanted go treat a good friend for something special, as she does not go out much. It was a splendid idea to invite her gor a Afternoon Tea at G.F.  We both enjoyed all the lovely sanswiches and delicious scones with our cream tea. My friend was absolutely delighted with her treat and even got her favourite tea, Earl Grey. A successful story and everyone happy!

title: very good afternoon tea
comment: Enjoyed our afternoon tea yesterday, a present from our grandchildren We were warmly welcomed and offered a table inside or out, we choose inside as rain was forecast. Sandwiches were delicious, especially the beetroot bread with smoked salmon.  and enjoyed a couple extra when the tray came round. Very good fruit and plain scone with clotted cream and strawberry jam.  The Victoria sandwich and the cakes were superb, very clever patisserie chef, we did bring some home in a lovely little box. Thank to Olivia our main waitress who looked after is very well

title: Champagne Afternoon Tea
comment: I can thoroughly recommend the Champagne Afternoon Tea fabulous venue with amazing gardens and perfect location to eat outside by the Moat splendid scenery. The staff were very friendly upon arrival and throughout our stay excellent service and very attentive. Also no big deal if you can't manage to eat everything they put leftovers in a carry out box matching the crockery very nice touch. Thank you will definitely be back

title: Fabulous
comment: Went to Great Fosters for afternoon tea for a friends birthday. Had a fabulous time sitting out overlooking the water and bridge. Was a bit worried about the weather as the sky did come over very black, but luckily the weather held for us. Had fabulous sandwiches, which were replenished until we said we had had enough, then lovely fresh, warm scones, one fruit and one plain scone each with clotted cream and jam. Also had a selection of small cakes and as much tea/coffee as we wanted. The staff were very pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. Would definitely recommend GF for afternoon tea. It was so relaxed, it was 6pm before we knew it, and our tea slot was 2:45pm, so no-one tried to hurry us.

title: Hen Party Afternoon Tea
comment: I "Mother-in-Law to be" booked a table for 7 ladies. Booking was via email and was very satisfactory. The tea itself on Sunday 31st July. We dined outside on the terrace which was absolutely beautiful as was the grounds and the building itself.  Every member of staff we encountered were so accommodating with everything we requested. I have a nut allergy which is not severe but I was given my own plate of sandwiches and cakes on a stand. All in all a wonderful 2+hours

title: First class service for afternoon tea
comment: From the young man who took my reservation, politely, but with a "smile in his voice", the Great Fosters waiter who met us in the hall with "we've been expecting you" to the tall bespectacled waiter whose silver service skills were second to none (I am an ex restaurateur, so I speak with some knowledge) and the smiling young ladies who moved oh so discreetly between the tables, everything was genuinely first class. Maybe the champagne before the tea pot arrived would be a good idea, as the tea was not piping hot by the time we poured, and so was a little less than 100%, but the food was lovely, grounds beautiful and the atmosphere relaxed and friendly. I am quite sure that we will return.

title: Damian
comment: We visit this restaurant regularly , and every time we go there, we get great service and great food . Definitely will recommend this place!! Best in London for Polish food with style .

title: If you want to try Polish food - this is the place to go
comment: Elegant and tasty. I keep coming here a lot. I am a big fan of beef. Tatar and steak. Speak to staff and ask them for chef's special. Guys in the kitchen can cook. I must enjoy this place a lot. After all Im organising my 40th birthday party in there.

title: Amazing food and a great signpost for Polish culture!!
comment: Me and my family came down for a meal hoping we can find great service and excellent Polish food and the restaurant delivered!! The staff was very attentive and polite, the dish sizes were very appropriate and food was sophisticated and delicious. I would encourage anyone to definitely give it a try and I guarantee you will love it!

title: Best of Poland's culinary traditions with contemporary twist
comment: First of all – the ambiance: This is, without doubt, the best looking Polish restaurant in London! It’s stylish and elegant, yet pleasantly casual in its atmosphere. There is something nice & warm about the restaurant part (the place has a second part as well, which is a café/ patisserie with great selection of ridiculously delicious cakes and freshly ground coffee), and the pictures of Polish cities on the walls just add to the character of the place. It’s worth to mention that the whole place is very clean, and you can see the staff constantly busy. When we had our dinner, the restaurant was almost full (good sign for a Tuesday evening), and we could immediately notice that people enjoy themselves and the food. The food: Everything we’ve tried was delicious. Handmade (you can see them being made!!!) pierogi are a true delight, and the main courses are full of interesting flavours, yet not as heavy as you would expect from a Polish cuisine – a new take on classics? Possibly yes, considering also some interesting contemporary presentation of the dishes we’ve tried. If you only want to try one thing… try the goose breast in plum sauce! Or pierogi with boar! Yes, definitely try more than one thing  Will I come again? Absolutely yes! The place looks good for a business brunch as well (an original idea to invite your clients to the Polish place for a change?). The waitress told us that the restaurant often organises special events, so there’s something to keep an eye on if you live in the neighbourhood.  Definitely worth recommending.
The grounds are gorgeous, tea is excellent and staff very helpful. Patrick on the bar was very attentive and so knowledgable with the cocktail making!

title: An excellent, enjoyable and relaxed afternoon
comment: Booked afternoon tea for four in about 4 weeks in advance. We were contacted the day before to confirm our booking; contacted again to offer us an outside table as weather was sunny which we went for but we were offered the option to move back inside if we found weather was too hot. Appreciated flexibility and consideration. The afternoon tea was excellent (we all had different blends of tea); good range of sandwiches with extras offered if needed; fruit and plain scones - jam and cream; good choice of cakes plus a "mini" victoria sandwich. Make sure you don't have too large a lunch before going for afternoon tea! Restaurant thoughtfully packed uneaten cakes into attractive boxes (the colour scheme of which matched the crockery!). Service was excellent and attentive - couldn't have asked for better to be honest. And, yes, it was too hot to sit outside! Will definitely go to Great Fosters for afternoon tea again.

title: Sarnies to die for...
comment: We had a Pims tea outside by the moat which I booked this as a treat for my sisters. Not being one for the cakes myself I absolutely loved the fresh finger sandwiches and scones. The artisan breads they were on were really tasty, it made a very welcome change to just white or brown and they weren't stingy with them either. We had a second round... This is the third time I've been there and they never fail to impress. This is worth it just for a walk round the hotel. The grounds and house are beautiful.

title: Great afternoon tea
comment: We had a great afternoon tea here. Plenty to choose from with regards to blends of teas. I had a vegetarian afternoon tea and it was tweeted to my preferences with no fuss at all. We were asked if we would like more sandwiches but what we had had been enough.

title: quality mother daughter
comment: We had a quality afternoon with my mother a special time In lovely surroundings and quality food great service really recommend It.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: I just love this place & enjoy their Afternoon Tea the most. The staff are ever so helpful & friendly. In May 2016, with my sisters, we visited the bees housed at Great Fosters, garden tour & lunch we thoroughly enjoyed every bit of it. I always look forward to Afternoon Tea at this place with my family & friends.

title: Weekend stay
comment: Delicious food and lovely staff. Tea can be eaten in the sunshine over looking the maze, moat and bridge.

title: Birthday Treat
comment: Friends took us for this sumptuous afternoon tea which was excellent. We were offered more sandwich but decided against them as we didn't think we could eat all the lovely desserts. We ended up bringing home a doggie bag with a cake each.

title: Birthday Treat for my Dad
comment: My husband, son and I took my dad along with my sister for afternoon tea. Having recently moved to Surrey i wasnt too familiar with many other afternoon tea places. The reviews here were enough to prompt me to book it and I am so glad that i did as it was such a stunning location and the afternoon tea was amazing! I really cannot fault it. The staff and waiters were so friendly and very attentive. Everything was fresh my scone literally fell apart and was still warm and tasted like it had just come from the oven! Sandwhich selection was amazing and very generous as was the cakes. We ordered addiontal cappacinos aswel as the tea and these were included within the price which was amazing. I would defintely reccomend this to anyone. Our table was situated by a gorgeous pond with a bridge and fountain behind us and on the other side of us there were amazing gardens and a beautiful maze. I shall be returning to this place without a doubt and look forward to trying the lunch/dinner and breakfast menus. Thanks for a lovely afternoon!!!

title: Skip lunch before!
comment: Mrs and I were given a champagne afternoon tea as a gift. We skipped lunch and started at 2.30pm. Amazing in every way. Beautiful sandwiches in different and unusual breads, clotted cream for scones, staggering good cakes, champagne, didn't really want the tea....Not something I would do too often, but as a treat it is a wonderful experience. Quality service too. Highly recommened!

title: Excellent food and service
comment: After Hammersmith's Malina shut down we lost that perfect place in London to go to eat Polish food done properly, which is hard to understand considering how many of us live here - and how we always like to share the best of our country. The wait is over. The Polish classics, beautifully presented and cooked exactly like they should be. Schabowy schnitzel arranged artistically next to a small side of bigos and a swirl of beetroot sauce, steak tartare spiced just exactly right and served in a center of a huge plate with lots of chopped pickles to make it just right, flavoursome, tangy żurek soup and of course pierogi... You can watch them made just as you would pizza - and I wish I asked the name of the lovely lady making them who was the discreet centerpiece of the room. The service is pleasant and fast. The prices are your typical London fare but it's worth it. I hope they will get more of Polish craft beers on the menu and a more varied section of drinks because it's guaranteed my British husband and me will be coming back and bringing friends around!

title: Sowa Restaurant
comment: The restaurant appears to have had a makeover and change of name, so is now called Sowa (not Magnolia), but I've no idea if it is new owners or not.  Tried it for the first time on 2/1/16, and was very impressed. Decor is good, staff are attentive, and the food is excellent. I had the chicken breast with vegetable stuffed dumplings (pierogi), and it came with several vegetables as well, and everything on the plate was delicious, though for £11.70 I think the portion sizes could have been a little bit bigger. My dinner guest had the mushroom and sauerkraut stuffed pierogi, and again these were excellent, though she said that next time she will have the chicken like I had, as there is a bit more variety on the plate. We did not have a dessert, as it was only a lunchtime meal, but the desserts come from their patisserie cafe next door (same company), and they look amazing, so I'm looking forward to trying them next time.

title: Restaurant and Cafe
comment: This is now the Sowa (Polish for owl) restaurant and the owl symbol is displayed in various places in the restaurant. There is also a café and adjacent patisserie. The decor is good and service fine, with only one minor hiccup due to a request being lost in translation.  Started with the chicken noodle soup which was served unusually by pouring a thin clear soup over a plate of noodles – recommend. Our party’s main courses consisted of goose, duck, pork cutlet. All were very well presented, tender and tasty. The pork cutlet was a slight misnomer as it was huge. Skipped the desserts, and went straight to coffee. Strong Americanos with a distinct crema. Will go back.

title: Never sgain
comment: It was my first and last visit for sure. No one really greet us , we sat down and been waiting for a menu for long time . Not busy at all , It was only 2 tables in the restaurant.  We have been waiting for our food ages because kitchen apparently lost our order! The waitress was nice but she offered a tab water as compensation for long wait !!!  I asked for dessert but been told the kitchen is closed already . I just wanted a slice of cheesecake ! I don't think it is so difficult to do ?! Did you ever heard about customer service ?

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Simply sublime. Location was wonderful set in beautiful grounds and the staff were lovely. Took my friend for her 50th and we couldnt have felt more special. Amazing. Best of all we got to take home a "doggy box" because we couldn't eat it all.

title: Wonderful
comment: fantastic. Awesome. Beautiful presentation. Excellent sandwiches and cake. A wonderful Victoria sandwich. Very filling so luckily they gave us a "doggy box"

title: Not in the book
comment: I was taken to Great Fosters for afternoon tea as a birthday treat and my hosts had specifically requested an outside table so imagine our surprise when we were shown an inside one instead. We asked if they could check the booking and they said that no table had been available - sadly not what they had said in their confirmation email. A shame because this sort of behaviour casts a shadow over what was otherwise a delightful experience. Had it not been a fine afternoon we wouldn't have been any the wiser but in these days of emails and social media it is really time that this sort of thing stopped. Moral being that people won't book for important occasions if they think you will let them down.

title: Very enjoyable afternoon tea
comment: We had a lovely afternoon tea to celebrate our daughters graduation We took a wander round the extensive grounds before hand. Our table was by the water outside, a wonderful setting, but like others have said in their reviews, you have to request a table outside when you book and if it rains they may not be able to accommodate you inside.

title: Lovely Afternoon Tea
comment: This is my second visit to Great Foster. We arrived 25 mins late due to an accident on the M25. We did call hotel to let them know and they were understandable. We were greeted by lovely staff. The visit was booked for my friends birthday treat and there was 3 of us. I reserved an outside table. There was only 2 chairs at the table and although another chair was put at the table it was at a slight hill towards the lake! Shame the table wasn't ready for our arrival particularly as they had extra 25 mins because we were late. However, I did feel safe, and the staff did ensure I didn't mind. We were directly in the sun as the parasol didn't reach our table which was a shame as it was very bright and hot. Maybe parasol should be over entire table in the summer??? The tea was very nice with a good selection of sandwiches. the cakes delightful and scones lovely and warm. We did have to ask to refill cream/jam as only very small amount in bowl. We asked for extra pot of tea too and all the staff were very accommodating, polite and friendly. We had a walk around the beautiful grounds. I would suggest a table is booked always, particularly at weekends as it gets very busy.

title: Very Nice but not outstanding
comment: The Afternoon Tea experience was given to us as a gift - a lovely idea. I am therefore loathe to make any detrimental comment. It was very enjoyable. The hotel and grounds are very very pleasant. The afternoon tea itself was nice and indulgent, but having explained that the pot of tea could be refilled as much as needed, we had to ask to have a second pot. The staff seemed a bit 'stretched' but there was a wedding party. The sandwiches were good, but the vegetarian selection was excellent The scones were delightful, light and more-ish. As well as the mini Victoria Sandwich, which could be cut into 4, there were 4 other fancy cakes. All nice, but as we both wanted to experience them all it meant cutting them in half! It would have been better to have had 2 x variety of mini cakes, as we have had elsewhere.

title: Fantastic afternoon tea
comment: 11 of us had Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters to celebrate my mother's birthday, and from the initial phone call to the day itself the staff were fantastic - helpful on the phone and charming yet professional when serving - everyone commented on how good they were. The venue is stunning - we were lucky to have a beautifully sunny day and were seated outside. The tea was delicious and elegantly presented, the dairy-free version was also varied and tasty, and the cakes we couldn't eat (the tea was very generous in variety and quantity) were packed into purpose-made 'doggy bags' for us. It was a very special day for the family, and Great Fosters was the perfect setting.

title: An unforgettable Birthday treat.
comment: We had afternoon tea at Great Fosters yesterday and it was fantastic! The building and grounds were magnificent. It really did feel 'fairytale' special without feeling uncomfortable in any way. I've networked in some grand places where i've felt a little awkward but the staff here were totally friendly and put us at ease. We had finger sandwiches of 6 different delicious fillings and these were topped up when we had finished them. We then had a three tier platter of totally different mini cakes, plus a midi size victoria sponge, plus a plate of 6 scones with cream and jam!  We carefully split all of them into 3 so we could each taste all of them in their wonder. They were just as delicious as they were beautiful. All of this was accompanied with our choice of tea and water. Just when we felt we were about to pop we were presented with 'goody boxes' to take home what we couldn't finish! We opted to sit outside because we were blessed with glorious weather, however had it turned a little nippy every seat was prepared with a blanket should you need it. As coco chanel is quoted on the back of the brochure "Luxury must be comfortable, otherwise it is not luxury"  It was an absolutely delightful way to spend an afternoon with special friends.

title: A splendid afternoon tea
comment: We felt very self-indulgent as we sat by the water and the rose garden at Great Fosters, eating our way through a most delicious tea served by the politest waiters - nothing too much trouble, and every detail adding to our enjoyment. Just don't count the calories!!

title: I love this place xxx
comment: Best pierogi i ever eat !!! They are doing pierogi in front of the costumers. Wine list is also very intresting. My favorite dishes : goat cheese salad and goose breast. I've been there allready 3 times and will come back definitly. Ana

title: Sumptuous
comment: We like our afternoon teas for special occasions. Invited to Great Fosters by friends, we were impressed by the beautiful setting of the Tudor Great House and the surrounding gardens. Tho only downside was the rumble of traffic from the nearby M25 motorway. The staff were attentive and courteous - our friends had reserved an outdoor table, but on arrival on the hottest day of the year we decided that indoors would be more comfortable so the staff were only too happy to organise a splendid table in the house. The tea itself was sumptuous - at a price of course - but we were offered regular top-ups of both eats and drinks and in the end had to admit defeat and take home doggie bags. The choice of teas was excellent and included, at the same price, white tea, usually an expensive rarity. In sum, the setting, the staff and the tea combined to merit 5 stars.

title: Chris P
comment: Best Polish restaurant in UK . I do go to restaurants quite often but this place is my favourite .  Brilliant place , well decorated . Amazing atmosphere . Highly recommended . Food looks like art and is delicious . Will go back there again .

title: A delighful afternoon tea without the London price tag
comment: The Great Fosters afternoon tea is very special. If you are lucky enough to be here on a warm day, the gardens and terrace are wonderful. Tea is served in 2 courses; sandwiches and then your cakes and scones. All truly delicious! The staff are amazing and I am very lucky to say this is 5mins from my house! They made me feel very special on my Birthday.

title: What a lovely day
comment: I was given a champagne cream tea by my daughter for Mother's Day we went early and walked the gardens  on are walk we meet up with the gardens and they gave me advice on my hanging baskets thank you I have started doing what they told me ....and it's working lol Make sure u go and see the pigs a must Service was wonderful cakes and sandwiches were lovely and the cakes we couldn't eat were boxed for us to take home ....and make sure u tea the white teas  I would loved to look round the house...it's a must

title: Wonderful afternoon, highly recommend
comment: 2nd time I have been to Great Fosters for afternoon tea and it's just such a gorgeous location over looking the gardens and little pond, ideally sit outdoors if u can It's great value for money as well and what you cannot finish you can take home with you- staff are very friendly and will box up left overs  Highly recommend

title: A fabulous sophisticated afternoon tea for a hen party
comment: Booked the Pimms afternoon tea for 8 of us to start my sister's hen party. A beautiful venue with lovely, friendly, attentive staff, the atmosphere was lovely, sumptuous sofas to sink into and every thought taken care of. The sandwiches and cakes were amazing and delicious - too much for us to finish on the day so they were beautifully boxed up for us to take away. A roam around the stunning gardens with some photo opportunities for the bride to be finished off the afternoon in style. I would recommend afternoon tea at Great Fosters for that special occasion and hope to be able to return sometime for an overnight stay.

title: Mums birthday!
comment: Wonderful afternoon and lovely tea! Great service, lovely grounds to wonder through afterwards. Took my mum for a birthday treat and it went down very well!

title: Very disappointing
comment: This was received as a gift and as such we need to restrain our comments. Very poor value for money. Quality of the food was average, and in one or two areas, tasteless. The service was rushed and inefficient, being seated at a very wobbly table was an experience we've never encountered before in a 4 star establishment, especially as a waiter had to place a considerable amount of cardboard under the table to stabilise it. This was after the drinks had been spilled...... The table position on the undulating floor was not appropriate and should have been dealt with prior to guests being seated. The staff, although pleasant, seemed more focused on maintaining their time schedule than the needs of the paying guest. The bill had to be presented three times before it was correct, and finally the "doggy bag" was so small that when opened back at home everything was crushed and mashed together. I feel this is a generous mark at "poor" and is only saved by the wonderful and extensive gardens. We have had afternoon tea at many, many quality establishments and this was by some way the worst. Cannot recommend.

title: Perfect afternoon tea for a bride-to-be
comment: I'm lucky enough to be getting married at Great Fosters next year - I wanted to show my bridesmaids how beautiful the venue is and we had a wonderful afternoon tea outside. The staff are warm, attentive and helpful, the food was delicious and we enjoyed selecting from the huge range of teas on offer. I will no doubt be back at Great Fosters many, many more times in the coming year!

title: Celebration Afternoon Tea
comment: Wonderful food, expertly served and time to enjoy in calming surroundings.  The weather was perfect enabling us to take advantage of the grounds following tea beside the water.

title: A delightful afternoon
comment: A perfect balance of tastes including a good selection of teas.....well priced and presented. Staff were friendly and attentive, without being over bearing. Definitely worth a return visit....

title: Nice afternoon tea
comment: Experienced an afternoon tea here with friends. Unfortunately we were moved inside because of the rain in the morning but when we arrived in the afternoon the rain had stopped and other guests were outside enjoying the grounds so not sure why they moved us considering we booked a table outside. The afternoon tea was nice, I've had much nicer at other venues though. The sandwiches were lovely but not served on a tier which is a shame, they are served on plates. The cakes and scones were nice too but nothing special. The Pimms is delicious. We then moved outside for cocktails, it's a beautiful setting. The cocktails are expensive but a nice treat.

title: Great place
comment: I have visited this restaurant a couple of times just after opening. Each time I enjoyed extraordinary food and friendly atmosphere. You must try ZRAZ and PIEROGI my personal favorites.

title: best pierogi
comment: If You want to try modern Polish cuisine you should visit this place. They offer the best pierogi which you can actually watch being made but also many more. Moreover you can enjoy great coffee and cakes in a cafe that is the part of restaurant. Next time in London I would visit Sowa again.

title: Afternoon Tea for Fathers Day 2016
comment: I have been to Great Fosters a number of times over the course of 30 years. The only thing that has changed are the accents of the staff 5 star service..real china, silver and wonderful food all served to you as if you are royalty

title: Nice
comment: Service was a little slow and awkward, I had scalding tea spilt on my foot and on the cloth. The sandwiches were nice. The scones were delicious. The very "bought in cakes" were ok. Lovely Hotel and beautiful grounds.

title: Simply Superb
comment: Can't say enough about this place, the service, the staff and the food are all wonderful, nothing is too much trouble. The gardens are a must see. We enjoyed it so much we have stayed on two occasions (The Coach House is an amazing experience) I can also recommend the restaurant for dinner, we had the pork sharing platter, a delicious selection of cuts from the herd reared at the estate, together with a Nero Di Troia wine that complimented perfectly. Definitely recommended.

title: Wonderful Afternoon Tea!
comment: We were very lucky to have had a break in the weather and decided to eat outside. The grounds at Great Fosters are beautiful and we also took the opportunity to have a look around while we waited for our reservation time. We both decided to go for the Pimm’s Afternoon Tea. Oh my goodness, the Pimm’s cocktail not only tasted wonderful, but the presentation in the glass was stunning. English Breakfast tea and Earl Grey was selected (not the most expansive list of teas we might see elsewhere, but nonetheless delicious) and then came the sandwiches. This must have been the softest bread we have tasted and the fillings were scrumptious (our personal favourites being the smoked salmon and cream cheese on beetroot bread, and roast beef, caramelised onion and rocket on kibbled onion bread. Yum.) They also offered us more after we have finished, which we always like. Sometimes people forget about the sandwich portion of an afternoon tea and it’s definitely not something you want to cast aside. The scones were lovely and warm, with plenty of jam and clotted cream. Very tasty too! There was also a mini Victoria sponge which was indeed very spongy, as well as an array of cakes! You do only get to try one of each, however I doubt we would have been able to eat everything if they had provided one of each cake to both of us! In fact, we didn’t finish everything, so were kindly provided with pretty boxes to take our leftovers home in. All in all a wonderful afternoon; in fact I think we rate it as one of our top afternoon teas (and believe me, we’ve done many)!

title: Christmas Gift - all the better for waiting for it!!
comment: Unusual take on the traditional afternoon tea. And the added luxury of a glass of champagne was much appreciated.

title: Really excellent experience for our wedding anniversary.
comment: The staff are very attentive and professional. Three different staff wished us Happy Anniversary before we even got into the restaurant. We had the Bollinger Rose afternoon tea which, whilst more than we would normally pay, was in fact very good value. They give everyone a pretty Great Fosters cardboard carrier to take home the rest of their cakes - no-one could possibly finish everything in one sitting. So we had a nice afternoon tea the following afternoon at home! Guests are encouraged to use the hotel facilities after tea, so many of the people who came for tea sat out on the terrace, in the sunshine, enjoying the beautiful gardens. We were given an offer of a free glass of champagne per person if we booked a weekday lunch. We did this the following week for a birthday meal and had an excellent lunch in the Estate Grill.

title: Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters - Lovely but Pricey!
comment: Beautiful setting, lovely environment, gorgeous soft furnishings & matching tea service. Food was lovely, service was good (had trouble hearing the waitress as there was a noisy group on the table next to ours) A pricey afternoon & VERY disappointed to see a service charge of £20.45 added to our already extortionate bill of over £200 for 5 of us (plus prosecco) To be fair they did remove it when I challenged it but it was embarrassing and very cheeky. Would not return due to this.

title: Lovely afternoon tea & delicious gluten- free option
comment: Fab afternoon tea outside in the beautiful gardens on a rare day of sun! We chose Great Fosters as my Mum was visiting and she is a coeliac and the gluten-free option had been recommended. It was a great choice as all the food was delightful and the staff were all extremely polite & friendly. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend and hope we have a chance to visit again soon.

title: Lovely way to spend a sunny afternoon
comment: Fabulous setting for our afternoon tea - good choice of sandwiches - lovely scones made all the better being able to sit outside in their lovely grounds. Pimms was a good choice - also liked being offered more sandwiches and unlimited tea or coffee.

title: Great setting
comment: Lovely setting and fantastic service, well worth the visit. Great selection of sandwiches and cakes.

title: Lunch
comment: The best polish restaurant in London  Food is outstanding , there is a wide variaty for meat lovers and vegetarians . Personally I recommend fish it's lovely and tasty , portions are about right , not too much and not too little. I admire attention to the details , because presentation on the plate it sales the dish itself .  This restaurant represents highest standard of dining . As a recently open restaurant staff is trying hard to please the customer but it feels like they need a bit more time to adapt to a new place.  I will be back there again and most definitely for my Sunday lunch.

title: Feels like W1!
comment: Took my mum for a birthday lunch and we both loved it! The food is delicious and served in a very elegant way, the cakes are to die for ☺ My favorite place in Ealing, will be back soon!

title: Waiting time
comment: We have been visiting this place many but is seems that the customer service is not getting any better! We wanted just to spend some Sunday afternoon time for coffee.To place an order took more than 10 min, after another 30min waiting for coffee and cake we just simply left the restaurant. We have also asked to speak to the manager but apparently on busy Sunday afternoon there was none from management there. They should be more organised especially if they know that weekends are extremely busy. Half of the menu was not available and poor waitress was not aware of that. Basically is very chaotic and disorganised, staff seems lost!!!! They all need good manager and supervisor who will put all the place in order. Trainings!!! Have you people ever heard about It !!!!! Very disappointed!!!

title: Delicious dumplings
comment: Had a dinner with a friend there, the herring starter was delicious and the dumplings main course was even better. The portions were very generous so unfortunately we couldn't any puddings - we were too full. The service was ok, but could have been more attentive.

title: Charming location, charming staff, scrumptious tea!
comment: And charming company, as I went for afternoon tea with my teenage daughter. We booked for an indoor tea, as we couldn't rely on the weather, and were in the Tudor Room, which is always a treat. We particularly appreciated the hotel's policy of refreshing the tea with a different one if desired, as this gave us the confidence to try new ones. Also having the lovely boxes to take leftover cakes home in meant my husband and son could try them too!

title: 90th birthday treat
comment: I took my ex gardener who had been with me for 28 years , he left 2 years ago due to ill health . It is his 90 th birthday tomorrow . He loved it, and enjoyed his first ever glass of pimms. We walked around the grounds before leaving. A wonderful afternoon.

title: Champagne afternoon tea
comment: Enjoyed champagne afternoon tea at Great Fosters with my daughter. ( a gift from my son and his girlfriend) We sat outside by the moat making use of the cosy blankets over our knees. The staff were polite attentive and explained what the sandwiches and cakes were made from. After our delicious tea we strolled around the beautiful and extensive grounds. The cakes we couldn't manage to eat were boxed up for us to take home. A nice touch.

title: Amazing pierogi
comment: If you want pierogi, this is the place to go. It has a wonderful atmosphere and a delicious polish patisserie annexed. You can see, behind the glass, polish grandmothers (babcha) making them by hand. You can try various fillings or stick to one filling. We tried a combination and couldn't decide which one we preferred. Also, their steak tartare, albeit small, was absolutely delicious.  Plus, once you're done with savoury, they have a fantastic patisserie to cater for the sweetest of sweet tooths.

title: fantastic food
comment: It has been a real pleasure to eat in Sowa Restaurant in Ealing, London. Delicious food. Highly recomanded

title: Tasty Polish Food at a Reasonable Price
comment: We have been to this restaurant many times, but this is the first visit since its refurbishment. It was lovely before, and we were relieved to find that the standard of the food was as high as ever. Waitress service now, much bigger floor space due to the addition of a second floor, plus a Polish patisserie/cafe adjoining. There is also a glass booth where you can see the pierogi (dumplings/ravioli) being made from scratch (and I know how difficult and time consuming that is from personal experience). We had pierogi filled with potato and cheese, dressed with caramelised onions and a white sauce on the side, plus traditional Polish seasonal salad. We ordered our desert from the massive choice of cakes in the patisserie. For anyone who does not know about Polish cakes, while different, they are at least the equal of French patisseries, they really are that good. You don't need to be Polish to enjoy the food on offer. Whilst traditional, there is plenty of good, hearty meat and two veg dishes on offer for the discerning English palette. We saw some interesting garnishes eg pansies - very decorative, as well as edible. My very English husband loves the food, including the pierogi.

title: A new regular for us
comment: Love this very popular new London branch of Sowa.. there are several in Poland and one in Berlin with a proven track record. Patisserie, cafe and restaurant with well prepared and beautifully presented Polish classics with a twist, using quality ingredients. I love their steak Tatare, freshly made pierogi (you can see them being made right there!) the pork loin, Sharbowy and duck main dishes are delicious and generous in size .. and there's an amazing selection of cakes to choose from... one Polish classic is missing .. the nostalgic fruit compote! Service is friendly can be a bit slow at times .. however, the upside of this .. you will not be rushed through your meal and the vibrant atmosphere compensate for these occasions.

title: Amazing food, elegant/posh place
comment: I've been there for few times already on few occasions. Amazing, delicious food, professional staff, elegant ambience, over all the best quality for your money. It can be an amazing place for a romantic dinner or eating out with your friends or family. The food is so tasty and the attention to every detail really overwhelmed me for the first time I have been in there. I really recommend it for a night out or a small party.

title: Great polish cuisine
comment: 'Sowa restaurant' offers very good polish food which is a modern version of traditional dishes from Poland.  The food was really tasty, nicely served. The service was very professional. They have menus both in Polish and English - although most of the guests are Poles missing good polish food. And this is the place where they can find it!

title: The best Polish food ever !!!!!
comment: What can be said about this place ?? This is one of the best , and I would say even the best Polish restaurant in London !! believe it or not, but I've tried a few , but this is the place from which each of us can be proud of and without shame can invite guests to bring them to taste the true Polish cuisine . all my friends including me love this place

title: dinner
comment: I was in the Sowa Restaurant in London, enjoying a delicious dinner. Very good food and service. I recomend hotly.

title: Excellent Polish Cuisine Moderately Priced
comment: Sowa Restaurant is next to Sowa Patisserie where you can buy most exquisite cakes and pastry which was, actually, our aim. Somehow we decided to have lunch first.  It was Sunday and all tables had been booked but we were lucky one party didn't turn up. It is a lovely, newly refurbished restaurant with a nice ambience and delectable Polish cuisine. They serve mostly meat dishes, but vegetarians can find a few dishes as well. My daughter who is vegetarian enjoyed broach with cream (beetroot soup) and dumplings with a mixture of potatoes and cottage cheese. I also went for dumplings with wild boar meet served in chanterelle cause. Absolutely amazing!!!  There are four or five soups. About 10 mains, including geese, duck, chicken beef, pork, all beautifully presented. There are also three salads and a few extra sides.  The food is cooked according to traditional Polish recipes with a slight modern twist. There were many families with children and people of all ages.  I can sincerely recommend Sowa Restaurant to anyone who enjoys good food.

title: Hard to describe by words
comment: After 2-3 weeks since they opened the restaurant we decided to try our traditional polish food. First visit was terrible only because of poor service. Thousands of useless glasses on the tables, wrong set up, our waiter without any experience. Someone informed us that they are very busy. Service was very slow, restaurant had more empty tables than taken ones. Starters was served after 30 minutes. We didnt even finish the soup and main course came. While paying the bill our waiter asked if we want to give him a tip. What kind of behaviour is it? it was embarrassing.  However chefs saved this restaurant from total defeat by the delicious food. Second visit was totally different then the first one. First of all, our friendly blond hair waitress has a big knowledge about the menu and drinks.  I can't describe the taste because suitable words about this food doesn't exist. It's our favourite restaurant and we recommend it all our friends.

title: Such a nice experience!
