comment: Coming to Sowa Restaurant was really lovely. The service was fantastic and the waiters were really kind and helpful. They had very good knowledge about the menu. You can see how the traditional polish pierogi is made. I didn't wait very long for the food and when i got it, the presentation was fabulous and professional. The food was delicious and very unique. I also ordered a lava cake which was so tasty. The whole restaurant was beautifully designed. Beside sowa restaurant there is sowa patisserie where they sell cakes, deserts and lots more. The room upstairs is very calm and climactic. Will visit again, for sure.

title: A phenomenal restaurant
comment: The first thing that struck me about Sowa restaurant is the atmosphere inside the restaurant is the atmosphere that was very suitable for dinner; peaceful and well lit. The atmosphere of the restaurant made the whole experience even more pleasant and enjoyable. The most major things that have given me a very high opinion of this restaurant was the service and the food. The service was very good and helpful at all times. However, the most impressive thing about Sowa restaurant is the food, i had the ribs and apart from being presented in a very nice way, the food was delicious and so was my friend's steak. The food is fresh and served with original sauces and spices.The dessert was also very tasty, however if you do not want to eat dessert at the restaurant you can always cross over to Sowa patisserie and enjoy cake and coffee. Overall the experience was one that I wont forget and would highly recommend visiting the restaurant to anyone and everyone, i will definitely visit again.

title: Jola
comment: The BEST restaurant, the BEST food, the most friendly atmosphere. Traditional Polish food. Even small children will enjoy.  Fully recommended.

title: Family dinner
comment: Absolutely delicious! Elegant and comfortable, and very friendly atmosphere.  Great for business, family dinner or a date.

title: One of the best Afternoon Teas
comment: I love it here, it's one of my favourite places (but I'm slightly biased as it is where I got married!) such a beautiful building and grounds. I've had lots of afternoon teas and I still think this is one of the tastiest and most generous ones. It's right up there with London's best and the price is very reasonable in comparison. Food is always excellent quality and I adore the sandwiches- it is great that they come round and offer you more. The only small complaint I have is that, although the pastries are delicious and dainty you have to cut them in half and share them- you don't get to have one of them each, but perhaps I'm just being greedy, as I still almost always come away with a goody bag because I can't eat it all! Well worth a visit especially if you want lovely surroundings and don't want to completely break the bank. If the weather is good I highly recommend a wander round the lovely gardens and grounds.

title: Fabulous treat
comment: This was a treat from our girls for the Pimms afternoon tea, despite it being one of the hottest days of the year the staff were fantastic from making sure that our table in the garden was shaded by the umbrella to advising us on the different speciality teas, very pleasantly surprised that we were offered seconds of the delicious sandwiches and the cakes we couldn't manage were boxed up and given to us to bring home. We would definitely recommend this, beautiful setting, superb staff, delicious tea.we will be returning soon.

title: Daughter's Christening
comment: I had my daughter's Christening party in the restaurant today and food was soo amazing! We had a three course meal with a great cake at the end. All guests were delighted with the quality of food, professional service and amazing atmosphere. I can not describe how good it was. Time wise I am gutted that it ended so quickly as couple of hours passed like seconds. I will recommend for all family events especially with kids. Great place to eat and have an amazing party. Jacob

title: Test sensations
comment: I thought I knew already the best Polish taste experience... I was wrong! Sowa restaurant raised the best memories of my childhood... guess what it was?... Dumplings :-) !!! I saw the lady was making them behind the screen. Real homemade with any stuffing you wish... Fantastic, awesome, mouth watering!!! They made my day :-) Desserrts - the same! The atmosphere - nice! Very nice and clean place with good mood! I can recommend this place with a clear conscience! If you visit the Ealing Broadway - do not forget about the Sowa Restaurant on 33 High Street!

title: Excellent Traditional Food
comment: As you enter the place you are welcomed by a magnificent setting, a restaurant with tradition. The service accompany with the high quality of the cooking. The owners, are always around willing to exchange some kind words with all thier clients. The products were fresh and the dishes had the warmth of home-made food. The chefs and owners take great care in selecting the best quality ingredients. I am a vegetarian In particular, my attention attracted by good quality selected seasonal vegetables. I had a pleasant dining experience with food of the most exquisite flavors. For this reason I highly recommend going to the Sowa Restaurant.

title: Polish food
comment: If you want to try Polish food in West London - Sowa Restaurant is a place to go. Great atmosphere and fantastic food. You will not find better pierogi anywhere else in London! All possible fillings you could think of too :) It is a very clean and well managed place with a friendly staff to take you through the journey of experiencing the Eastern European Food.  oh when you finish your mains - why not to have a look on caffee next door (just separated from restaurant with the glass wall so you can see all goodies there while eating you mains). All cakes you could dream of and good selection of teas and fresh juices. Yum yum nom nom :)

title: Great cake!
comment: Best cake I have eaten so far. So soft and smooth, delicious! The atmosphere is good, people are so kind. Love the restaurant!

title: Excellent Food
comment: We can always relax in here whilist having a nice glass of wine and the food is of a really high standard, so good in fact that we are here every Sunday with our friends for lunch. Staff is really friendly. Sadly we are going on holiday for 3 weeks so we will not be able to have lunch in there on Sunday.. Hopefully when we will be back they will have some new positions in the menu as we know it all already!!!! Perhaps some different special on every Sunday???

title: Amazing experience
comment: We had a family event there yesterday and everything was excellent from the ambiance,decor service not to mention the fantastic food. The meal and dessert just ridiculously good definitely worth five stars if not more.

title: Best polish restaurant in London
comment: Visited the place twice already and will be returning no doubts :)  The interior is nice and modern , the food is very very good, especially pierogi which are made in front of you freshly. Nice selection of polish classics, and the staff is amazing. Recommending checking the desert menu as it is mind blowing. Don't forget to buy some polish bread to take home !  It is in Ealing Broadway which is a bit inconvenient but it's so nice that is with a trip across London .

title: Standard Has Slipped
comment: I've eaten here a few times and each time it has been very enjoyable apart from two weeks ago when lunch was pretty bland and uninspiring. We had the chicken and fish main which we had both had before. Both dishes had changed and didn't taste of much at all, the chicken and fish was dry and over cooked. We will probably give it another try but its a shame the standards appear to have dropped.

title: I'm to happy to visit again :))
comment: This my second time visiting and really enjoyed this experience. I ordered veal chop wellington and the waiters were very informative and knew a lot about the menu. After eating in Sowa Restaurant and I enjoyed a slice of cake ice tea. The cake was delicious and an explosion of flavours. Will for sure visit again.

title: amazing cakes!
comment: Highly recommended cake store, especially the chocolate cake with crunchy bits inside is amazing! They  Reciently they renovated the whole place and there is more seating space and it looks like an expensive cafe.

title: Excellent food and good service
comment: We discovered an excellent place here, with great soups, good (even if too big potions ) main course and excellent deserts. Friendly, prompt and professional staff. Very clean place, modern design and friendly atmosphere. We are definetely coming back!

title: Terrific
comment: Champagne afternoon tea. The warm and friendly welcome was the prelude to a wonderful afternoon. Stunning and relaxing surroundings, warm, friendly and attentive staff, what more could anyone want. The quality and selection of teas, sandwiches and cakes was fantastic and generous to a fault. We will definitely be back and we will bring our relatives from Australia with us. .....A review I am proud to post.

title: Out of this world.................. superb
comment: very nice choice of cakes which we had boxed up to take away with us,the tea selection was fabulous and the scones soo yummy with jam and cream....such a wonderful experience

title: Just love it !
comment: I been there already couple of times and never disappointed. Food is absolutely amazing and full of taste. Perfect for nice dinner with glass of wine or cocktail.  Strongly recommend!

title: Delicious Afternoon Tea
comment: This was a second visit for Afternoon tea and this time was much better. We were in the Tudor Room and had the standard tea, this started with pots of various teas or coffee and a plate of 5 different finger sandwiches which were lovely (plenty of seconds if you want them) then the cake stand came out with warm scones, a small Victoria sponge to share and 6 mini cakes and pastries which were all delicious. The setting of the hotel and the gardens are beautiful and the interior with roaring fires a delight!

title: Happy client.
comment: I visited this restaurant several times and always have fabulous experience, food is amazing, professional staff, stoning interior. My Christmas party for 50 people was all so amazing. Highly Recommended.

title: Great Experience!
comment: I visited Sowa Restaurant as I had to book a work lunch for 15 people, and was extremely impressed by the experience. The staff were really lovely and helpful when organising the booking, and allowed us to pre-order our meals as we only had an hour for lunch. The restaurant décor is lovely, and we arrived to find that a table had been set up for us, with the soups were served as soon as we arrived. The food was very high quality, and the lunch menu was good value at less than 10 pounds for a soup, juice and a large main. The service was also excellent and very efficient, and at the end we were all able to pay individually at the end by card or cash, with no fuss whatsoever. Having organised several work lunches in Ealing, Sowa Restaurant was the best experience so far – overall I found the staff so considerate and helpful, and would highly recommend Sowa Restaurant to anyone.

title: We will come back for more
comment: We travelled to Ealing from the opposite side of London to visit an Italian restaurant recommended by a friend, but when we saw Sowa, we decided to give the Italian place a miss. Food is delicious, hot, served promptly, and most importantly it looks and tastes different. We need a Sowa in our part of London, too!

title: Great Polish Restaurant in Ealing
comment: We had a really lovely meal here for my partner's birthday and we were given a nice, central table. The food was absolutely delicious and I would have given 5 *s apart from the fact that there were a number of fruit flies buzzing around us which was really annoying but certainly didn't detract from the food. The portions were a good size, and I have leftovers which I can't wait to tuck into.  I would definitely return, I just hope the fruit fly situation can be sorted out.  Thanks to those working last night who made it a thoroughly enjoyable evening.

title: Fantastic homemade lunch at great £ deal
comment: I had a very tasty lunch, with great service at less than £10p.p. The surroundings are looked after very well and standards are very high. Family friendly with clean facilities.  Decent affordable restaurant, will be back before too long.  Many thanks

title: The best food in London
comment: Great Polish food, very nice and friendly staff, the best thing is variety of meals, definitely one of the must go in Ealing. Good place to celebrate a family event, or just have coffee with friends

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Fabulous location, amazing food, delightful staff. Highly recommend having a relaxing Afternoon Tea here

title: Fantastic service
comment: Had our 2nd anniversary treat here, staff very attentive, when we first arrived greeted at reception by the manager who personally escorted us to the bar area where our afternoon tea would be served. We unfortunately had a dirty sugar spoon and cup on our table that we highlighted to the waitress who was mortified and couldn't appologise enough, after that things went well, plenty of sandwiches were offered to us and far too many cakes for us to eat in one sitting, thankfully they have thought of this and are ready with the cake boxes as just about everyone took some cakes home. Only thing I would have liked would have been an offerring of more tea at an earlier time as by the time the waitress could get back to us as they were busy the need had passed. Great setting though and made to feel very very welcome, will certainly be back as great value for money.

title: Excellent food with lovely atmoshere
comment: We tried Sowa for the first time on Saturday evening, the restaurant is very cosy, the staff is helpful and kind, the food was excellent and the price is reasonable. Really happy about our experience and we will definitely come back.

title: Excellent food and value for money
comment: A pleasing decor, helpful staff and surprisingly attractive presentation of food. I have eaten à la carte and the weekday set menu and found the food delicious. I also enjoyed watching the live demonstration of the lady making pierogi. I highly recommend eating here.

title: Fabulous in all respects. A fine dining restaurant.
comment: The last time I tried Polish food was about 15 years ago at a restaurant in Hammersmith. There was limited choice and the food was not great - lots of heavy dumplings. I came passed here a few weeks ago and looked at the extensive menu which includes dishes to suit almost everyone plus a few vegetarian choices. I persuaded my wife to give it a go so we came for lunch on Saturday. They were almost full but found us a table. Service was prompt and we were soon eating a fabulous wild mushroom soup. The soup was served from a jug and poured over a very decorative arrangement of cooked wild mushrooms. On the outside rim of the soup plate were delicate dollops of garlic mushroom puree. The flavour was fantastic. For main course my wife went for beef cheeks in a sour cherry sauce and I went for beef loin cooked medium rare. Both these dishes were beautifully presented and you could tell the ingredients were fresh and great quality. The dishes were both made up of loads of different elements and were complex. The beef cheeks were served with delicate and light dumplings and my beef with tasty waxy roast potatoes plus lots of vegetables. Also the portions were substantial. For dessert we shared apple pie served 3 ways with ice cream - all were lovely and had a perfect balance of sweet and sour. The coffee was good as well and including sparkling water and a beer the bill came to just over £30 a head which s reasonable for the quality. Service was delightful. The waitress was very pleasant and served us in a formal manner. I was hugely impressed by this restaurant which is truly a fine dining experience and probably the best quality in Ealing. If I had to make one criticism I would have liked to see a better choice of wine by the glass and I think the food deserves a few more interesting wines by the bottle too.

title: Authentic polish food
comment: Ealing where large numbers of Poles settled after the Second World War is the home of one of the best polish restaurants and definitely the best polish coffee shop with a huge variety of cakes ice creams and pastries. I had a set lunch of free soup free cherry compote drink and a fish dish for just under £10. Friendly and efficient polish service. There's no rush to leave either. And if you are on your own you can watch the pierogi (traditional Polish dumplings) chef make them while you are eating. The decor is cheerful and warm and the preparation areas hygienic. Good home cooking and popular with families too.

title: Yum Yum
comment: Ate here last night.We tried Polish food in Krakow a couple of years ago and have been looking for a good Polish restaurant for a while. Bingo job done. My wife started with the mushroom soup and then had Pierogi I didn't have the starter but had the pork knuckle saurkraut and mash. I'm really glad I skipped the starter .  My mains was lovely ,my other half was equally impressed. There's a Danish word that sums up the atmosphere "Hygge".Warm cosy ,friendly but not loud,ideal for a cold winters evening. We both finished with ice cream ,me chocolate her caramel. The bill was 43 including drinks. Really good value for what we had. It's really nice to find a local restaurant that you want to go back to.

title: Tranquil Elegance
comment: A group of four of us had a Friday afternoon tea here. The foul weather was more than compensated by the gorgeous house and sense of history. We did also enjoy walking the grounds under large umbrellas supplied by Great Fosters The tea was superb with an excellent selection of savoury and sweet offerings with the possibility of having as many different tea drinks we wanted. The service was non-intrusive and excellent when we needed it. We spent an afternoon luxuriating, enjoying and truly relaxing in a large quiet sitting room with wonderful log fire. We left sated and feeling we'd eaten more than a large meal - all for under the price of such a meal. I can't wait to have another tea there, possibly outside when weather permits. Highly recommend.

title: Afternoon tea two weeks ago for a special family celebration
comment: All aspects of our visit for afternoon tea was really very good. Food was of a high standard and the service was discreet, thoughtful and efficient. A really good experience and I would both recommend and return again.

title: Truly fabulous afternoon tea at a truly fabulously located hotel - Great Fosters
comment: Attentive service, with only one slight slip-up - forgot to bring out the plate of veggie sandwiches for our birthday girl - but never mind, eh? Everything else was wonderful; tasty sandwiches, scones with scoops of clotted cream and lashings of strawberry jam, and dainty cakes, washed down with a terrific choice of teas, coffee, or hot chocolate. After all this, it was a pleasure to walk around the extensive grounds with topiary garden and moat, with outdoor sculptures. A great many of the rich and famous have stayed here since the 1930s, so I don't suppose for a moment that it's cheap to hire a room, but apparently they are very special. It's something I will definitely do when I've won the lottery.

title: Anniversary afternoon tea.
comment: A group of us went along to great fosters for afternoon tea,to celebrate the 1st anniversary of my daughter and son in law who got married last year on 13/11/15. All I can say is it was superb,we mostly all had a champagne afternoon tea. The sandwiches were superb,nice and fresh and lovely fillings.The tea was also lovely exactly how we all liked it! Nothing was too much trouble and they made a separate cheese sandwich for my granddaughter and also made her a hot chocolate. The sandwiches were plentiful, as were the scones ,cream and jam.The little fancies were lovely and loads of them too. Also a lovely touch was the chef had done a blackboard with a happy anniversary message and cakes. There were 10 of us plus a toddler and baby. The service was very attentive without being intrusive and we all said we had a lovely afternoon

title: Fabulous!
comment: Excellent hidden gem in the heart of Ealing! Modern Polish/European food, full of flavour and cooked perfectly. Starters, mains and deserts equally excellent. A must try for everyone! If you voted for Brexit - this place will make you regret your vote... on top of that staff is professional and friendly. Book a visit today.

title: A local, to me, attraction
comment: This is a stunning local venue. I can not fault the service at all but their prices are eye watering.

title: A quick bite
comment: Oh my word. What a gorgeous little place. The food is so so good. The duck and the dumplings are absolutely mouth watering. Lovely atmosphere and the staff are very good and attentive.  Definitely coming back.  Oh and try the cake. The sponge cake with fresh cream.

title: Food great, customer service not so great
comment: Having been there several times to eat I have always enjoyed the food and the service has been adequate. When I booked a function for 14 the communication between the manageress/owner was non existent. It was virtually impossible to get hold of her, nothing was received by email from her despite assurances and promises that it would be, etc, etc. Then after I cancelled had several phone calls from different people at the restaurant assking about various things. Terribly disjointed management,

title: Really nice Polish Food & reasonably priced
comment: Have tried this place few times with my Polish friends and food is great and also very reasonably priced.  I have been to few other Polish restaurants in London in the past (Tatra & Patio in Shep. Bush and Daquise in South Ken.) and found that food in Sowa is as good as the other ones if not better. Also the cakes in their bakery (specially the Polish dacquoise) are fantastic.  Cosy and warm atmosphere in the restaurant with 'most of the waiting staff' actually happy to serve customers.

title: One of the best steak ever
comment: One of the best steak in my life. This is not my first visit, the service of the staff from start to finish is impeccable. They are highly knowledgeable on the subject of meat (stake is particular of course) yet extremely down to earth and always available to give a helping hand. The food is exquisite with wonderful flavour which you can really taste the difference. All in all a very special experience which I can't recommend enough. Thanks so much and see you soon

title: Amazing cakes
comment: Having tried the restaurant a few weeks ago my wife and I decided to give the cafe a try. We had cappuccino which were very well made and quite reasonable in price plus a large piece of apple strudel (superb as lots of fresh apple, not much pastry and not too sweet) and a piece of traditional Polish cheesecake which for shop bought was very good having a nice consistency and a clean taste - not as good as my wife's though. The bill came to £11 which I thought was good value for the quality, service and luxurious setting.

title: Festive Dinner
comment: During the christmas time I went with my family to a dinner at this restaurant on the 26th December. I was once again taken back by the excellent quality of the food. The mushroom soup was served in an inventive manor and I enjoyed very much, as well as the festive duck dish. I will definitely come back each time i visit London.

title: Oh I love this place!
comment: There is absolutely nothing to fault this restaurant. Big plates of fresh authentic Polish food, tasty & very well priced. We have been a few times already, it's a nice touch to be able to see them making the pierogi right in front of you too! Good friendly service & amazing desserts too - if you can somehow fit any in!  Of course we will be back.

title: So glad I brought my business contacts here for dinner.
comment: Unexpectedly I had to find a restaurant to bring some very wealthy and well travelled business contacts to dinner. These guys have dined at some of the best restaurants all around the world but Polish food is not something they generally go for as their experience has not been so great in Poland. I was a little nervous but decided to give this place a go as the food was amazing when I tried it a few weeks ago. I had nothing to worry about. They absolutely loved everything about the food. They enjoyed the mix of homestyle cooking (pork knuckle. tongue, dumplings) that are lifted to great heights by the quality of ingredients, portion size and beautiful presentation on the plate. There was no fault with the food. The waitresses were really lovely and helpful but they could do with just a little more training to be spot on. A 3 course meal with a pint of beer each, water and coffee came to about £35 before service so not expensive.

title: A++
comment: What a fantastic restaurant. Attention to detail is beyond fantastic. Technical skills of the chefs are A++. Every course beautifully presented, and delicious. My new go to restaurant for exceptional Polish food. Very impressed! Keep it up!

title: Great Polish home style cooking, just like grandma used to make
comment: I've eaten here a few times because the food reminds me so much of grandma's home cooking but remember to leave room for dessert with so many delicious cakes on offer. My father flew over from Oz for a visit so I couldn't think of a better opportunity for him to enjoy food he was raised with. The restaurant has a lovely decor, very comfortable seating and tables. Of course the waitress staff speak Polish but they are equally happy to speak English and are very polite. They answer questions about food without rushing you and are enthusiastic about sharing their homeland's cuisine - all fabulous reasons to eat here.  We started with Mushroom Dumpling Soup (see pic) which my father loved, an assortment of Pierogi (dumplings) - Boar Meat (see pic), Mushroom & Sauerkraut (see pic), Crispy Buckwheat (see pic) all were delicious and everyone at the table fought over who was going to eat the last one on each plate. Mains were Veal Wellington (see pic) which was so amazing and highly recommended, Beef Cheeks with Potato Dumplings (see pic) - yummy plus. Desserts were Hot Chocolate (see pic) which is really rich chocolatey and perfect on a cold or wet night, Apple Strudel with Ice Cream (see pic) which was clearly delicious as the person eating it almost finished in a matter of minutes! Cheesecake is a Polish specialty made with love and every grandmother or mother declaring theirs the best so if you want a taste of Poland you have to eat cheesecake, Sowa's lived up to my father's high standards so much that he ordered a second serve.

title: Wonderful location and service
comment: Great location with comfortable lounge chairs and log fire on a very cold January Sunday afternoon. Excellent service, polite, available, but not over-powering. Really good choice of teas. The sandwiches were good with interesting breads but the fillings were very thin. The cakes were very good - although the Victoria sponge was slightly dry. The Scones were light and warm, the individual cakes were interesting and tasty, and those we didn't eat at the time were packaged nicely to take home. We had 2 hours and that was plenty of time, and we walked around the impressive building and gardens after. Unhurried and welcoming. Would return again.

title: Wonderful afternoon tea
comment: Sublime afternoon tea. Excellent choice of teas. Plenty more sandwiches on offer if you're hungry. Lovely scones, Victoria sandwich and selection of cakes. Such lovely gardens to look at and walk around. Staff very attentive. Cocktails available if you're that way inclined. Great for a special celebration.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: This is my 2nd visit to the hotel and both times have not disappointed. The building and grounds are exquisite. The hotel is well signposted and easy to find. The food was delicious and the staff were both pleasant and attentive. The atmosphere was relaxing, crackling open fireplace and fascinating artwork.

title: Little quiet spot
comment: We went there in a weekday morning, and was hoping to get breakfast. But please be aware that their kitchen doesn't open until 10am, so if you're looking for Polish eggs kind of hearty breakfast beyond pastries, don't go too early.  Otherwise, coffees, smoothies and juices are delicious! We hung out till 10am and ordered their breakfast plates and were quite happy about them!

title: Mother day
comment: I went with my family to Sowa restaurant to celebrate mother day.Excellent service food atmosphere strong 6*

title: Great food and service
comment: A lovely restaurant attached to a Bakery & Patisserie. Interesting menu with Polish Sour Sop and other specialities. I had the Beef main course and both of my companions had Pork Knuckle. The main dishes were stylishly well presented. The meal was rounded off with a selection from the fantastic array of pastries on display in the adjoining bakery. Well worth a visit and reasonably priced too. Thoroughly recommended!

title: Uniquely excellent
comment: One needs booking I guess due to its popularity. One of those restaurants with comfortable armless sofa chairs to make you at ease before you even look at the Polish menu. Also well decorated. Had mushroom soup as a starter with mushrooms from Polish forests. The softest mushrooms I have ever had. Enjoyed my main as a duck fillet. Very smart and efficient staff. For wine lovers a wide variety menu is available with excellent wines red, white and sweet ones.  Undoubtedly one of the best small restaurants I have been to. Note that nearby is Ealing Broadway for those into shopping. Parking is 5 minutes walk. Adjacent to the restaurant is their sowacaffe which you clearly see since the separation is a clear glass wall.

title: Lovely evening
comment: I visited recently for an evening meal with my partner. Food was beautifully presented and delicious, some really interesting and unusual menu choices. The boar pierogi were fantastic. Would definitely return!

title: Wow! Another great lunch!
comment: It has to be said - it is The Best Place for lunch in Ealing! Who says that salmon has to be boring. Just look at the photo, it tasted as good as it looked!

title: High End eating comes to Ealing
comment: The atmosphere is slightly austere in an understated way. You will see a lot of owls. The meal was not austere: very inventive and seductive, much like the cooking shows that over use the statement 'great plate of food'. Every mouthful was slightly different - with every combination working in my opinion.  As the place is also a patisserie, the cakes also looked amazing.

title: Lunch special with pierogi
comment: I chose the lunch special of soup and pierogi - for 9.95 (?) ish... you get more delicious food than you need. The pierogi filled with meat come in a portion of 8 and are perfect! I will definitely return soon

title: Delicious and authentic Polish food
comment: If you want experience and enjoy authentic polish cousins, Sowa is the best place. I have tried pierogi and schabowy. Taste was outstanding and reminded me of my mum and grandma's cooking.  Cakes are so yummy that you can't get enough of it. I would recommend jablecznik or variety of cheesecakes.  They offer different type of draft beers and vodkas. The pace is cosy and fantastic for lunch or dinner or even a coffee. Perfect for a date or family dinner. Staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful.  I love going back there ! Highly recommended !

title: Very good food
comment: My first visit but the food was amazing !!!! Friendly service Place to go !!!! See you soon for sure........

title: Polish food wrapped up
comment: 4 stars for the restaurant, 3.75 stars for the food. 'Sowa' means owl in Polish. This modern, spacious, comfortable, elegant Polish restaurant in busy Ealing has quite a few images of owls decorating it. The restaurant is attached to a café, where a truly mouth-watering selection of cakes may be bought. We opted for the set lunch, which includes a soup and a main course, along with a glass of lemonade. The mushroom soup was perfect. The pierogis, which are hand-made to order in a glass booth easily visible from the restaurant, were served in generous portions. We tried the meat-filled ones and also those filled with potato and cheese. They were all perfectly tasty, but I always find that the pasta surrounding pierogi is too thick. I prefer the thinner wrapping used to enclose the fillings of Chinese dumplings and some Italian filled-pasta.  Service was efficient and friendly. I hope to return to Sowa to try items on its à-la-carte menu. The restaurant and its toilets are well-maintained and spotlessly clean.

title: Pricey Polish Restaurant
comment: I love the dumplings and something had a crave to go and eat the biggest portion they have! Apart from that, the restaurant is very expensive. The menu is very sophisticated and prices are high. For the same price you can eat locally and probably you will get bigger portions.

title: Could not fault anything!
comment: Last night we had our anniversary. From some time we were going to visit Sowa restaurant. We have already been few times for mouth watering desserts and cakes from the pattiserie whcih is part of the restaurant. Let me say this, we could not fault anything at all. Service was good, place kept to high standards but most importantly - food. Polish cousine full of flavour. Perfectly cooked by the maestro in the kitchen. Great value for money also. You must try the pierogi with boar meat and beef tartare or smkd fish starter. As me being Polish i give this review 5/5 for autencity and quality of food. Will be coming back again!

title: Lovely Rhubarb Tea and cake
comment: Not been in here for a while. Wanted a cool long drink. Tried Rhubarb Tea which is earl grey with rhubarb syrup and lemon served over ice. Very delicious. Also had St John's cake I think it was called which is fruit crumble with a layer of custard. Gooseberry in it so not too sweet. Also had a great quality coffee. Staff lovely as ever.

title: Tea and Coffee visit
comment: Stopped by for a tea and a coffee. Staff helpful, ordered at the counter and sat down, drinks were brought to the table by the staff. Nice pot of tea and real fresh milk (really hate places that serve pre packed UHT tubs of milk). Lovely fresh looking establishment. will visit again as the cakes looked lovely.

title: A treat for your eyes!
comment: I have been several times and each time has been faultless. Not only is the food excellent but the presentations are thought out. Good choice of starters and meals always cooked to perfection and full of flavour. One of the best steak I ever had, accompanied with sides too. Meat lovers should not miss it. Service is also great - very charming and attentive.  Highly recommend! I will definitely back to this restaurant again!

title: Delicious afternoon tea
comment: We had a fabulous afternoon tea and wander round this lovely place and I was excited as I will be getting married there next year. The staff were friendly and attentive from the start. We were spoiled for choice with the range of tea varieties offered and the gorgeous food; first sandwiches with different types of bread, then scones, a small Victoria sponge and a range of different cakes. All items were explained, looked and tasted stunning. Our favourite was a lovely chocolate tart with popping candy on the top. We were beaten by the quantity of food, but we were able to take the left overs with us. Thank you so much for making us feel welcome. We had a great visit.

title: The wonderful historic setting and the friendly staff
comment: Afternoon tea was excellent in every way - great sandwiches, cakes and service. The surroundings are wonderful and have a good atmosphere based on the history of Great Fosters. After tea a walk in the gardens really finishes the event perfectly.

title: Birthday
comment: Fab venue Food excellent so tasty Wonderful cake selection and sandwiches really appetising  Service great  Grounds are beautiful and a very special place to spend a special occasion

title: A gorgeous setting for afternoon tea
comment: A wonderful place for afternoon tea at a historic hotel in wonderful gardens. A delightful experince for afternoon tea with a lovely selection of sandwiches and cakes and excellent scones. Reasonably priced compared with the equivalent in London hotels.

title: Excellent!
comment: I am pleased that it wasn't another polish restaurant which serves polish dishes (I call it common modern) where you get a huge portion of potatoes and many too sweet salads and most likely garlic sauce on the side. I'm praying that those times come to an end.  Absolutely amazing food, great service. Prices similar to good English pub or good Indian restaurant. Quality has a price!  What you get is modern polish cousine- sophisticated twist to traditional polish dishes.

title: Great place: recommended
comment: Went with whole family-8 of us-and ordered a variety of dishes. I ordered the pierogi as my starter, which were superb. Then had perch for main course, which was very tasty. Desert I chose (cheesecake) was a welcome finish. Very happy with the service, and judging by the reactions of family members, they were too.

title: Pierogi
comment: The pierogi here is great. I’d recommend the cheese and potato pierogi and the mushroom and red cabbage.  Being introduced to polish cuisine has opened me up to try more every time we visit here. The raspberry fruit tea afterwards is a must also!

title: Nice place and good food
comment: My first time at a Polish restaurant and my experience was great overall. The food was great, not so expensive for the quality of it. The staff is nice, and the restaurant looks really good and clean. Recommended for team lunches or dinners with friends.

title: Great Pork Knuckle
comment: Fantastic pork knuckle and really tasty Pierogi. Staff were friendly and there were good Czech beers available on draft. Patisserie next door looked great too!

title: Lunch menu was good but no longer serve
comment: Came to here for group lunch in 2016 when they provide lunch set menu. Food was delicious and good value.

title: Dinner with friends
comment: Lovely little restaurant friendly staff and delicious traditional polish food. Not a massive choice about 7/8 mains but a nIce selection of desserts.

title: Birthday Treat
comment: We enjoyed our afternoon tea which was a gift for my 80th birthday (last year) from my neighbours.the whole experience was wonderful, Daniel looked after us so well. The food was lovely a good selection of finger sandwiches not only with different fillings but also in different breads! Then the three tier cake stand arrived with warm delicious scones on the bottom layer,clotted cream and strawberry jam.The middle shelf had a small Victoria sponge and the top (to die for) a selection of very naughty cakes.All washed down with lots of tea not forgetting the champers to start.

title: Birthday treat
comment: We had afternoon tea here a few years ago for a wedding anniversary and were so impressed we decided to try it again for a birthday treat; we weren't disappointed! My family of 4 were well catered for and very well looked after. The food was delicious with a great selection of drinks; anything we couldn't eat was packed up in boxes to take home. There was a 2 hour sitting but we didn't feel rushed and enjoyed the wonderful surroundings followed by a walk around the lovely grounds.

title: Lovely afternoon tea
comment: I went with 3 friends and we had a lovely time. Immediately welcomed and shown to our table which was laid out nicely. Everything was explained and nothing was to much trouble. Excellent service from all staff. I chose the vegetarian afternoon tea which made a nice change to the normal afternoon teas I have had before and would recommend it.

title: Best afternoon tea ever
comment: In a wonderful Elizabethan building, this was a birthday celebration I won't forget. Elegant setting, attractive porcelain, tablecloth and napkins starched to within an inch of their lives, very solicitous and obliging catering staff brought the most delicious sandwiches, beautiful cakes and scones. An interesting range of teas and good coffees. Gardens were beautifully manicured and a delight to wander in.

title: Mixed fayre
comment: Stunning building - if you like period properties. Beautiful, well kept grounds. Reception staff a little over-attentive. Food waitering staff very good.  The tea (bottomless) was excellent and it's easy to request fresh pots (we consumed about 4!).  Sadly the food lets the experience down a bit. The sandwiches are okay. Nothing exceptional. The Scones were very good. The sponge cake was dull and the top tier desserts looked and tasted past their sell by date. Tables are somewhat close together - so beware of trying to share an intimate conversation. Not a terrible experience - but a few tweaks and this could be much better.  It's not currently good enough value at £66 (for 2) - although tourists might not care.

title: Good food just...
comment: Friday dinner with my friend (2 skinny women) we order some fish with staff recommendation. Food wasn’t bad just portion was to small for us and no salt or lemon. Little disappointed. Menu a pit poor. No choice. I’m not big fan or cream soup so leaving restaurant hungry. And price 23£ wasn’t brilliant as well. Staff very friendly

title: Great Xmas cookies
comment: Their lovely window display enticed me in to purchase some Xmas cookies which I am enjoying as I write this review. They are delicious and not expensive.

title: Polish cuisine - fine dining style, superb.
comment: We were in Ealing for a Polish festival (my wife is Polish) at which there were loads of Polish food stalls. Despite the Polish theme, the weather was decidedly English and we unfortunately chose not to eat at the festival. This meant, having been taunted with the sights and smells of Polish cuisine we were yearning to enjoy some.  Thankfully, we found Sowa. The design is ingenious as it's two businesses in one: A cafe and cake shop to the left hand premises and a restaurant in the right hand premises and the two are adjoined.  We were seated in a quiet corner, thankfully away from families and children.  What a wonderful surprise when our waitress happened to be a former member of staff at a sandwich shop near my work in Westminster! This was a funny twist but the fact I knew our waitress had an unexpected and positive impact on our dining experience.  My wife chose rabbit and I had my favourite Polish dish, golonka. I don't know what I was expecting, but I was fairly astonished at the fine dining appearance of my wife's rabbit dish - absolutely superb. I may have had my favourite dish, which was also very good but perhaps I was secretly jealous of my wife's dinner! She says that she remembers it to this day which reflects the standard of the dish.  We only had a main course so can't comment on the rest of the menu, but if it's anything like that rabbit dish, then the standard is high.  Another quirky twist about Sowa is that there's a babcia (Polish for grandmother) making pierogi (Polish dumplings) in a little kitchen area almost inside the restaurant. This is very showy and demonstrates how Sowa's pierogi are made on-site, by hand and not bought in. Impressive. You can probably tell, we highly recommend to others and are highly likely to return when next in Ealing.

title: Great place for an afternoon tea
comment: There were 10 of us looking for a place to have afternoon tea with snacks so we came across this restaurant which has its own bakery. All their cakes and desserts looked very appealing so we decided to go and the staff were very accommodating to give us all one long table. All the drinks we ordered were tasty specially their fresh juices and latte. Some of us chose desserts and they were tasty the only thing disappointing was the trio cheese cake all three variety tasted stale which I did not enjoy. However I would go back again to try some of their savoury food however they don’t seem to be catering Halal food.

title: Delightful in every way
comment: While visiting from Texas, my best friend took me for Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters. It was absolutely lovely. We had the pleasure of being assisted by Camello and Eric -- 2 positively charming young men from Columbia. They were quite attentive to our needs, making sure we wanted for nothing. So, for them alone, I would give a 5 Star rating. However, the experience did not end with them. We sat in a room with an amazing view of the gardens, laden with wisteria. So lovely.  We were very relaxed with a feeling that we had all of the time in the world to enjoy this experience (2 hours is provided, however should you need additional time you are welcome to walk the gardens, or move to another location to complete your tea). As for the actual tea selection -- we were pleased to see that it was a large menu, with many options to choose from -- including standard English teas, but also many exotic and lovely options.  The delicate presentation of the sandwiches was exactly what I imagined the perfect High Tea would have. A major added bonus is the gluten free option. We specifically selected Great Fosters for this reason. My friend was pleasantly surprised at how wonderful all of the GF items tasted. I had the standard tea sandwiches and also found them quite tasty. And then they came around with a tray of sandwiches (both GF and regular) so that we could have more sandwiches! Excellent! We needed to save room for dessert, so we only indulged in a bit more -- but it was really nice that the option was there to have additional. This, as I understand it, is not always the case in other places.  Oh, I mustn't forget my first Pimm's experience. We ordered a Cider and a Pimm's to accompany our Tea. Pimm's is an English drink (somewhat similar to a sangria, but not with wine). Very good. I'm actually going to bring a bottle of Pimm's back home with me so I can recreate this experience! Delish! Lastly, the towers of desserts arrived. They prepared individual towers for us -- my friend had the GF selections. Again, the presentation was delightful. Each tower had scones, Victoria Sponge, and assorted other pastries (that looked like artwork). Not only did they look beautiful, but they tasted amazing!!! By now, we were full (or fat and happy as we would say back home). We strolled for a bit in the garden, where we spotted several geese and goslings, and then made our way out to the front of the hotel. Both Camello and Eric came to wish us farewell -- the excellent hospitality continuing until the very end of our adventure. I have not a single complaint to share, other than I can't go here all of the time. This was my first experience having High Tea. I can't imagine wanting to experience it anywhere else when this met and exceeded my every expectation. I would not only highly recommend the Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters, but I will be sure to come back the very next time I have the pleasure of being in England. So, if you get the chance, go! If you're lucky, Eric and Camello will be there!

title: Celebrating our 20th Wedding Anniversary
comment: Delightful experience.Delicious sandwiches,superb cakes and pastries. Gorgeous outside setting.Excellent,attentive service from Rob. We were married here 20 years ago-great then,greater now. Thank you Great Fosters.

title: Another fabulous afternoon tea
comment: Our third visit and another fabulous afternoon tea. Lovely sandwiches scones and cakes. Really helpful and friendly staff. Beautiful gardens to walk round afterwards.

title: Make an afternoon of it!
comment: Great Fosters do an excellent afternoon tea so don't rush it. A good selection of sandwiches, which seem to keep on coming, followed by cakes which demonstrate their chef's creative skills. Victoria sponge and 2 scones (jam and clotted cream) per person complete the food offerings. This is not the cheapest afternoon tea on offer but combined with a large selection of choice teas plus the option of adding some 'fizz', it makes for a very enjoyable experience. Just don't be on a diet!

title: Superb place to bring clients
comment: My wife and I were entertaining a client who is very food orientated. We decided to bring him here as it is a smart restaurant offering a very varied menu of very high quality food. He was very impressed by the pike perch and we went for the lamb filled pierogi as starters followed by beef and venison. The quality of the meat was lovely and the portions very good. The vegetables were a little too al dente for me but everything else was lovely. I chose the raspberry roulade for dessert which was amazing - something different and not to heavy or sweet, the others went for cake from the patisserie counter. The picpoul de pinet was very nice wine and not pricey. For 3 courses, a drink, water and coffee the bill came to a reaonable £35 a head including service which was formal and attentive.

title: Disappointing
comment: Great Fosters is set in the most beautiful grounds so to be crammed against a wall not being able to put your feet under the table was quite disappointing. The service was good and staff were attentive but we were served jam and clotted cream on a chipped plate and tea in silver tea pot which had not been polished which was also disappointing. I would expect this establishment to pay more attention to detail. The cakes and scones were good but not good enough for a return visit. I wouldn't recommend.

title: Delicious Polish food, cakes and staff
comment: I love good food and can cook many nice dishes by myself, but Sowa is really worth all the frequent visits I pay and it's by far my favourite restaurant in the whole Ealing area. The variety and home made quality of their cakes was the thing who attracted me first, with their szarlotka (apple pie) being my favourite one. Quality of food is nothing less. Their dishes really taste like excellent homemade traditional dishes: delicious goat cheese salad, home made pierogie (kind of Polish dumplings/ravioli) and their baked kaczka (duck), just to mention my favourite ones. Speaking of home made pierogie, when you go there at evenings you will be able to witness the sweet but strong lady hand making pierogie just in front of customers. You can't really get anything more fresh and home made than that, aside from your own grandmother (maybe...). All of that happening in a restaurant which compared to many other places around is very elegant, very nicely decorated but sober and warm at the same time. As a last thing, but not the least, their staff is the perfect balance of professionalism, manners and fun. Mister Jakub is always fun trying to teach me how to order in Polish and miss Klaudia is always so friendly and humorous. They all give you positive mood and an excellent service. I'm always happy to be back there!!!

title: Polish lunch
comment: We have had the set lunch menu, starting with nice, hot cabbage soup. After that I have had pierogi, boiled dumplings stuffed with cabbage, mince meat and cheese and my friend nice presented pork (two pieces of rolled pork steak stuffed with potatoes?) with some vegetables.  The food seems fresh made, perhaps a little too salty. The free fruit juice was undrinkable. The alternative, hot hot water and two slides of lemons was much better!

title: Very good
comment: Amazing cake and coffee, as well as traditional polish dishes. I will definitely come back If you like pierogi and dumplings or were thinking about trying it, this the place to go. Also they do a variety of main meals and good puddings, plus polish beer.

title: Friends birthday afternoon tea
comment: We went on Monday 22nd May which was a glorious day. We sat outside by water. Food was excellent and we had a wonderful afternoon.

title: Mum's birthday treat!
comment: Amazing surroundings and friendly staff! Cakes and scones were delicious, each morsel was highly enjoyed. Sandwiches were OK, bit floppy but still a good selection and variety. Teas lovely and again poured in plenty. Staff took a long time in between serving sandwiches and pastries. Room was very warm; opening the window or switching on the AC would have been more pleasant.

title: A wonderful afternoon tea in beautiful, unique, historic, surroundings
comment: We invited our two Australian visitors to join us for a delicious afternoon tea at Great Fosters. The Tudor hunting lodge and various gardens provide a stunning location. We sat by the moat in the gardens to enjoy our afternoon.  The staff were highly attentive and keen to make our visit as enjoyable as possible. To have access to the hunting lodge used by Queen Elizabeth I, with the Boleyn's Coat of Arms still visible gives the whole experience of afternoon tea something special. Will definitely come again.

title: Aftertoon tea - too much sugary items and not enough savoury!
comment: My partner was given a Bollinger rose voucher and we set off to have a lovely afternoon (I'd popped a bottle of bubbly in the fridge at home for our return and planned a romantic evening). We were given a warm welcome by the staff and had a lovely walk around the grounds. Then I am afraid it was downhill all the way. I want to be constructively critical as just a few things could have made this a 5 star occasion which unfortunately it wasn't. We and another couple were seated in the same room as a large group of people (more than a dozen with children in tow) so all intimacy was lost - couldn't they (or us and the other couple) have been put in a separate area ? (I noticed a couple arriving after us were led to a room leading off ours). My main issue was that apart from sandwiches everything else is just one big sugar fix. It would have been great if they had offered something savoury, pastries, mini quiches, vol au vents etc. in place of all of the rich cream and sweetness. There was nothing wrong with the cakes themselves just too much emphasis on sweet things and insufficient imagination given to those with savoury tastes. I was not alone in wishing for something savoury as I heard someone from the big crowd saying he would have likes some cheese. I only ate about half of the sweet things on offer but started to feel really physically sick. I didn't say anything to my partner but when he got in the car he said he felt sick as well. Also it would have been nice if the staff had asked if we wanted fresh tea - basically one large pot each was plonked down in front of us at the start and expected to last 2 hours. As I was feeling nauseated it would have been wonderful to have had the option of some peppermint tea - yes I know I could have asked but service is about anticipating needs. So sadly we doubt we will be returning and won't be buying an afternoon tea voucher for anyone. They packed up all of the remaining cakes beautifully for us to take home but as they were the last thing we wanted, we gave them to person who had bought the voucher who was disappointed too that we hadn't enjoyed ourselves. Needless to say the nausea put paid to the romantic evening and the bottle of bubbly remained in the fridge!

title: Anniversary afternoon tea
comment: This was a really wonderful experience the sandwiches were exquisite and could have had more if required. Great selection of teas and cakes were delicious and very dainty boxes to take home cakes which were not eaten. This was a gift for our anniversary and it it quite expensive but well worth it . We hope to return again in the future.

title: Lovely Cream Tea
comment: Went for a standard cream tea with my friend. We were immediately welcomed by a very charming waiter who took us to our table. The staff was very attentive. The sandwich selection was good and the pastry and cakes were delicious. We were offered further sandwiches and fresh tea. As we couldn't manage our scones, these were put in little box and they even found a little plastic pot to put some clotted cream and jam in for my friend! Thank you so much! I will return.

title: Tea for Two, Perfect
comment: Great Fosters, Sitting outside, sun shining, champagne arrives. Then attentive waiters ask which tea we prefer, finger sandwiches, then delicious cakes. After such a feast a walk around the exquisite gardens and of course after such a typical English tea the typical English Rose Garden completed the day.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: 4pm booking on a Saturday to celebrate 17 Years of marriage, my wife, 16 & 14 year old children and I. This place was highly recommended by a work colleague. On booking was asked if it was for a social occasion, which was nice(1) As it was a warm day so we arrived an hour early to have a wonder around the gardens, we were given a map on arrival and it took around 30 minutes, they were very enjoyable and well kept, though partly fenced off due to a wedding taking place (2) We were seated 15 mins early, very helpful as we were early and had a nice table by the moat. Order taken after 10 mins of waiting, then another 15 mins till sandwiches and tea arrived. That's ok as we were chatting.  Our daughter ordered the vegetarian sandwiches that failed to arrive, but we didn't notice as it all arrived on one plate, it was the vegetarian option being delivered separately to another table that made us realise, we mentioned it and it was soon sorted with a refill for the rest of us. Good sandwiches, very nice. Then the cakes arrived, awesome!! Although when asking if we could have another chocolate one we were told no, which is a shame as only one of each cake is supplied for two people. Disappointed daughter. Good choice of tea and the wife enjoyed her champagne, it's easy to complain on the small things but menu said hot chocolate with marshmallows, so moans of disappointment from my son when it turned up without any, we could see the staff were under pressure so just let it go, in the grand scale of things it's not life changing. So why a 4 and not a 5 marks (1) after making me think we were going to treated special, it was business as usual, I've had a message piped on a plate before and was half expecting something to make my wife remember the event, especially as I was asked. (2) The wedding, I'm guessing staff were diverted to the service of that and not us, other tables complained of waiting unreasonable times and if we were not so relaxed we may have done the same. The waiters were definitely under pressure and although they did try they were not very attentive. Having to pay a 12% tip for that level of service is not good, service charge should be based on level of service and not automatic, but that's not for here. Conclusion Food was exceptional but small portions for the price, £47 for a glass of champagne 2 rounds of sandwiches and a few cakes is not great value with the level of service we received, I'd be happy to pay that if I was made to feel special, but I wasn't. The grounds were enjoyable, we may go back but would make sure a function was not taking place at the same time. There is a lot of competition in this area for our custom and when paying Premium prices we should get premium service.

title: Afternoon tea for 12 lovely ladies
comment: I am no stranger to Great Fosters and wanted to introduce my friends to its charm and lovely gardens . Booked afternoon tea which was in the Anne Boleyn room . The tea itself is one of the most reasonable that I have had . There was no problem with us ordering more and more of the sandwiches !! We had a super time and the staff were attentive and polite . We then moved outside and sat in the beautiful gardens until 7.30!! I must admit the bar bill had increased a lot by the time we left . Enjoyed the pink raspberry gin! We went there as our girls are all leaving school and we have been friends for many years . It was perfect !

title: Delicious Afternoon Tea in a Stunning Location
comment: I'll get the negative bits out the way first. You only get a two hour booking slot for your afternoon tea, which on our last visit at Christmas we found to be just about right, but unfortunately due to traffic, some of our party were a little late getting there. We all understood that the time constraints were still the same and were happy to hurry up a little bit, but unfortunately I think every other table in the room had the same issue. What this caused was for the service to end up being slower than normal as the staff rushed around trying to keep everything timely, and actually having the opposite effect. We didn't get our cake stands until 15 minutes before we were due to leave, despite being ready to receive them quite a bit earlier. We asked for the bill at the exact point that our booking was due to end. Our poor waitress appeared to have the manager from hell (blonde gentleman) trying to get her to hurry things along and she looked like she was nearly in tears as she took our money. I felt absolutely terrible for her, as the situation she was in was absolutely not her fault.  On the bright side, the food was exquisite as usual. The location is just absolutely beautiful to sit and have a luxury afternoon tea and the grounds are well worth a stroll around afterwards. Everyone was happy with both vegetarian and the meat options, and we all got either a glass of Pimms or champers to go with the tea which really added to the whole experience. I would definitely come back again and recommend this venue for afternoon tea, but all parties should check traffic and allow a decent amount of time to arrive as your booking slot is not flexible!

title: Tea at Great Fosters
comment: We had tea at Great Fosters last Sunday to celebrate a close friends special birthday, they made the day a memorable day with a walk round the gardens before we sat to very enjoyable and truly scrumptious tea We will definitely be enjoying tea at Great Fosters again.

title: Quintessential English afternoon tea ☕️
comment: I made a booking for my mothers birthday and unfortunately on the day there was severe traffic so I rang up to let them know I was running late the lady said that time would be running from booking and that we lose that time. We eventually got there about 20minutes late and we were warmly greeted by the staff and taken to the Tudor room. We were introduced to Carmelo our waiter for the afternoon tea experience. He was an absolute gem and I even got to practice my Spanish! He had wonderful manners and had good conversation. We had jasmine tea and oolong tea ☕️ with our sandwiches and we were offered more -it was delightful. I then had a hot chocolate with marshmallows followed by a tier of cakes. We delved into scones which were lovely and fluffy served with clotted cream and a nice jam. We had the English breakfast tea. We felt like the cakes needed more of a variety with more flavour and colour. The other thing I noticed was the cakes were one of each. I really liked the chocolate tart but I had to share it! Other afternoon teas I have been to have given two of each cakes. Presentation of the cakes were pretty. Even though the lady said we would lose our time at the table we actually didn't feel rushed and had the full 2 hours so it worked out fine in the end. The ambiance of the room was nice and intimate so it was good for a special occasion and as a nice touch they gave a wonderful dish with a cake saying happy birthday. My mother throughly enjoyed that.  After our teas Carmelo packed our cakes up as we couldn't finish them all in one go and placed them somewhere safe while we went for a long walk in grounds. There was a wedding going on and the weather was fantastic. I recommend visiting the English gardens, the rose garden was splendid and the discovering the secret gardens,bee hives and lake.  All in all a great experience and I would visit there again in the future.

title: Amazing Place
comment: I have been here several times and thoroughly enjoyed each visit. The service is good the surroundings are beautiful and the food is delightful ! I took my friend here for her 80th Birthday and we both had a lovely time. The only thing that spoiled it a little for me was the expensive service charge that was added to an already expensive bill,I was paying for her treat so I didnt want to make a fuss,but i felt a little annoyed !

title: Really fabulous location.
comment: Went with our daughter as it was a Christmas present from our Grandson in Australia. As it was her son she decided to gatecrash. The reception and welcome was great as was the weather. Started with great choice of tea or coffee followed by great choice of sandwiches and more tea and coffee. Then a really great selection of cakes and warm scones with jam and cream. After being really stuffed the cakes which were left were given us in special boxes to take home. Fantastic day and would recommend to anyone.

title: Superb!
comment: We booked for a party of twelve work colleagues in the gardens. On the day we woke to forecasts of thunderstorms, despite it being June. However, in the early morning I received a phone call from Great Fosters offering an area indoors, which was a great relief.  We arrived with an unexpected extra guest, who was accommodated cheerfully, and were introduced to our waiter. We ordered from a wide selection of teas (coffee and soft drinks were also offered) and then a huge array of sandwiches arrived, followed by an incredibly beautiful variety of delicious cakes and hot scones, and many refills of tea. The generous selection of cakes proved too much for us, but we were delighted to be offered little boxes to take the remainder away - it would have been such a shame to see them go to waste. Thanks so much for a superb afternoon.

title: Excellent Polish restaurant.
comment: After a recent visit to Krakow I was starting to crave Polish dumplings so my friend and I decided to pay Sowa a visit in Ealing.  The staff are lovely. Really friendly and very proud of their heritage. They talk about Poland with pride and a smile on their faces. It’s a great place to visit to just get holiday advice and recommendations.  The menu is comprehensive and the food matches some of the best that I have tasted in Krakow. The dumplings are amazing. Very tasty and freshly prepared with mixed fillings.  We had the pork tenderloin and duck main courses. The presentation is great. Neither of us could fault the food.  Sowa also offers an on-site coffee & cake shop. The choice & quality of cakes is to die for. If you have a sweet tooth you’ll be in heaven. I had the peach cheesecake and it was so soft & moist. Really tasty! Sowa offers great value for money and the service is genuine, natural & friendly. I’ll definitely be back.

title: Eat here!!
comment: This place has the most amazing food and I wish I’d found it sooner! The dumplings are handmade on the counter by a Polish lady, the service was outstanding, and the food extremely tasty and well presented. The best meal I’ve had in months. I ate the pierogi for starter (pork, and potato pierogi were the best) and for main, I had the old polish beef roulade.

title: Fab cheesecake
comment: They sell many cakes in the patisserie by weight including several cheesecakes. Normally I don't like cheesecakes unless my wife makes them but these are very good and baked rather than set in a fridge. On this occasion I had a very large slice of Grandma's cheesecake at just £2.50 so very good value too.

title: Birthday party
comment: The best steak I have ever had  High recommend . Staff is very friendly and helpful  Huge selection of drinks.

title: The bakery is the bomb
comment: We did not eat at the restaurant but have gotten delicious pastries from the bakery. Be prepared to order. The staff is curt and ready to serve you. We are American and were unfamiliar with some items and asked questions. They sort of seemed annoyed with that. We will be back anyway.

title: St John's pie to die for
comment: My wife and I came in for a refreshing and delicately flavoured iced Earl Grey tea and chose to share a piece of the Stuff John's pie which is a mix of fruit, custard and crumble. It was light and not too sweet.

title: 👌
comment: Cosy, little place. Delicious food (our party had two types of fish, deer and pierogi - everyone was happy with their choice). Fast and attentive staff. Recommended!

title: Lovely find
comment: We stayed a couple of days in Ealing and just wandered through the town one afternoon looking for ideas for an evening meal. We walked past this restaurant and had a look at the menu outside, and thought it looked nice and a bit different. A quick check on reviews of it backed this up so we booked ourselves, and so glad we did. The staff are really friendly and the food was lovely. For desserts I went into the adjoining patisserie and was totally spoilt for choice. Great food, great service, nice venue. Would happily re-visit

title: Probably the best lunch in Ealing
comment: Best find in Ealing. Weekly lunch menus are excellent! Tasty and really nicely presented. Staff is very friendly. Prices are not high. I was never dissapointed. Highly recommended!

title: Worth every penny,
comment: Very good food and service.Worthwhile doing the bee keeping/honey tour very informative and good for children to get a bit closer to nature.

title: Amazing
comment: Amazing food worth every penny,great service I will be recomend this place to everyone.The best dessert which I ever had to be honest

title: Superb Polish Restaurant
comment: I prefer my perogi fried to boiled and the starter with beef cheek was excellent, the old style Polish beef roulade with dumplings and beetroot was even better - well done to everyone at Sowa for a lovely evening.

title: Beautiful Food
comment: I was interested in going to Sowa mainly because I've been to Poland a few times and loved the food. What a lovely restaurant, our waitress Ania was brilliant. I wasn't really sure what wine to have so Ania gave me a couple to taste, the red Portuguese was lovely. Everything about Sowa is so nice.

title: Favorite restaurant in Ealing
comment: I am from US working in UK for a few months and living in Ealing. My wife and I stumbled upon Sowa and it is a real jewel. The food is authentic Polish starting with the Beef Roulade which is fantastic. After that try everything else on the menu. Can't go wrong. Try the Pierogies as an appetizer which are hand made by a lady behind a window at the back of the restaurant.Whenever we have friends visit we take them there first. Already know some of the staff (all Polish) and they are very nice and friendly. Must try if you are anywhere near Ealing!

title: Great food, resalable price.
comment: Came at lunch time, having a very easy lunch menu offer. Authentic, tasty food and nice place. A little slow service, but after all our waitress was lovely and excellent.

title: OK, but....
comment: It is very difficult for me to write this review as I am Polish and really would like to support Polish business in UK, however... We arrived and we were welcomed by a rather nice waitress (she was nice until she realised that my partner was English). Sat down and ordered our drinks. My partners coke was fine, but my white wine was warm. We then started looking around the place and realised that they get 'brownie points' for the decor and the fact that the place was amazingly clean. My partner was given a menu in English which was a really nice touch. We then ordered our meals. I went for beef roulade and silesian dumplings. My partner ordered the pork knuckle. We had to wait forever for our food to arrive. When it finally came, it looked absolutely amazing but that's were it ended. I will start with the pork knuckle - all the dressing that came with it was fine, but the knuckle itself was pretty much fat and skin and very little meat - not what you would've been served in Poland. My partner never had that meal before and I was really excited for him, but I soon as I saw it I knew it wasn't going to be good. Now, my meal - the most disappointing meal I had in years. Let me make it clear - I am from Silesia - I grew up on that meal. I had it every Sunday for 20 years of my life. I cooked it myself hundreds of times. My gran eats it every Sunday for the last 80 years. I cook it at least once a month. I think I know what I'm talking about. What I got on my plate was some sort of a mistake. I had the silesian dumplings which were fried! Silesian dumplings fried? Serioulsy? Why on earth would you do that? They also tasted like they had an egg and plain flour in them. They are supposed be potatoes and potato's flour and boiled. That's it. They most definitely are not supposed be fried and covered in basil pesto (basil pesto in Silesia? Where?). You have destroyed the most iconic meal in Silesia. The roulade - that was not a traditional roulade. It was nice, but it was not the one you eat in Silesia. It was some weird piece of beef stuffed with more weirdness. I can't even describe it. Traditionally you eat this meal with red cabbage. I can forgive swapping the cabbage for beetroot, but where that sweetness came from? This is not supposed be sweet! Also, did your chef forgot what salt and pepper are? The food was hugely under seasoned and at times tasted of nothing. For someone that never tried Polish food, especially Silesian food it could be an ok meal, but for someone who knows it well it was a disaster. Please, avoid this place. Everything there is for show, but there is no taste in it all. Go to a small, scruffy looking cafe and it will blow you taste buds away. The food at Sowa restaurant is not worth the money or your time.

title: Lovely restaurant, food and servers
comment: Really excellent Polish restaurant with an interesting but traditional menu. The service was great with the lovely waitress patiently explaining the various dishes. A real gem that local people should support They should run a competition as to how many pierogi's does the lady in the glass kitchen make in a day!

title: Lovely place👍😘👍😘👍
comment: Very nice place, pleasant staff, amazing polish food for a great price. The botwinka soup and potato pancakes I had today were to die for, just like my mum's! Will definitely be back there! Keep up the good work!

title: Decent contemporary Polish cuisine in nice surroundings
comment: The food is well cooked and you can try both traditional dumplings (made by the lovely lady in the corner of the restaurant) and some more adventurous dishes. they have a bakery adjoining, which adds to the choice of desserts. Waiting staff are polite and efficient. We've been a couple of times already and will come back!

title: Sowa a traditional polish restaurant with tasty food, superb presentations and warm welcoming.
comment: My fiancee and I really value Sowa. We have been visiting it on several occasions. We had our first date in Sowa and we celebrated our anniversary here recently. It is a traditional polish restaurant with authentic polish food.They also serve gluten free options as my fiancee cannot eat anything with gluten. The service is excellent, very friendly and warm. Food does not let you down and the presentations are superb. I recommend pierogi, duck and the old polish beef roulade. I should also mention that during our last visit, we had an issue with one of the plates but they resolved it with great customer service, turning a negative impression in a very positive outcome. We will definitely go back and we recommend it to all our friends.

title: Fantastic restaurant giving rustic, polish food a fresh twist
comment: Visited Sowa last Wednesday evening. The restaurant had a great atmosphere. At first when we arrived the place was a little empty, which is to be expected on a weekday, but 30 min in and it was much busier. The food was lovely. 8/10. We shared and had the pork tenderloin and the wild boar pierogi & would recommend both dishes.  100% will be visiting again.

title: Great food
comment: We brought a friend here for a special meal. As usual the quality and presentation was outstanding. Every element of every dish was terrific although some of the vegetables with the venison were very al dente. The service was attentive and this is a lovely comfortable classy place.

title: Pricey
comment: As Polish I can say some of dishes are not the original ones,also portions seem to be more microscopic every time I went there.Prices are not.

title: Great Meal and Evening
comment: Lovely, delicious food and my Polish friend said it was authentic and modern. Portions were very generous and service was excellent! Really enjoyed the evening!

title: Amazing food
comment: Not only is the atmosphere nice, but the food is also good and well priced! Their pralines are to die for! One of my favourite restaurants in London!

title: Miss
comment: Excellent service, lovely selection of sandwiches and cakes, great surroundings inside and out value for money

title: A Birthday Tea
comment: My family treated me to a wonderful afternoon tea at Great Fosters to celebrate my birthday. We were welcomed warmly and seated on comfortable sofas ready for tea. The young and attentive staff were unobtrusive but extremely helpful and we were served with an excellent tea starting with a variety of gorgeous sandwiches followed by warm scones and jam and clotted cream plus a Victoria sponge and a inviting selection of small cakes. We also enjoyed an excellent glass of prosecco. Although we only had two hours we weren't rushed and when we finished we spent a happy hour wandering round the beautiful grounds and enjoying all the beauty of this grand hotel. I can't wait to return for a repeat experience.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: A typical "country style" hotel, lovely grounds and somewhat baronial hall and entrance. Afternoon tea was splendid beautifully served and thoroughly enjoyable. A real treat. Varied and nicely presented sandwiches scones jam and cream and cakes. Altogether a very pleasant afternoon.

title: OK - Not Great
comment: Positives: - Environment is clean, cosy and relaxing. Chairs are very comfortable. Neutrals - Food was okay, nothing great. We went for different pierogi dishes, mine was goose pierogi which was nothing special, I was tasting goose meat only, the sauce was helping for taste and I asked for more sauce. Took a bit of time they brought some sauce. my missus had cheese and mushroom pierogi and it was better than mine. Negatives: - Whilst the staff was very polite, they were not professional. For example the lady brought our bill with card machine which I didn’t have time to review the bill. Then she took the bill with herself!!  Will be back? probably not.

title: Perfect Afternoon Tea
comment: Unfortunately even though it was August it was not warm enough to sit in the garden, but the Estate Grill is a stunning room in which to partake of afternoon tea. An ample choice of crustless sandwiches followed by a tiered tray of cakes accompanied by fine tea made for a memorable afternoon.

title: Excellent
