comment: I visited this place twice and the food is phenomenal. I really recommend it and I will definitely visit again. Lovely wine list too.

title: Excellent Polish Sunday lunch
comment: Dear lady wife and I had lunched here once before and it was extremely good, so as my entire family were in London this weekend 6 of us booked for lunch. It's fantastic Polish traditional Polish food with terrific dumplings , great duck, wonderful soups, and mouthwatering wild boar, followed by the best of Polish deserts and cakes , coffee and flavoured vodka . Cannot recommend it highly enough .

title: Terrific Sunday lunch
comment: We have been twice. Traditional polish food on offer and everything has been delicious. The dumplings, or pierogi, are very filling so bear that in mind when ordering. You can choose your dessert from the adjoining cafe next door if you like. You can watch the dumplings and noodles being made too.

title: Best Little Pub In London
comment: Went to a funeral and went back to the pub after,nice spread good beer(Timothy Taylors) nice decor.what I must say is the toilets where amazing(clean). I'm in the trade and am passionate about the pubs not being run down,this is not the case with The Woodman the Landlord Steve and the staff make you so welcome. This is a must visit as ever time I go down south I'll bob in for a pint Thanks Steve and staff for a lovely day and hope to see you all again soon

title: Wonderful
comment: Echoing other reviews, we recently held my mum's wake in the private room at The Woodman and found the pub via TripAdvisor so feel compelled to reassure others in a similar position - this is the perfect pub for such a sad yet celebratory day. From the initial phone call to the end of the day, all the staff were kind, warm and attentive. Great touches (food, Prosecco, photos and music) and would recommend for this type of occasion or the other side of the pub for a regular drink/meal.

title: Wonderful Place.
comment: We booked the private room for a family funeral and we was very well looked after! Short walk from the crematorium, lovely outside area at the front, friendly staff, amazing food, tea and coffee they put on for us and their desserts were just mouth watering; very organised and didn't have to do a thing! They did it all for us! Would highly recommended as a pub or place to hire.

title: Personal touch plus Wow the flowers!
comment: We popped in for a mid-summer weekday lunchtime, early doors, hoping for a nice quiet lunch, and it was glorious. The floral display in the beer garden must have won prizes, it's unbelievable. The personal service, with two cooks bringing out the food and chatting, put the dining experience right up there to start with. The Ploughman's had a well-thought-out simplicity with a killer Stilton. The fish and chips starred a perfectly cooked piece of haddock in the lightest batter. Judging by what we had, I think the pub is trying to deliver absolutely top quality pub food in a compact way. I would imagine they have an incredible turnover in the summer, and also as the go to pub next to the crematorium. They had Timothy Taylor beer, which was great, but CAMRA would probably poopoo the pub because of the lack of real ales. Don't let this put you off though, Landlord is a fine pint, also the best bitter as a sessioner. If you are a gardener, you must check out the display. The fact that the fabulous Duck's Hill Garden Centre is half a mile away can hardly be a coincidence.

title: Exceptional Venue
comment: In May, we held my late father's after funeral gathering here. The staff were so helpful and couldn't do enough for us. The attendees were very impressed and we gave my dad a good send off. There was plenty of food, prosecco, tea/coffee and other drinks. My dad's favourite music played in the background and we were able to show photos from a memory card on their TV. Highly recommended as a venue for parties for any occasion. Great value.

title: Not impressed
comment: Ordered two ploughmans which took over twenty minutes to arrive.Cheese ploughmans had nice cheeses but that was it.A tiny pot of pickle and a few grapes along with two rolls.The Ham ploughmans had just a few slices of ham along with grapes etc.For the price ,would advise to try another dish off the menu or another pub

title: Thank You
comment: Today I said the final goodbye to my lovely Mum and the gathering afterwards was held at the Woodman. I can't praise this venue highly enough, from the use of a private room with a TV to show memorable photos to the delicious and plentiful food. All of our needs were taken care of by the friendly and helpful staff and their professionalism was second-to-none. A huge thank you goes to Steve and his dedicated team for helping to turn a sad occasion into an uplifting one. Highly recommended.

title: A Little Gem of a Pub with Service & Staff to Match!
comment: We recently held a post-funeral buffet for about 25 people for my dear Dad at The Woodman and wow! what a success it was! From the first contact phone call to Steve, he & his staff couldn't do enough to ensure this little gathering of family & friends went so very well indeed. The little function room is just perfect, warm and friendly, with the bar and photos above a treasure in themselves! The cloakroom facilities were beautiful too and in tip-top condition, a real treat in themselves! The staff were so efficient yet discreet and the food was beautifully presented, with dietary needs (gluten/wheat/dairy free) catered for, and so plentiful & tasty. It was the perfect place to say a final informal farewell to Dad and I know he would have loved it! Thank you to All at The Woodman especially Steve,Alison, Louise, Annette, Gemma & Paige and the others in the kitchen ... it was just ideal and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone looking to do the same - just book it and get in quick!

title: Brilliant Service
comment: Arranged a wake with the owner Steve to cater for what we thought would be 40-50 guests . On the day it was more like 90-100 people who turned up but nothing was too much trouble for Steve and his excellent staff - they quickly arranged to set out more food to cater for the additional unexpected numbers with no fuss. Fabulous comfortable pub with great traditional beers and unlimited tea and coffee. Can’t recommend this pub highly enough. Thanks again.

title: Thank you for looking after our family and friends
comment: We held a post-funeral gathering at The Woodman. Excellent service and attention to detail by all the staff. Good buffet selection and separate bar in a private function room. Highly recommended. Thank you!

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Visited several times over the last couple of years and I rated the afternoon tea the best I had ever had - so was very much looking forward to another visit. Booked a table outside to be told we were being seated inside due to the wasps, the staff kindly agreed to set us a table in the garden. Menu was explained in good detail with our orders taken promptly, the staff deciding to place the jam in a different container to prevent the wasps. The drinks arrived in a timely manner followed by the afternoon tea, the jam was served in its usual fashion which did attract a lot of wasps resulting in the jam needing to be replaced. We decided not to order any alcohol but the glasses were not taken away. The food quality was very good with decent size sandwiches, but no offer of any additional items. Waited 30 mins for a waiter to top our drinks up but no one appeared - I had to go inside myself to ask for more drinks. Some of the staff were delightful, others couldn’t care a less and it was weird we were served by so many different staff- there was no consistency which is possibly why we were forgotten about. It’s very unlike me not to leave tips, but unfortunately the staff did not deserve anything - considering the standard of Great Fosters this was some what disappointing. It’s good to see the Gardener still cares about his job !

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: Was a lovely day so we started sitting in the garden which is stunning. Unfortunately we moved inside due to wasps. Inside is a beautiful old building but it felt lacking in any atmosphere. We were seated in a side room and there was hardly anyone around anywhere. The staff are attentive and accommodating. The food was average for the cost. Some of the sandwich were soggy and others dried out quickly. The china etc was lacking in any quality for the environment or cost. It was ok but I wouldnt be rushing back there, unless it was for drinks in the garden.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: Celebrated our anniversary at this beautiful venue. Staff were polite and attentive, food was wonderful & there was a wonderful ambience. The only thing that let it down & let it down badly was the large group of impolite corporate men outside who blocked all entries to the bar & rooms & made it very uncomfortable trying to get through them. Gave up & went elsewhere for dinner.

title: Really disappointing afternoon tea
comment: We booked afternoon tea for my Moms birthday and it was a very disappointing experience and most definitely the worst service at afternoon tea that I've ever had. My sister booked dairy free for hers but they claimed to know nothing about it when we got there. Rather than sorting it out efficiently, they made a big fuss about it and said they couldn't do any sandwiches so she needed to order off the main sandwich menu! This whole thing took a lot of time so we were left with our afternoon tea for a good 30 mins while they sorted hers out. It made the whole thing really awkward for my sister who didn't want to make a fuss. I spoke to the manager who just kept repeating that they hadnt received the request for dairy free and so it wasnt their fault. Eventually he agreed to give my sister her afternoon tea free but then charged her for a sandwich! Apart from that, we waited ages to be offered any drinks and the service was overall very poor. I definitely won't be returning despite the hotel and gardens being beautiful.

title: Nice Experience
comment: Having stayed at the property before many years ago we booked a special package for D,B&B for my husbands Birthday & Our Anniversary. Knowing we were coming we were bought an Afternoon Tea for Two voucher as a gift. The service we received from the female staff member was great (sorry didn’t get her name) She was welcoming, explained the menu and chatty without being too intrusive. I’d read previous reviews and was a little concerned about a couple of things but must say the whole experience was lovely. We were asked if we wanted fresh plates between savoury and sweet, there was subtitle music playing in the rooms and my tea was replenished a number of times. We were also asked if we needed additional jam or cream. Knowing that we were staying in the hotel I was told that should I not wish to eat everything that a box could be provided and the cakes taken to my room.  Overall the cakes, scones and sandwiches were nice (I’d go with other reviews and say that a different bread is needed for the coronation chicken and whilst the cucumber swirl looks fancy it looks better than it tastes.) It was a very nice relaxing experience. Topped off my husband got an additional cake at the end wishing him a Happy Birthday. We finished off the experience with a stroll around the gardens to try and walk some of the calories off before dinner!

title: Oh dear! Mediocre Tea, Truly Great Service
comment: Like other Afternoon Tea reviewers here, we have a long and familiar history with GF.  Been coming here since I was a child. Indeed, it’s somewhere we’ve recommended to many and have often, over the years, taken transatlantic family and friends to visit, prior to the new ownership. Due to health problems, we haven’t visited GF for at least a year, and we were excited to see the changes that we’d read about. Whilst there’s absolutely no doubt money has been spent on renovations, whichever interior decorator Alexander Hotels appointed had no business taking on this brief, unless said hotel group specifically requested anodyne as the look they sought to achieve.  Indeed the revamp appears entirely designed to rip out the hotel’s heart and soul, and, instead instal a bland 4/5 star modern, sub Gulf, private hospital look.  Perhaps this works for the corporate, and the undoubtably lucrative local, nouveau riche, wedding market, but it does nothing for one of Henry VIII’s former hunting lodges, and a sense of occasion. The building must be colossally expensive to run, so perhaps who am I to criticise? Now to the Afternoon Tea..... We were served by the utterly charming, and faultlessly professional, Caspar, (who was assisted by lovely Eunice with tea replenishments).  He’s been at the hotel for the past 3 years and knows the hotel, and it’s guests, inside out. Nothing was too much trouble, and Caspar offered us clean plates and refills of tea, milk, cream without being asked. He single handedly made our afternoon, and stopped us feeling ripped off. What was poor, mean and unforgivable at £35 per head, (plus very deserved service charge), was the penny pinching of the actual afternoon tea, however.  Our tea stand comprised of 4 uninspired sandwiches, 2 warm scones, a small selection of very sweet, little cakes and a macaron. Never at any point we’re we offered a refill of anything on the cake stand! Hmm I’m certainly not the first person to mention this here on TripAdvisor during this past year. Whilst tea itself was perfectly decent, it didn’t represent good value in any way whatsoever. Price wise, GF compares very favourably to other local offerings, but contents wise, it most certainly doesn’t. It will be interesting in these steeply competitive times, to see how busy Afternoon Tea at Great Fosters continues to be.

title: afternoon tea
comment: Myself, my husband and mother just had after noon tea at Great fosters to celebrate our 5 year wedding anniversary. Returning for the 1st time in 3years it has changed quite a bit. still stunning. beautiful grounds.  unfortunatly the afternoon tea was rather dissapointing. I am dairy free and they offer a dairy free afternoon tea. it comprised of 2 salmon and caper finger sandwiches...very dry. unfortunatly it got worse. my only other sandwich on offer was 4 thinly sliced pieces of cucumber in white bread. nothing else. not even a slither of any type of spread. that was my offering. I'm dairy free, not vegetarian yet had no chicken offerings at all.  none of us were offered more sandwiches so my 2 sandwiches were my lot. the dairy free scones.hard and very cloggy. nice to have dairy free cream though and jam was lovely.  maybe my biggest disappointment was what most people look forward to the most. the cakes and deserts.  I could have cried. a tiny plain dry cake, some type of lemon jelly which was awful, a raspberry panacota type desert and a chocolate offering. truly terrible to be honest.  if that is the best they can offer dairy free guests I think they need to 're evaluate their thinking.  we were not offered top ups of water either. very sweetly we were presented with a happy anniversary plate written in chocolate with 2 macaroons for our anniversary. a lovely touch but unable to eat them due to my dairy free intolerance.  a big shame. I honestly think they can do better. especially now allergies and intolerances are common and there are many ingredients readily available to create wonderful things. maybe we will return for our 10 year anniversary and try again.

title: Really Enjoyed Our Tea
comment: This was a really lovely experience from start to finish. We were greeted on arrival by the manager. He gave us an overview of the history of the house. As we were early and the weather was nice we walked in the vast grounds. The garden is spectacular. We then went for our tea. As the weather was so nice we were offered the opportunity to eat in the garden by the edge of the water. The service was excellent and as was the food. A good selection of sandwiches, scones and cakes. A vast choice of tea and coffee. We sat for some time just enjoying the food and surroundings. There was no pressure. After tea we walked to the lake and visited the pigs. This was not just afternoon tea it was a charming experience in fantastic surroundings.

title: Needs to go back to the way it was
comment: I go to Great Fosters for the Afternoon Tea about 3 times a year. It’s always fantastic and has never disappointed my friends or family that I have taken there...until today. The menu has completely changed and you can tell they’ve made a lot of cutbacks, yet charge the same amount of money. Normally we would greedily stuff ourselves with their delicious beef sandwiches on onion bread, or smoked salmon and cream cheese. This time, we didn’t even want to finish the sandwiches in front of us, let alone ask for more. The smoked salmon and capers were revolting, the rest of the sandwiches were pretty tasteless. They used to give a lovely Victoria sponge or lemon drizzle cake, in addition to the delicious smaller cakes. They seem to have stopped that now. The smaller cakes weren’t very nice, we would normally take them home if we hadn’t finished but they were that bad that we didn’t.  The service wasn’t brilliant, whereas before the staff were very attentive. I used to always tell everyone how fantastic the afternoon tea was. It was always the best one I’d ever been to. Today, it was a very standard afternoon tea but for the price of a very good one. It is far from worth the money that that charge now. I’m not sure why they have made these changes, whoever has made them needs to change them back. Don’t try and fix things that aren’t broken! I will certainly be warning other people who love their original afternoon tea and I am so disappointed to say that I won’t be returning unless they revert back to their original standards. I’ve heard the Christopher Wren in Windsor is good, we’ll be trying there next time.

title: Amazing Polish food
comment: The food is very authentic, high quality and tasty. I absolutely loved it. The prices are reasonable and the portions are good. I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who would like to try Polish cuisine. I have already made another booking.

title: "Would recommend a visit"
comment: Took my partner and her mum to London for the day and booked a table in the evening here, they are from Poland and were very happy with the food, me too! I had brisket in broth was lovely. If your not polish and never eaten polish food I would recommend going, the staff were very friendly.

title: Fantastic Cakes
comment: Really really good cakes - much nicer than the usual shop bought ones and less artificial than other venues. Not a good place for a diet.

title: The best in town
comment: Went there following the reviews and we were not disappointed! Very nice and genuine food, fresh ingredients and good vodka. Beef tartare good, polish style soup amazing, goose pierogi amazing. Coming back very soon to taste the rest of the menu. 5 stars!!!

title: A wise decision...owl about that then!
comment: This review is for the newly opened Sutton branch of Sowa.  We came across this last week at the end of a stressful day shopping. It was almost closing time and they allowed us to come and sit to have a drink. Did not feel rushed. Today, a week later have come back for lunch. I had a very nice chicken bagel and hubbie had spinach quiche and salad. Both fresh and presentation of food very nice. The attention to delay is very good. This is a place I would recommend. It's a busy place and staff are efficient and friendly. We have had cafe from here and they are marvellous, tastes authentic. My friend is Polish and make cakes similar to these sold. Personal opinion this is far superior to Patisserie Valerie.

title: Unwelcoming and Rude
comment: We visited the cafe/restaurant for a nice dessert in Saturday afternoon. The staff were so ignorant and we were told that there isn't any table available.which was a bit too late because we'd ordered alreary. We were given a table in the restaurant but the staff were rude enough to roll their eyes and say that we can not sit as the table is reserved. We had to explain ourselves to 3 different staff who had unhappy faces wondering what we wanted there. They made us feel very uncomfortable and unwelcomed.

title: Great pastries
comment: We came in for a takeaway cake which is sold by weight. There is a large and varied choice to choose from. £2.50 will get you a generous slice enough for 2. Quality and freshness is excellent.

title: Shockingly poor manners!
comment: Came in for a coffee today with my friend turned out there was no place to sit, one of the ladies kindly asked if we could sit on the restaurant side even though we only wanted a coffee, we were told to take one of the tables once we were ready to sit another lady jumped into us saying we cannot sit here as it is reserved! I said that we have been told to take that table n can sit for one hour! I was told no u can’t sit here u can see it’s reserved and she started pointing to the reserved sign!! I said I can read that perfectly but we were told we can take this table ! After all we were placed at some other table and again another staff member said u can’t sit here only for coffee it is restaurant!!! I said we were told to sit here cos of lack of the space on the other side!! I would understand everything but the worst thing is all of those people got zero manners! Absolutely undermining tone of voice!!! Never been to place like that before! Place is nice but people spoil the whole atmosphere!! I only write this review cos it is not first time I have experienced such a lack of manners!! Need new staff!!!

title: Great food , shame about the slow service
comment: Visited Sowa after reading great reviews - made a special trip from the outskirts of London.  The food was very good and the presentation great which many polish restaurants are lacking. Unfortunately, the service is somewhat disappointing. Despite the restaurant not being very busy - getting a menu involved the unnecessary wait and then it was going even more painful - waiting for starters which finally arrived - then a massive gap and wait for a main.  After that, no one offered a dessert menu which I had to ask for.  From then on I gave up - tea and coffee arrived separately and the waiter forgot to deliver the desserts.  Good food, nice atmosphere - completely uninterested waiting staff.

title: After funeral refreshments
comment: Following the funeral at Breakspear Crematorium last Friday of my late father we had booked the facilities of the Woodman Pub close by for the wake. They supplied a Prosseco reception for the guests and a very good selection of buffet foods.  From the initial phone call to make enquiries to the actual day itself the staff could not have been more friendly, helpful and professional. Together with the lovely food, teas and coffees, a beautiful pub with great beers we all had a lovely afternoon. Thank you so much for your wonderful service.

title: Lovely friendly service
comment: We booked a wake here just off the reviews online and weren’t disappointed, they couldn’t have been more helpful with arrangements. Whole team was very welcoming and food and drinks were great.

title: Amazing food. Great service.
comment: Went here for lunch and could not be happier. All 7 of us had fish and chips with peas. This was recommended to us by the land lady. She boasted how good it was. I love it when someone is so sure of what they are doing and they are not only right but they nail it. Everything that was served to all us was perfect. Tartar sauce, clearly made on site was lovely. Peas were good quality and freshly cooked. They clearly had not been sitting in luke warm water like in some places. The chips were lovely. Skin left on, not greasy and they complimented the fish.  Now to the star of the show the fish. Great tasting, thin batter and again not greasy. Many pubs could learn from this one and when we are next in the area we will of course try something else.

title: Tea and Shrinkflation
comment: It is a couple of years since I have had afternoon tea at Great Fosters. It was one of the best around with superb sandwiches, a good range of teas, super scones and and delicious cakes. Add a wide tea menu and a few more sandwiches if you would like them, and it was worth traveling around the M25 for.  I did. Repeatedly. I knew GF had new owners and that the price of the tea had risen considerably, there was also a maximum time at table policy which I did not recall from previous visits. Still, based upon past teas I was looking forward to returning. GF is still a beautiful building in immaculate grounds and inside there had been some half hearted refurbishment with corporate chairs and new but somehow not quite right crockery.  The tea menu had been cut back with a reduced choice, no more Lapsang. But if the tea menu had been trimmed the food offering had been slashed. No more trays of sandwiches and plates of scones and cakes. A single stand per couple with a few, trying to be artful, but fundamentally low rent sandwiches, a couple of scones and mini cakes and macaron. The scones had also been on a diet but were warm and tasty and came with appropriately reduced portions of cream and jam. The cakes varied from quite good to sugar rush. Service was very friendly even after we declined the various upsells. On a sunny summers day the grounds might make the tea a worthwhile admission price but otherwise afternoon tea at GF is barely worth crossing the road for, let alone a few junctions worth of the M25

title: Family Wake
comment: The staff could not have been more helpful, compassionate and understanding and the food was really excellent - catering for diverse tastes, vegetarian particularly.  Nothing was too much trouble. Strongly recommended.

title: Afternoon Tea
comment: We really enjoyed our Afternoon tea today. The staff were fantastic and very attentive. The tea was lovely and the hot chocolate with marshmallows delicious. We were really looked after and offered more tea and hot chocolate. The sandwiches were enjoyable. Scones beautiful and little cakes also lovely.  Thank you for an enjoyable Afternoon tea. The hotel looks fab .

title: Disappointing Afternoon
comment: The staff were friendly and approachable. The sandwiches were not traditional afternoon tea - Coronation Chicken on a baguette and Egg on brioche. Jam and cream were served without spoons. However, the scones and pastries were delightful. Having been to Great Fosters on many occassions, we were disappointed with the standard and lack of tradition.

title: Great venue for afternoon tea
comment: Great Fosters is a big place with restaurants and accommodation but it also does a good job with more intimate events such as afternoon tea in the library. A very good selection of food and teas, served by attentive and friendly staff. Especially good in the winter, in the summer there is outdoor seating overlooking the well kept gardens.

title: Impressive afternoon tea
comment: Delicious afternoon tea in gorgeous setting, could not have been better looked after. Above and beyond - offered extras for our toddlers and were clear we could have refills if needed - but they weren’t! We took three boxes home between the 4 of us! Lovely atmosphere and furnishings - gorgeous hotel. Can’t understand some of the negative reviews from last year!

title: Great venue lovely afternoon
comment: Had a wonderful afternoon at Great Fosters great services lovely afternoon tea and fine champagne.  Lovely walk round the hotel, clean tidy, and friendly Staff

title: Amazing High Tea
comment: My friends took me here for a Spa Day and High Tea when I was visiting the UK. Amazing selection of food but we couldn't eat half of it. They boxed it up for us to take home so we shared it with other friends that evening.   A gorgeous old house that also has accommodation although we did not stay the night. Beautiful gardens to wander around and and the pool was nice to laze around before Tea.

title: Wonderful setting!
comment: Wonderful setting! Glorious old hunting lodge, steeped in history.  Sandwiches and a ones beautifully presented. Be sure to ore order if you have dietary requirements!  Lovely log fire!

title: Sowa- Sutton Surrey
comment: I took my grandmother for a hot drink and cake at the branch that has recently opened within the shopping centre. Staff were friendly, kind and helpful. My grandmother was impressed with the decor and cleanliness of the location. Keep up the good work!

title: Revisiting after a year and very disappointed with the experience
comment: Entrance area - I love how you have updated the entrance area and made it even more welcoming, classy and comfortable. Taking away the over the top floral displays has really opened up the room. The afternoon tea - I have a number of complaints, which I did not want to address at the time (more later) We were seated at 1pm - we assume we were meant to sit in the 5 seats as there was no one there to show us. I had been offered to go through when I arrived as just me, but wanted for all 5 of us to go through together. Despite this, we didn't get our tea until 1.35. As in the beverages, not the sandwiches. I realise that you had a number of other afternoon teas on but they were served a lot quicker than us. (Were they guests of the hotel and therefore more valuable to you?) Agreed, one of my party made it tricky on the day by asking to be gluten free (in addition to myself) which no doubt caused panic in the kitchen.  When the teas arrived, I was given a tea holder (I don't know if there is a correct name for them) and it was pointed out "sandwiches - gluten free", "scones - gluten free" "macaron - gluten free etc". It felt really over the top and I did not rate the service of the girl who served them - Veronika perhaps? She had very very black mascara on. The teas arrived on individual tea holders. I have experienced this numerous times due to being gluten intolerant but it was actually very awkward on the table. Particularly due to the level at which they sat = eye level in your new lower down chairs. It meant conversation and celebration was around the edges of the tea and not flowing. Needless to say, I was further disappointed to only receive 3 finger sandwiches each. And no offers of replenishment. This has never happened to me before, even in the big London hotels (Soho, Dorchester Athenaeum). Funnily enough, the member of staff who was in the room then, managed to continually avoid our eye contact so never mind, a pregnant lady had just three sandwiches. It felt very mean. Previously, the service has been impeccable and we have been offered refills or more tea and water throughout - this did not happen, so I was only able to enjoy two cups of tea. The scones were lovely, however your staff presented the afternoon tea cages facing away from my friends so they were unable to see the spoons for the cream and jam. Small things, but when you are paying £37 a head for a non alcoholic afternoon tea with only three finger sandwiches, it counts.  Moving on to the cakes. They were very small,intricate and overly sweet whilst not really tasting of anything. In fact, our pregnant lady didn't touch them despite only having three finger sandwiches.  We were permitted to sit at the table for longer than the allotted two hours, which we were thankful for - but perhaps also because of your delay in bringing out our beverages which would have a knock on effect for the rest of service. It did take us three requests to get the bill though, which was a bit frustrating as there was only one other couple dining at the time.

title: Great as always
comment: Food was fab as usual, fun crew working there makes it so much better an experience. We had steak tartare, a must, and then pierogi, beef roulade, duck, another must, and different soups. All was yummy though the beetroot soup could have been richer, came a bit flat. But overall, great and will be back this weekend again!

title: Delicious Food and friendly staff
comment: I regularly have lunch in this restaurant. The food is delicious! Cosy restaurant. Friendly staff, especially supervisor - Klaudia- welcoming and professional always ready to advise on types of food; Fantastic customer service! Thank you

title: Not as good
comment: Not as good as previously I’m afraid. Firstly we were sat right out in the sun on one of the hottest days. Luckily we were moved to a table with an umbrella.  When we made our booking, we made a few simple requests like plain scones, no mustard etc. They hadn’t taken that into account, so we had to return it. Was all sorted though and staff were very pleasant. Didn’t get that many sandwiches though as they used to bring round seconds. Also cakes very small. Although we enjoyed it, it is quite expensive for what you get. We usually get leftovers boxed up, but we ate it all and I’m not a big eater.  So, we probably won’t be returning.

title: Good quality patisseries!!
comment: Having dined at a nearby eatery and not having a dessert, therefore one required a dessert and Sowa Patisserie was right on your doorstep. I purchased a chocolate slice for a family member, along with an apple pie and berry pie (have forgotten the name) – both being very good. The apple pie had plentiful apple filling which was tart, this was the same with the berry pie. Could not really fault them. I have had produce from this patisserie before and found them to be good.

title: Awful
comment: This wins the price for the least interested, aloof. dismissive staff in the universe. Coffee is weak, the food is average, half the premises are closed and reviewing this over a year the place has gone downhill

title: Disappointed Regular
comment: Firstly I think its important to highlight that we visit GF every year in Summer for our Afternoon Tea in the sun. We have a Gluten Free Daughter and a lactose free son and have always been blown away by the food. This time we chose to take our friends during the Eat our Help out scheme and have just returned a little shocked.  Very disappointed that the hotel was exceedingly busy (which is a good thing for them) but the afternoon tea was a long way from previous years. The Sandwiches were very plain, the scones were tiny and the cakes we overall below standard. We were so upset having taken friends and telling them how good it was going to be.  Overall the staff tried really hard and in 32 Degree heat did incredibly well but they were just short staffed. I have to thank them for at least making the effort. Casper took our problems but asked us to write a review again (I have written previously a glowing review). I want to understand that if eat out help out is causing this and intended to improve the number of customers this won't work. When we asked for more sandwiches the staff said she would ask her manager, never to return. The total experience was around 3 1/2 hours long and I don't know why they took so long,  But overall the food quality was not acceptable.  I will struggle to be back next year unless I am fully convinced this was temporary and will be removing my recommendation from Coeliac Berkshire website until this is improved.  lets hope this was a one off but please be careful of previous photos things are not the same.

title: Sadly it's not as good as it use to be.
comment: I can see from the other reviews that my experience was similar.  I come every year to Great Fosters to treat myself and my mum to a gorgeous Afternoon Tea so am a keen 8 year regular.  What you can't fault is its amazing building, attentive staff and gorgeous grands. This has always made Great Fosters a beautiful location for dinners and weddings.  HOWEVER, the afternoon tea has very much gone down hill. They have kept the price of £35-45 per person but cut the portion sizes dramatically. You use to get: sandwiches on multiple types of bread, fresh scones, a Victorian sponge cake and desserts.  You now get basic sandwiches, TINY scones, and miniature desserts. They have dramatically cut the portion sizes, cut the creative flavours but kept the price.  This is such a shame as so many regulars will be highly disappointed and not want to come again and pay these high prices that they were willing to pay before.

title: Abismal service, ok food, beautiful setting
comment: We had Afternoon tea in the beautiful gardens at great fosters, Egham. £35 pp usually but using eat out to help out was £25pp However even with this discount this was not worth the money!. Sandwiches were fine but it’s not hard to make ham and mustard, cream cheese and cucumber, egg mayo and salmon fillings!. You get 2 scones each but they were small and very dry thank goodness for the jam and the “clotted” cream with a bizarre texture but at least it made them relatively edible. And finally the cakes... they were just ok, mum liked the eclair so I let her have both as I found the others a bit bland and had given up by then. However the food was not the worst thing... The service was abismal!!! We asked the waitress who brought our food out for some more tea and water and that we were waiting for a cocktail which she said she would go and get, after waiting a further 10minutes in the baking hot sun for them I went in to complain and they finally arrived. But I then had to do the same with the bill!!. You can use the app to “request a waiter” or “request the bill” however these functions are either not working or they were just ignoring the request!!! I suspect the latter. We were comped our drinks due to me complaining about the wait for them. Food 4/10 Service 0/10 Setting 9/10

title: An Afternoon tea
comment: We had an afternoon tea which was 25 pounds each as 10 pounds were taken off for the eat out to help,The tea was extremely poor compared to what we had there five years ago ,I took photos five years ago & now see the difference ,They charged 8.75 tip which as my wife paid as i went to the toilet ,But i didnt realize until i got home they did a 12.5 charge on the 70 pounds not the 50 which we paid,I rang them no responce ,Then i e- mailed them still no responce ,The cakes were extremely small also last time we went we asked for more sandwiches which we got ,But this time they said we would have to pay for them ,I certainly wont be going back there again ,There not the slightest bit interested in customer relations only ripping you off ,I have put some photos on from last time & this time see the difference .The setting was nice but thats it ,We were outside then it started raining we went inside but no more water was bought ,So we ended up with none , Also as it was my Birthday my daughter rang then up in the morning to ask them to say Happy Birthday to me sadly that never happened .The thing with the 12.5% charge you dont have to pay it,We should have cancelled it . Even the scones were a lot smaller than five years ago .

title: Birthday tea time - perfect
comment: After reading the reviews here, I was a bit concerned about what to expect. I booked a tea time for my wife's birthday. We were sat in a private room, the study I do believe, which was beautiful and ideal for our group.  It was less 'proper' than perhaps a formal tea, but we found the experience perfect and memorable. Casper serviced the table with care and we quite enjoyed the conversation and his insight on the tea, scones and clotted cream. The finger foods were outstanding and I would not hesitate to highly recommend this beautiful hotel for a comfortable tea with beyond-expectation sweets and savories.  Thank you Great Fosters(and Casper)for helping create an ideal and memorable birthday.

title: Dog friendly pub
comment: Popped in for lunch, lovely tasty food. Dog friendly, dogs are allowed in the pub. Pleasant outside area too.

title: Perfect venue
comment: We hosted my dear dads wake at the Woodman pub last week, it’s just five minutes from Breakspear Crematorium. Louise & her team we’re wonderful, they helped us plan everything from start to finish & took away the worry of planning the event ourselves at such a difficult time.  The whole afternoon went like clockwork, plenty of food to go around our 55 guests & the service was excellent.

title: Charity quiz night
comment: A lovely, charming country pub with a really hearty welcome from a great landlord and bar team, our charity music bingo night spent there was a great intro for me, to a new venue - will definitely be back

title: They go the extra mile
comment: We had my dads wake there in January and they went above and beyond to help, but to be honest it was a painful time and I forgot to give a review. Went back today on what would've been his 88th birthday and had lunch - the fish platter! Really good, but that was just the tip of the iceberg. Gave my grandson an ice lolly, provided a bucket with water for flowers a family member had bought me, wanted to give me a chocolate ice cream when I had a sweet craving. I really cannot praise enough - thank you

title: Lunch time visit
comment: My partner and I went to the Woodman for a drink and snack after completing a walk in Ruislip woods. The food and drink were good. The pub had a friendly atmosphere.

title: lovely staff welcoming
comment: we take our dog to the woodmanand the staff so friendly and lovely. i hifhly recomend this pub. They are lovely to the dogs as well having water and treats

title: A little gem of a pub!
comment: My friend and I went to the Woodman after reading a couple of reviews and reading about the stunning floral display at the front!  It is a little piece of floral heaven at the front with an outdoor seating area surrounded by wonderful bursts of rainbows of colours and a vine covered pergola with about six clean wooden tables and benches.   On going through the lovely warm wood doors there is a tiled little hall before a choice of doors. We went through into the lounge bar and what a joy! The greeting from the two ladies serving was so warm and even though they'd never met us before, we felt like returning friends! We then met the landlord who was so charming and he told us that they wanted it to be a community hub sort of pub, so for that reason they serve food during the day but not at night and they don't do a roast at the weekend, that sort of thing.The bar was lovely and clean, fantastic atmosphere with no ranting dukebox throwing out it's music so loudly that guest can't hear themselves talk let alone think!!! They did have screen but it wasn't on, the landlord said that they did have a jukebox in the other bar but this one was kept as the more refined one. The colours of the decor are rich and luxuriant with honey coloured wood and white painted ceiling with red Wallpaper!   We were given menus and took time the chose what we going to select from the we were going to have for lunch. There was a cottage pie with creamy mash and vegetables and the most awesome chicken ceaser salad and a lovely bowl of fries! The fish and chips looked excellent but we'll try those the next time and believe me, there definitely will be another time as with the fabulous food around whichthe lovely freshly made food, you'd be a fool to miss out on a true dinning experience. The Toilets were so clean and I Felt quite able to take other medications there! We wanted to say a big thank you to all concerned for a most enjoyable dining experience. From Ke’ala

title: Funeral
comment: The Woodman was the perfect venue to give our dear Mum a wonderful send off. We had a private room with its own bar and the food provided was excellent . There was a good variety of sandwiches and a superb buffet for our guests. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly and we would highly recommend this pub and restaurant.

title: Home-cooked food at reasonable prices
comment: Went with my elderly Mum and friend. Extremely friendly and welcoming. Great to get home cooked food amongst the many chain pubs locally. Very tasty food and warm atmosphere.

title: Afterdoom Tea...an honest review.
comment: My wife and I have visited the once Great Fosters Hotel numerous times chiefly for their afternoon tea. Having not been for a while we decided to go on a quiet Tuesday afternoon and my goodness... Firstly, after we were seated, there was a great deal of confusion over a QR code which we were told to scan. When we were eventually provided one we were told to scan it but put in a different table number - this didn't work. Upon a different waitress arriving at the table to take our order (despite having no menus), she then told us we needn't bother with the QR code. We were then provided with the menus and what a difference compared to visits gone by. Very limited tea options. We proceeded to order - one normal tea, one vegetarian, an English breakfast and a black coffee. We waited a little while and a third, different member of staff attended our table for reasons unknown. He was pleasant and named Casper. We informed him of our veggie order, just in case. He assured us it'll be taken care of... Our food and drink arrived and we were greeted by two normal afternoon teas and our beverages - no veggie options in sight. We flagged down a member of staff and informed them of their faux pas. An apology was received and some veggie sandwiches promptly arrived. Now for the food... I'm not exaggerating when I say that a 7 year old could have knocked up the majority of what was offered albeit slicing cucumber that thinly must require surgical precision. Very bland, very uninspiring. Cucumber and cream cheese, egg mayo, salmon and PLAIN ham. The veggie options were PLAIN chutney, cucumber and cream cheese, coleslaw and egg mayo. I mean, c'mon. It was as mundane as it gets. The scones were microscopic and we asked for additional cream and jam in order to feel as though we got our moneys worth (which I'll come on to). I have no idea how you'd make scones that small. Finally the cakes sort of saved the day. They were easily the best part but in no way compensated for the rest. I suppose we should end on cost. Had it not been for the Eat Out to Help Out initiative, our tea would have cost us £70 before service which is a 12.5% standard. That's £78.75. Let that sink in. Excluding drinks, that's almost £4 per item on the plate. £4 for a chutney filled finger sandwich... In the end, we found the whole thing hilariously bad. We had a good time laughing at the car crash and the cost saving made it bearable but please avoid if you don't share our sense of humour...

title: Terrible service, poor quality food
comment: Having booked for 4pm we were not served till nearly 2 hours later. We had finished the pots of tea before any food arrived. We had to ask for refills as they were not offered unprompted. The sandwiches had obviously been made a long time previously, sparse filling and dry. The scones were small and rock hard, they should not have been allowed out of the kitchen as they were more like a biscuit. The cakes were good though. No extra sandwiches or other food items were offered. It was the first afternoon tea I have come away from without a doggy bag.

title: Delightful Sunday Lunch
comment: The Sunday lunch was delightful. The meats were cooked perfectly and the red cabbage was the surprise of the dish, with its beautiful balsamic taste. The service was both enjoyable, with light hearted banter around the cellar we dined amongst and impeccable in its execution. Was certainly a memorable afternoon and one we will be arranging again.

title: Idyllic place poor tea.
comment: Idyllic surroundings disappointing tea. It was an amazing day and sitting in the beautiful gardens was a joy. Service was ok but it would have been nice to have had new cups and saucers with a fresh pot of tea. Sandwiches were so disappointing the brioche with beef which my partner could not eat and wasn’t offered a similar replacement was good. The rest were poor supermarket white and brown bread when the local town has a great baker! Fillings were minuscule. My partner as a vegetarian was given two cheese and tomato sandwiches in white bread as an alternative. Scones were good. Pastries were ok but the lemon cake was dry. Unfortunately we will not be making a return visit.

title: Afternoon tea
comment: My family and I visited Great Fosters for afternoon tea, to celebrate my husbands grandmothers 95 birthday.  We requested when booking that we’d like the occasion to be extra special and we were not disappointed. We were given our own private room, the staff were all friendly and courteous. The afternoon tea was excellent, with a good selection of cakes and the finger sandwiches were fresh and tasty.  It was a very pleasant afternoon. Beautiful settings to celebrate any occasion.

title: Beautiful peeps!
comment: ManFred and Charlotte treated us to a splendid night with the upmost professional service and a passionate sense of humour! A real treat along with divine cuisine.

title: Really enjoyable
comment: The tartar is one of the best I’ve eaten. The goose is amazing and the wild boar stew is a must!! The dishes are really well presented and the care that is put into the food is obvious. The cakes follow the same quality level. And on top of that, really good service!

title: Generous and flavoursome pierogi
comment: The restaurant has lovely decor and atmosphere, one side is a restaurant whilst the other is an open bakery. I ordered the meat pierogi and they came as a generous portion size and filling. Flavoursome and good value for money.

title: The best Polish restaurant..!!
comment: You must visit ....!! Food is amazing.!! Staff is very friendly...!! Ask for anything and they will sort it for you with smile. Don’t wait... book table now !!!

title: We love this restaurant but
comment: We love this restaurant and went for lunch to support local establishments during Covid. The food was great BUT Sowa’s attention to keeping diners safe was extremely poor. Issues included  - no hand sanitiser on entering  - no temperature check or self declaration  - waitresses wearing masks under their chin - and worst of all, being seated less than 8 inches from the next table (I know, I should just have turned around and left) There were no screens and certainly no effort to follow social distancing guidance. It’s a real shame given the food is good, Ealing needs decent restaurants and the local pubs are being forced to spend £000’s on Covid precautions. Now I am home, I am pretty annoyed with myself for not causing a fuss. I’ll decide on Sunday whether to drop local trading standards a complaint since there has to be consistent rules for everyone. And Sowa appear to be breaching most of them. What a shame...

title: Never felt so discriminated against
comment: To put it bluntly they were very coarse when dealing with us and racist. Such backward minded people shouldn’t be working in a place like London where it is so multicultural.  I am from a mixed background and love learning about different cultures, food and traditions. It was my sisters birthday and with covid and everything that’s happening I thought it would be nice to get out of the house and try this nearby place. I was excited to try Sowa as it seemed really elegant and inviting.  However, to my dismay it was anything but welcoming. I was cut off mid sentence when making my order to someone who was stood behind me in the queue (was not even a customer as he left the shop after their conversation which lasted a good few minutes). I let it slide trying not to think too much of it. I asked the waitress kindly if she could assist me in letting me know which cakes did not contain alcohol- oh! But it seemed a pain for her, she looked a bit angry and had an expression on her face that said why are you doing here? I started asking myself that very question! But I continued my order and sat down to join my family.  We were the only ones there at first, soon after us it started getting busy. I noticed that everyone had been served (like 4 or 5 tables) but we hadn’t even been given our hot drinks yet. I looked around and instantly got another staff members attention. She asked me if I needed any help, I replied saying that it want help I needed, I just wanted to get served, questioned why it was taking so long when we were the only customers in the restaurant and so many tables have been served despite them arriving after us. The lady apologised and immediately went to go and see what was happening. So i thought great, shouldn’t be long now. How wrong was I! Instead of getting my order sorted she was serving new customers. Filled with disappointment and disgust at the lack of service we requested a refund as nothing had even been prepared for our table, even after making the remark that we had been waiting a very long time.  We left with a refund of course but no apology whatsoever from the staff.

title: Excellent takeaway meals
comment: I went into the patisserie for cakes and was told that the restaurant chefs had prepared takeaway boxes so I bought fried fish with sauteed potato and vegetables plus a lightly fried stuffed chicken breast served again with sauteed potato and unfortunately bacon which I don't eat so this had to be thrown away. I also got a coleslaw / saurkraut salad, tomato soup and sweet croissant for each main dish at a price of £10 per meal. The fish, chicken and salads were delicious. I haven't tried the soup / croissant yet.
